story:
What is Saturdays in Saxapahaw?

Saturdays in Saxapahaw is a free, independent music series and farmers market which takes place every Saturday between May and August, from 5-8pm in Saxapahaw, North Carolina. 

What is this campaign all about?

We've been running Saturdays in Saxapahaw for over a decade now, bringing excellence in music, food and art to residents in North Carolina. And oh how it has grown! This year as crowd size grew we needed more staff, signs and supplies and so we need to raise more than planned to cover the budget!  Your help gets us across the finish line!

All these years, we've relied on donations by passing a "Swan Bucket." However, 100% of those donations always go straight to the band; we need to raise funds to ensure that we can support everything and everyone else that makes Saturdays in Saxapahaw a unique experience.

What We Need 

Our goal is to raise $3,500. These funds will be used to:

Help cover the costs of our hard-working staff in the kids zone, our safety folks, sound technicians and market managers as well as help cover insurance, portapotties, signs, equipment and supplies!

The Impact

Saturdays in Saxapahaw provides a platform for excellent North Carolina musicians, high-quality artists, and farmers as well as craftspeople.  

Saturdays in Saxapahaw is a free, open-to-everyone, welcoming and non-discriminatory program where families from all over central North Carolina gather to relax, listen to great music and sample all that North Carolina has to offer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and share our campaign! Tweet, post and talk about it to your friends. If you've ever been to Saturdays in Saxapahaw, you know what a special program we've got here. Let's keep it going and keep it growing. Next summer will be the 15th year!!!

The Problem 

This type of prosthetic FX make up is expensive and takes a lot of time. 

The Solution 

I'm currently raising funding to have my FX team build a custom wearable version that will allow me to quickly transform into the character for things like the stage, red carpet events and television interviews.  This is just the begining... 

******CAMPAIGN UPDATE******

Now that we've reached our minimum goal to make the mask, were going to keep the fund raising going for the full 30 days as the extra donations will go toward creating campaign collateral and buying media space (like the billboard above) to continue to disseminate our scaly mission.

story:
The Calling's Dragon Age LARP

So, you've watched the video, and now on to the text! Well, welcome to the Indiegogo campaign for our brand new event in 2018, our Unofficial Dragon Age Live Action Role Play.

Imagine yourselves transported to the world of Thedas, as you arrive at one of our potential historical venues, be it the grandeur of a castle, or the charm of a chapel house. You will be supplied with a warm bed* and entry to the event, all that is left to worry about with your tickets is transport and food. Our happy and helpful staff will then induct all of the attendees to the event, run a couple of ice breakers and crash courses with one another, and then, once everything is set, time in will begin and you'll arrive in the story that wins the vote.

*subject to venue.

The event will be 18+ due to the game's original rating and the nature of it being a LARP event. 

Story 1

A Facade Game

[Ballroom/Social/Low Combat]

The civil war has created more unrest in Orlais than a poorly spread banquet, and the current Empress is taking more blows than dealing them as Gaspard still challenges her claim to the throne. But the concerns of the royalty mean only a little to their court, who see more frivolous scandals as matters needing serious dispute. You have been invited to the event of the year, be you human, elf, dwarf or even - scandalously - a qunari from the entire reach of Thedas, to come and share your voice on the current leadership in Orlais. Weapons must be left at the door, or dire consequences may befall you. 

Story 2

Andraste's Chosen

[Mystery/Social/No Combat]

It's before the very first age, in the city of Nevarra,  where the pressure between the northern territories of the Tevinter Imperium and the claimed lands of the Alimarri clans in the south is beginning to build to a breaking point. The source of the tension is the proclaimed leader of the Alimarri, and an ex-slave of the Imperium, Andraste. Choose a side as the two ends of the war convene to discuss talks of a peace treaty. Will you be able to survive such delicate talks? Or will you be pursuing your own agenda, no matter the cost? In this story of magic and war, things might not be as easy as they first seem.

Story 3

A Blighted Cause

[Survival/Mild-Horror/Low Combat]

Ostagar has fallen. The wardens have betrayed Fereldan once again, and no one is coming to save you. The village of Lothering sits, awaiting aid, as darkspawn approach. But as more and more people come seeking shelter and aid, will Lothering be able to help them? Or will you be more concerned with saving your own skin, and escaping the oncoming blight to live another day?

 

The Calling 2018 Larp Guide & Stream Workshops

We've prepared a helpful guide full of information on the stories and how the game will come to work. It's our aim that once everything has been decided we will be releasing a full PDF format guide to the LARP with extensive character creation advice. Those who donate enough will also get to have their own printed and bound version of the guide for the event, but whilst we're still waiting for your input here's our indiegogo guide;

(Click the picture to follow through)

Once the campaign is over we also intend to run livestream workshops for attendees to the event too. Helpful classes on creating a character for the game, how the rules and mechanisms will work as well as some information on costume and props as we come to make the Larp a reality.

And how does the game work exactly?

For those unfamiliar with LARP, it's a form of Role Play, similar in a sense to tabletop games like dungeons and dragons, and most rpg based systems. The difference? You're playing in real life! Where your actions account for anything that happens in game, and you act as your character as other players and the staff around you help to build a world or story where you are involved. You have to work as a team with your fellow players to emerge victorious - though there are often other players playing against you, so no one can ever predict how the game will end. 

Over the coming months we will be building our own independent system based around the story that you all vote for. We'll be filling you all in with updates as well as providing online seminars and group chats to help any new players come in to the game with an idea of how to play.

What Does the Campaign do?

We're aiming to raise the funds to run an event in the late summer/early autumn of 2018 and depending on the scale of the amount we raise, depends on the scale of the event we hold. So the fate of the experience is truly in your hands!


Our Goals

  • Top Goal - £4000

This will get us a full weekend of adventure. Your funds will be going towards the hire of a beautiful historical venue, with indoor accommodation included. We'll be fully dressing the set and reaching out for some great props to help tell the story and make it as immersive as possible. The players will also be given plenty of goodies that will help you along your journey!

  • Mid Goal - £2500

Whilst we might not be able to afford the grandeur of the top goal, we'll still be running a weekend long event. With arrival on Friday and departure on Sunday, you'll get 2 nights of magic. The down side to this lower goal? We will probably be working on a much smaller scale and venue.

  • Low Goal - £1000

£1k will buy us an extra day at our existing venue - YHA Beverley Friary - and will be running as an add on to The Calling's fan convention. So you will get to come a day earlier and experience what a larp with us might look like in the coming years.

What does the funds pay for?

The biggest portion of our funds goes towards venue hire, which we believe is the most important aspect to building the world of Thedas. We've worked with the YHA over the past 2 years at Beverley Friary to create a great base of operations for the yearly convention, but this year we would love to go bigger! In fact, we've got a couple of potential venues for you to see;

St Brivals Castle

Within Gloucestershire we could have our very own castle, all to ourselves. With large spacious dormitories set within the building and self catering facilities for anyone to bring food of their choice. (Though if we over-exceed even our top goal, we can provide all inclusive!)

This setting is perfect for our ideas. With the scale and grandeur to cover it all, you'll definitely enjoy escaping away to a location like this.

 

Wyldwood, Huntley Woods

Tucked away in the forests near Stoke-on-Trent is a piece of land known as Huntley wood. It's a venue that has supplied the backdrop for many LARPs already, and provides a location that's both immersive and secluded away from reality. The Wyldwood cabins contain their own heating, and we'll have plenty of bell tents available for anyone who wants to have the experience of being closer to nature. 

 

Beverley Friary

The flagship of our events thus-far. We have run 2 previous events at the Beverley Friary, and our guests have always left pleased with the experience they've had. Modernized but keeping it's historical charm, this is the most convenient to reach of all our venues, with a train station less than 3 minutes walk away. 

 

Besides that, The Calling runs 100% non-profit events, as the event is an UNOFFICIAL fan made event with no endorsement from Bioware or the creators of Dragon Age. We're simply a group of nerds who really want to make the experience real. So any and all funds that we raise above the venue hire will go into the event itself. We've got a lot to pay for after all! Decor, props, costumes, make up, special effects, and all the added goodies that we get to throw at you over the weekend. So everything you pay you get back tenfold.

How can I help?

Donate! Share! Comment and get generally hyped up! At the end of the day, the amount you help us to raise will determine what kind of event we run, and if we can make it all the way to our top tier goal before the end of the campaign we will be OVER THE MOON. Our lowest reward is set at £5, which for the mean time if that's all you can afford, at least you get a say in what the story will be for if any of our tickets are available after the campaign. But if you've got dragon age friends - TELL THEM. If we don't make the money we'll never be able to run this in the years to come, so even if you don't think it's achievable next year to attend show your support today and we can still be here in the future. Follow us on Facebook! Share our posts! Visit our website and send others our way! We're more than happy to talk to anyone who has questions too, so share the love! 

 

Disclaimer:

This event is run on a 100% not-for-profit basis, all money that's contributed on the event and spent in the purchase of tickets is put directly back into the event. Our intention is to create a fun event for fans alike of the series, and absolutely no one is making any money from the events. This is an unofficial fan-made event and has no official endorsement from Bioware or EA as of yet.

story:
*** STOP PRESS ***

As of 7pm this evening (2nd November 2017), this project was 100% funded to its original goal. At the same time, Phantom Power Films announced their intention to travel to Catalonia to interview people on the ground in the aftermath of their independence referendum. We believe that is an important project to support, so we pledged to swing the final 3 days of this crowdfunder - that is, monies donated past the original target - to this new emergency project.

Every penny of the money donated towards the original target of £3,410 will go towards Scotland's Choice, as originally described below.

Donations beyond this point (100% funded at 7.01pm 2nd November 2017) will be transferred to the Phantom Power Films project in Catalonia.

The reason for the small change is simply the fast-moving events in Catalonia which we believe will have a strong political bearing on indyref2. We opted to forward the "overflow" from this fundraiser (after the 100% target was met) to this new worthy project. This was purely to save time and avoid delays in getting a film crew out to Catalonia.

Any original funders who object to this, we will happily - and without question - refund their donations.  For further information or enquiries, please use the contact form on this website and we will respond as quickly as possible. Thank you.

*** UPDATE ENDS ***

We’ve come a long way since 2014. However you voted back then, or in the 2016 EU Referendum, the situation facing us today is completely different.

The UK is leaving the EU. The Brent oil price has halved. We have a shambolic ideologically-driven UK government seemingly hell-bent on ‘hard Brexit’. Trump is in the White House. The SNP lost its Holyrood majority (though crucially not its mandate). Catalonia has voted for independence - so far denied by an increasingly fascist Spanish state.

Some things haven’t changed. The newspapers are still full of politically-motivated drivel, and our state broadcaster only seems interested in mentioning Scotland if it plays badly for the SNP. The Tories are still pushing austerity and nonsense "economics", and the Scottish Labour party is having another leadership election.

 

After the 2014 indyref, I went looking for answers to the unanswered question that still burned in my mind; how could Scotland, one of the most resource-rich and intellectually gifted countries in the world, not afford to be independent? Why do the GERS figures just make no sense?

What I discovered on my journey was a far more complex story, a fabric of intertwined threads stretching back years and, in some cases, centuries, all bringing us to a nexus point in 2017. The story of how Scotland reached this point is incredibly rich, full of heroes and villains, high-powered politics and global economics. There are so many incredible pieces to the story, and they are being brought together now for the very first time.

Meticulously researched and referenced, Scotland’s Choice explains - in plain language with minimal jargon - the political and economic forces that brought us to an inevitable choice between Britain and Europe. It lays out the options before us, demystifies Brexit, and unearths the crucial evidence missing from the Scottish Government’s 2013 White Paper. Perhaps most importantly, it completely destroys the so-called “economic case” for the union with England.

 

What do we need?

Time and money - as always! The book itself is about three-quarters written in an unedited state. The key pieces of research are all in place, but I need access to some more specialised texts which, because of their complexity and the small audience for them, cost a bit of money (hence the crowdfunder!). I also need to bring in some experts to proof-read and cross-check my work. Again, mostly it’s time that is the crucial resource rather than money.

In terms of the money, I need to cover modest living expenses for 3 months – that’s £1,800. For the research materials I need a minimum of another £800 (I will beg, borrow and steal wherever possible for everything else). For outside expertise I’ve budgeted £500 – and again, I’ll be pulling in a lot of favours. Add on the 10% crowdfunding and PayPal/payment gateway fees brings us to a grand total of £3,410.

What you get

A whole new campaign resource! The complete book will be made freely available to everyone as a downloadable PDF. In addition, a website version – continually updated as future events unfold – will be published at the same time as the book. It will also contain PDF Factsheets on individual topics for easy A4 printing and distribution, plus high quality infographics suitable for sharing on social media.

Once the book is complete – and assuming demand justifies it – we will launch a bigger crowdfunder next year to get the book printed for free mass distribution (i.e tens of thousands of copies) via the National Yes Registry to individual Yes groups who can then distribute them to activists and voters in their area.

There are no donor “perks” for this fundraiser. The amount of money needed is comparatively small, and adding perks (such as limited edition print copies) just ramps up the costs significantly. We can do this on a pretty small budget now, and the mass-production can come later.

story:
March 14th-15th | Gainesville, FL | Free Admission | swampcon.org

SwampCon is a FREE, multigenre convention held in Gainesville, Florida on the UF campus. Our event is entirely student-organized and volunteer-run. This event has been a labor of love for almost a decade, and we can’t wait to show what we have in store! 

This year, we bring you SwampCon: HACKED, a cyberpunk thriller pitting the ominous MARSHCORP LLC against the plucky hacker Rebellion. Hearkening back to the movies and RPGs of old, and looking forward to the high-tech future, SwampCon 2020 will feature the time-honored struggle of man against machine.

SwampCon: HACKED will be held March 14th-15th, 2020 and run all day for both days. It will be hosted at the J. Wayne Reitz Student Union on the University of Florida campus.

As we approach the event, for the second year in a row we are pleased to offer admission to some of our exclusive events!

For nine years now, SwampCon has been entirely free to attend. Each year we grow in size and take on more roles, and as a result, we rely on more funding from sponsorships and donors like you! Because of the nature of our convention, we do not make any profit; none of our staff are salaried, and all the money we raise goes directly into funding this event. 

Contributions will go toward funding:

  • Our venue! Room rentals, equipment, and venue labor costs are all vital to keeping the convention running. This includes lighting and sound costs for out best events, like idolfest and the drag show.
  • Special guests! The more support you give, the more guests we can invite! This goes double for guests outside of Florida.
  • Printed materials! Having printed con guides, maps, schedules, and souvenir items helps make our con more accessible and fun.
  • Volunteer and performer perks! This includes things such as food and bottled water day-of.

Unfortunately, this year more than ever before, our budget is very tight. Due to changes in student government legislation, we have not received the same level of financial support from the university, and still have to pay the same fees to use their space. Last year, our venue alone cost over $8000, so every bit helps!

Our Premier Events fundraiser offers something you can't get anywhere else: tickets to our Exclusive Maid Cafe Experience, and private sessions in our official SwampCon Escape Room. On top of that, we're also offering another chance at VIP status and our SwampCon: HACKED MARSHCORP t-shirt. 



  • The Exclusive Maid Cafe Experience:     SwampCon Maid Cafe has teamed up with Idols A La Carte to give its donors a truly elegant experience. Donors will gain access to a private Maid Cafe Experience in the morning both Saturday and Sunday, as well as VIP seating at the public performances throughout the day. The Exclusive morning event has open seating for donors, but the VIP seating during the day will be assigned in advance by donor selection, as there is limited space at each public performance.

    At the performance you will receive light refreshments. Our Maid Cafe is always packed, so if you want to skip the line this perk is perfect for you! 

    EDIT: Idols A La Carte has provided us with their schedule! Here's the performer breakdown:

     


  • SwampCon: HACKED Escape Room RSVP:     The SwampCon escape room is returning, and this time, in addition to the general admission sessions, we're offering private escape room experiences through the Indiegogo! Each backer will be able to bring up to 7 of their friends and enjoy the 15-minute room escape all by themselves. Are you up for the challenge?
     


  • VIP Status:      You will be granted access to limited VIP seating at all of our main and special events including the Drag Show, Maid Cafe, and Special Guest Panels. You will also gain access to our VIP Lounge, which will have free food and drinks, and a quiet place to relax after hours of exploring SwampCon’s many attractions, hosted at the Reitz Union’s Matthews Suite. You will also gain access to our VIP chat, which you can use to contact volunteers for assistance during the convention.

    NOTE: Purchase of our VIP tier also includes access to our Exclusive Maid Cafe Experience. If you purchased VIP Status from a previous fundraiser and have not yet received an email regarding the Exclusive Maid Cafe Experience from our fundraising staff please email swampconfundraising@gmail.com.
     


  • Indiegogo Exclusive Rebellion T-Shirt: This is your last chance to grab our exclusive t-shirt design. The Rebellion T-Shirt will NOT be sold at the event, so if it's in your nature to resist the 'CORP act while you can!

SwampCon is organized by college students who devote their time and effort to making a free, enjoyable, and family-friendly convention. Each year we learn more about planning, how we can improve, and what you, the donors and attendees, love about SwampCon the most!

We make SwampCon for you, and it is your support that drives us forward and keeps us dedicated.

For any questions, comments, or concerns, please email:

swampconfundraising@gmail.com

story:
UniPro’s Multinational Forum for Pilipino Young Professionals, Students, and Youth, also known as UniPro Summit, is an annual conference to congregate Pilipino community leaders. The purpose of Summit is to provide a safe space for honest dialogue among young Pilipinos from throughout the world.

Who we are

Pilipino American Unity for Progress (UniPro) is a New York City-based 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with chapters in San Diego, Seattle and Chicago that envisions a unified and engaged Filipino America.  Founded in 2009, UniPro’s mission is to engage Filipino Americans through collaboration, advocacy and education. It seeks to transform Filipino students & young professionals into community leaders through its various programs, which incorporate professional development, history, and policy through the lens of the Filipino experience. The organization allows Filipino Americans the opportunity to explore their place in the community in the hope of owning their niche. Ultimately, UniPro asks Filipino Americans to critically answer, “How do you define Progress?”

story:
it - IL FESTIVAL 

Il Caorle Independent Film Festival, ormai giunto alla sua quarta edizione, è un evento culturale che si tiene annualmente nella splendida città di Caorle, la piccola Venezia, e porta per alcuni giorni la magia del cinema indipendente tra le vie di un paese in cui non ci sono sale cinematografiche.

Il festival nasce dalla volontà dell'Associazione Culturale Caorle Film di valorizzare proprio quella nicchia di artisti che creano e producono le loro opere senza l'aiuto di una grande casa di produzione e che difficilmente vengono distribuite nelle sale: il cinema indipendente.

Il nostro evento culturale è ormai un punto di incontro fisso tra videomaker, autori, artisti ed esperti di questo settore provenienti da tutto il mondo.

Il Caorle Independent Film Festival (CIFF) è strutturato in modo da porre sempre al primo posto tutti i partecipanti in gara in un ambiente festivaliero dal sapore internazionale,  costruendo occasioni di confronto e scambio culturale uniche, oltre all'assegnazione di premi e riconoscimenti attribuiti da una giuria di esperti.

Anche gli stessi visitatori, oltre a poter assistere gratuitamente a tutte le proiezioni, diventano parte integrante del festival partecipando attivamente alle attività collaterali del festival: incontri con gli autori, panels e conferenze in cui porre domande e curiosità, oltre ad assistere ogni sera a concerti gratuiti che si svolgono nei locali partner della cittadina.

en - THE FESTIVAL 

Now at its 4th edition, the Caorle Independent Film Festival is a cultural event held annually in the beautiful city of Caorle, the little Venice (Italy), and brings for a few days the magic of independent cinema in the streets of a town without cinemas.

The festival was born out of the desire of the Caorle Film Cultural Association to promote that very niche of artists who create and produce their works without the help of a major production company, and who are rarely distributed in cinemas: the independent cinema.

Our cultural event has become a regular meeting for video makers, authors, artists and experts in this field coming from all over the world.

The Caorle Independent Film Festival (CIFF) is structured so as to always put all participants in the first place within a festive atmosphere of international flair. This creates unique opportunities for comparison and cultural exchange, along with the assignment of prizes and awards conferred by a jury of experts.
The visitors are also given the opportunity to become an essential part of the festival: besides attending all the screenings for free, they actively participate in the festival's collateral activities, such as meetings with the authors, panels and conferences where they can ask questions and curiosities, as well as attending free concerts every evening in the town's partner venues.

 

it - IN CHE MODO PUOI AIUTARCI


Ogni anno, edizione dopo edizione, i costi di gestione e la difficoltà nel trovare sponsor aumentano proporzionalmente alla crescita del valore culturale dell'evento e dei suoi contenuti. I tempi sono maturi per la svolta, pertanto noi organizzatori abbiamo pensato di rivolgerci a te e chiederti un piccolo aiuto per fare davvero la differenza, permettendoci cosi di organizzare un'edizione che possa rimanere nel cuore di tutti.

Siamo ben consapevoli che l'emergenza covid-19 abbia trascinato con se una crisi economica senza precedenti, quindi anche una semplice condivisione e diventare un follower delle nostre pagine social può fare la differenza.

Se invece sceglierai di aiutarci attraverso un contributo, saremo felicissimi di ricompensarti con dei gadget e delle esperienze uniche del festival!

Anche con un piccolo gesto potrai davvero fare la differenza: aiuterai in prima linea la diffusione della cultura e dell'unicità del cinema indipendente, che troppo spesso non riesce ad essere valorizzato adeguatamente e ad avere il giusto spazio di espressione.

Grazie al tuo preziosissimo sostegno, moltissimi artisti dell'audiovisivo potranno vivere un'esperienza unica e indimenticabile, aiutandoli ad essere valorizzati come meritano e a ricevere i riconoscimenti che gli spettano. 

en - HOW YOU CAN HELP US

Every year, edition after edition, the running costs and the difficulty in finding sponsors increase proportionately to the growth of the cultural value of the event and its content. 


The time is ripe to make a change.

Therefore, we, the organizers, have decided to turn to you and ask for a little help to make a big difference, so that we can organize an edition that will remain in everyone's hearts.

We are fully aware that the covid-19 emergency has caused an unprecedented economic crisis. Thus, even sharing on social media and becoming a follower of our social pages can make a great difference.

However, if you choose to help us through a contribution, we will be very happy to reward you with unique festival gadgets and experiences!

Even with a small donation, you can really make a difference: you'll be helping to spread the culture and uniqueness of the independent cinema, which too often finds itself unable to be properly valued and to have the appropriate space for expression.

Thanks to your invaluable support, many audiovisual artists will be able to live a unique and unforgettable experience. You will help them to be valued as they are rightfully due and to receive the recognition they deserve. 

it - L'IMPATTO DEL TUO CONTRIBUTO

Il tuo supporto ci permetterà di: 

  • aggiornare le nostre tecnologie audiovisive;
  • far conoscere sempre più il Caorle Independent Film Festival attraverso azioni mirate di marketing (sia digitale sia cartaceo);
  • sostenere gli onerosi costi di organizzazione (tra cui la tipografia, i gadget, assicurazione, sanificazione degli ambienti e dispositivi di prevenzione personale, insonorizzazione delle sale proiezioni e gli allestimenti degli ambienti);
  • coprire le spese di vitto e alloggio per le maestranze e i volontari del Festival;
  • spese impreviste.

en - THE IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Your support will enable us to: 

  • update our audiovisual technologies;
  • increase the visibility of the Caorle Independent Film Festival through targeted marketing strategies (both digital and printed);
  • support the onerous costs of organisation (including typography, gadgets, insurance, sanitation of environments and personal prevention devices, soundproofing of screening rooms and room fittings);
  • cover the costs of food and accommodation for the Festival's staff and volunteers;
  • unexpected expenses.

 

 

    it - ALTRI MODI IN CUI PUOI CONTRIBUIRE

    Anche un semplice like alla nostra pagina Facebook e Instagram e una condivisione della campagna sono dei validissimi aiuti per il nostro Festival e, più in generale, per la cultura del nostro Paese. 

    Puoi trovarci facilmente sui social cercando Caorle Film Festival! 

    Sarai sempre più che benvenut* al Caorle Independent Film Festival: oltre a vivere l'esperienza del cinema indipendente, potrai vedere con i tuoi occhi il frutto del tuo preziosissimo contributo!

     

    Un grazie di cuore da tutto lo staff e gli organizzatori.

    en - OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

    Even a simple like on our Facebook and Instagram page, as well as sharing our campaign, can help our Festival and more generally the culture of our country. 

    You can easily find us on social media if you search Caorle Film Festival! 

    You will always be more than welcome at the Caorle Independent Film Festival: you will not only live the experience of the independent cinema, but you will also be able to see with your own eyes the results of your precious contribution!

    A heartfelt thank you from all the staff and organizers.

story:
Preparations are in full swing for the upcoming Miss Himalaya Pageant 2018 on 6 and 7 October in McLeod Ganj, India. Application to compete in the Pageant has closed, and the contestants will be announced in early September. The selected contestants will arrive in McLeod Ganj on the 4th October, and will meet the press on the 5th morning.

 

The Pageant brings onto one stage women from the entire Himalayan region, from Ladakh to Arunachal Pradesh. The Pageant inspires and empowers young women with the opportunities the platform brings. It also fosters better understanding and friendship among the Himalayan people. In addition, the Pageant is an opportunity to bring awareness around the environmental and developmental issues in the Himalayas.

 

Six rounds of competitions over two days will decide the winner, with a first prize of one lakh (100,000.00 ) rupees, the first runner-up 50,000, and the second runner-up 25,000 rupees.

 

The Pageant is expected to cost 10,000 USD. The amount covers: Food, accommodation, local transport, stage, sound, lighting, venue charges, seating, printings, photographer, cameraman, make-up, hair, judges honorarium, staff salary, and miscellaneous expenses.

 

We will try to raise half the cost through crowdfunding, and the other half through sponsorships and ticket sales.

 

If you believe in women empowerment, take this opportunity to support the young Himalayan women to get them wings to fly.

Lobsang Wangyal
Director

story:
Help us bring the party back to Miami Marine Stadium!

We at the National Trust for Historic Preservation, in collaboration with Heineken USA, are on a mission to jumpstart the restoration of this historic venue after decades of deterioration. And with your support, we’ll be one step closer to re-opening its doors so we can all enjoy the stadium again. 

Boat races that filled the Biscayne Bay with the roar of hydroplanes. Concerts on a floating stage with legends like Jimmy Buffett, Queen, Gloria Estefan, the Beach Boys, and Ray Charles. And parties that raged all night long. That’s what went down at Miami Marine Stadium in its heyday when it was the center of cultural life in South Florida. 

But it wasn’t just the wild entertainment that people marveled at. With its iconic concrete roof and unique waterside location, the stadium was unlike any other place that existed in the world. It’s a simple fact that remains true today, and it’s what inspires and motivates us to help bring it back to life. 



Imagine sitting in one of these seats and watching a concert under the stars. The Biscayne Bay’s cool breeze is on your face, and the skyscrapers of downtown are dazzling in the distance. It doesn’t get much more Miami than that, right?

That’s the future we want for Miami Marine Stadium, and it’s not hard to imagine because that’s the way it used to be.

Today, we’re closer than ever to making this vision a reality. Awareness is at an all-time high, and important engineering studies are already underway. But we need to move faster. We need to do more. We need to actually start fixing the place up.

That’s the whole point of our campaign. We’re here to raise money that will fund tangible restoration projects at the stadium. Our first goal? To remove and re-purpose what’s left of its worn and weathered seats so that new ones can eventually be installed.

And depending on how much we raise, we might be able to do even more!


With your generous backing, we’ll begin the critical overhaul the stadium needs, including our first big project — removing and re-purposing its dilapidated seats.

Plus, when you donate to our campaign, you’ll get some sweet perks in return, including graffiti prints, "Save Your Seat” t-shirts, tickets to exclusive events and concerts, and authentic seats from the stadium itself. How awesome is that?

The biggest perk of all, however, is the satisfaction you’ll get from bringing one of the most unique venues in the world back to life. So many people have epic stories from the times they spent at Miami Marine Stadium. Now it’s time for a new generation of memories to be made.

Be part of it...and claim your perks!

Back by Popular Demand — Stadium Graffiti Print #1! We've made 50 more prints available, so claim yours today!

Available Now — Graffiti Print #2! Get yours while supplies last!

Last In Our Series — Graffiti Print #3! Complete your set today!

Not able to contribute right now? Don’t worry—there are plenty of other ways you can help the “Save Your Seat” campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word on social media. Tell your friends, show your family, post the campaign online—no matter the method,  we need everyone’s help to restore Miami Marine Stadium!

Built in 1963, Miami Marine Stadium was the first powerboat racing venue in the United States. This 6,566-seat grandstand also hosted hundreds of legendary concerts, events, and parties you would not believe—all with MIA’s ever-growing skyline in view. Then Hurricane Andrew washed ashore in 1992, and the once-visionary venue has sat vacant and abandoned ever since.

  • 1963: Miami Marine Stadium opens its doors. Its 326-foot roof was—at the time—the longest span of cantilevered concrete in the world.
  • 1967: Miami Marine Stadium features in Elvis Presley film "Clambake.” 
  • 1972: Richard Nixon holds a campaign rally at Miami Marine Stadium where Sammy Davis Jr. infamously hugs him.
  • 1985: Jimmy Buffett brings Margaritaville to MIA for a raucous, two-night concert that ends with him plunging into the water.
  • 1990: The final boat race is held at Miami Marine Stadium after years of hosting world-class events that drew thousands.
  • 1992: Hurricane Andrew hits land and shutters the stadium.
  • 2009: The National Trust declares Miami Marine Stadium—vacant for decades—as one of America’s most endangered historic places.
  • 2012: The National Trust names Miami Marine Stadium a National Treasure. We’re in it for the long haul to help save this amazing place.
  • 2013: The City of Miami approves a comprehensive plan to restore Miami Marine Stadium as an entertainment venue, as it was in its heyday. The National Trust makes a grant to begin critical engineering studies.
  • 2014: The Miami International Boat Show—the largest boat show in the world—announces that it will relocate to the stadium site for its 2016 event. Finally, the boats are back!
  • 2016: Miami Mayor Tomás Regalado makes news by awarding as much as $4 million dollars in city funds to help restore Miami Marine Stadium. Soon after, the National Trust and Heineken join forces to raise even more.



Where is my donation going?

More than 75% of all funds raised will go to projects to support the preservation of Miami Marine Stadium, including our initial project to remove and re-purpose the stadium’s seats. Fifteen percent will go to support the National Trust for Historic Preservation for our ongoing work to restore the stadium and other threatened historic sites around the country. Up to eight percent will cover Indiegogo costs and processing fees as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.


Why can’t I get a stadium seat if I live outside of Miami-Dade, Broward, or West Palm Beach counties?

We’re working with a local delivery company and find it isn't feasible to ship the chairs outside this delivery area. We will refund donations for anyone who selects the seats but does not live in these counties, unless you can provide us with a local shipping address.

Tell me more about the graffiti prints.

These photos were taken in 2014 at a series of National Trust sponsored events designed to bring attention to both the plight of the stadium and the rich culture of street art that has helped keep it alive. We’re happy to share these unique photos with campaign backers who are passionate about the restoration of the stadium.

Can I pick which graffiti print I receive?

Different prints will be offered at different times during our Indiegogo campaign. It will be clear which print is available and when. Keep an eye on our campaign so that you can collect all three!

How will I get tickets to the finale concert?

Tickets will be issued electronically at the end of our campaign to the email address connected with your Indiegogo account.

Live Nation Worldwide, Inc. is not a sponsor of the ticket offer, and is in no way responsible for the administration of the ticket offer, the verification of qualified consumers or fulfillment of tickets.  All inquiries regarding the ticket offer should be directed to Heineken USA and not to Live Nation Worldwide, Inc.  Tickets available while supplies last. 

When will I get my perk?

All perks will be mailed in October at the conclusion of our campaign except for donation badges and concert tickets. Donation badges will be sent electronically to the email address connected with your Indiegogo account within seven days of your donation. Concert tickets will also be sent electronically to the email address connected with your Indiegogo account at the conclusion of our campaign. The concert will be held in September.

Can I visit the stadium?

Sadly, the answer is no. The stadium has been closed to the general public since Hurricane Andrew and remains completely off limits today for safety reasons. The site is monitored by security guards 24/7, so don’t chance it!

When will the stadium’s renovation be complete?

Saving places takes time! With your support, though, a critical first step in the process—removing the seats—will happen soon. Recently, the City of Miami committed $4 million in funding for other important restoration projects at the stadium. They also hired an architect to guide the transformation. This is all part of their comprehensive plan to bring the stadium back to its former glory.

What about the graffiti? Will it be removed when the stadium is restored?

Our recommendation is that the restoration plan should definitely take into account the murals and graffiti, which are an undeniable part of the stadium’s story. Our hope is that the culture of street art is somehow incorporated in the renovated stadium.

Is the National Trust involved in other restoration projects?

Yes! We’re the country’s leading advocate for saving historic places, and as such, we’re on the ground in communities across the nation. Visit our website to explore other National Treasures like Miami Marine Stadium.

story:
LoveFest is a collaborative experimental arts festival. The event uses the medium of ‘festival’ to create new ways of being and producing together. The festival aims to produce radical rethinking on the concept of Love through events where non-form is the form.

The inaugural LoveFest was held in 2017 which we put together without external funding, relying solely on the generosity of local and international artists. This year, we have the goal to financially compensate the wonderful artists and creatives who make LoveFest. 

With this campaign we are raising money for resources to put on the shows including promotion and infrastructure, production costs of the publication, and paying contributing artists who are developing original work for the events. 

Love Fest 2018 will be held in Budapest, Hungary from May 11-13. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise a modest amount of money to compensate artists for their time and work. It is still important to us to financially appreciate artists’ work, even if this amount just a token contribution. We hold this goal strongly this year when many in our creative community are living precariously. The more money we collect through this campaign the more we are able to pay contributors. Contributing to the campaign also keeps the LoveFest events free of charge.

The more money we collect the more we are able to pay contributors! 

In exchange for your donation, we have a bunch of great love fest merchandise. Most importantly the Lovefest2018 Publication. This anthology is created from artists, writers and thinkers all over the world who responded to our open call.  Last year the limited first edition copy sold out in two hours.  Contribute to the campaign to day to secure your publication now.

If you want more detail about our budget, you can contact us and we will happily share it with you. 

The Impact

The money that we raise helps us put on the festival, it keeps it free for guests and it helps to compensate artists for their work. 

Last year, we put on the festival with no outside funding. Our friends and others were generous enough to contribute their work and time to help us make LoveFest happen. This year, we would like to be able to support the contributors to the festival with some financial support and this is why we are making this campaign!

Each happening of Lovefest is created through a process of collaboration based in queer feminist principles. The aesthetic of LoveFest pulls from pulls from our everyday realities. It pays homage to our modes of communication and community while interrogating our relationship to these banal activities and habits.

LoveFest 2017 played with themes of collaboration, communication, cyber reality and celebration. LoveFest 2018 is taking you to the city. LoveFest provides alternative ways of being together. As much as we can, we try to keep it outside of an established structure and we have a strong focus on collective working practices. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to contribute financially but want to be involved in LoveFest2018 you can consider contributing to the 2018 publication or you can email us to get involved with organizing the festival itself. Any kind of contribution is met with love. 

    Lots of Love. 

    xoxo.

story:
A Moment that Changed the Prism of Female Sports

The 1999 Women’s World Cup Championship game at the Rose Bowl Stadium had one of the largest crowds to ever witness a women's sporting event. Team USA's inspirational moment at America's Stadium was an iconic moment of change for female athletics in the United States and all over the world inspiring a generation of youth and female athletes like never before.
 
Who can forget the iconic image of Brandi Chastain’s celebration after making the historic penalty kick that sealed the first World Cup victory in U.S. history? This victory, watched live by a world women's sporting record attendance of 90,185 fans including former President Bill Clinton and by more than 18 million on television, inspired a new generation of women athletes not only in soccer, but in a host of other sports as well.
 
As we approach the 20th anniversary of this watershed moment in women’s sports, we need your help to build a statue at the Rose Bowl Stadium that will continue to inspire women and girls for decades to come. Help to empower women with your tax deductible donation, and check out the great rewards that you can also receive!

We Need your Help

The Rose Bowl Stadium is crowdfunding for a commemorative statue in honor of the 1999 Women's Team USA World Cup Champions. We expect the statue will be similar in design to the first statue we erected in 2017, this popular statue of the legendary Jackie Robinson, who broke the baseball color barrier, and who played football at America’s Stadium after growing up just blocks from the Rose Bowl in Pasadena.

Our ultimate goal is to raise $200,000 through crowdfunding to honor the 1999 World Cup Champions and to commemorate this seminal moment in women’s sports. We have already raised more than $100,000 in private donations, and are opening the door for anyone to help make this statue a reality. We are offering some excellent perks for our crowdfunding contributors, so check out how you can get things like these with your tax deductible donations:
 
$25 Donation - Be a Part of History and be recognized as a donor of the Centennial Campaign as we celebrate the stadium turning 100 Years Old in 2022
 
$100 Donation - Help us honor the '99 US Women's Team and be recognized on the statue plaque
 
$500 Donation - Receive an autographed Brandi Chastain photo


 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.
 
MAKE SOME NOISE and help us get the word out that we are looking to honor a significant moment in our country's sport history- not just for sport but for all women! Share this link: www.1999TeamUSA.com on your social media platforms and with your friends and family, and help us build a statue that will inspire women and girls for decades, just like the 1999 U.S. Women’s World Cup Champions did nearly 20 years ago.

story:
About us: 

The Mostar Street Arts Festival has been continuously held for the past 6 years. The festival is a part of a positive social movement in Mostar, always evolving to include a more diverse artistic program.

It also provides an open space for up and coming young artists from B&H to hone in their craft and go public with their work. Because of this, Mostar has become one of the largest open-air galleries in Bosnia and Herzegovina and even the region. More than 100 murals have been painted in Mostar by artists from Bosnia and Herzegovina, the region and abroad, most of which were funded by the Street Arts Festival.

The month long festival this upcoming June is not only about artists painting murals across the city, but it also includes events such as concerts and DJ nights featuring talented local musicians, workshops and exhibitions. During the festival, there is truly something for everyone and all ages. Pop-up events occur as interest gains and citizens of Mostar realize their own creative skills and talents they have to offer. We have an official schedule, but events often form organically, usually at a low cost using communal spaces in the city and collaborations between formal and informal organizations.  

Our most ambitious venture began last year when we began to transform the ruined military complex into a open air gallery and event space. The Konak Barracks are now the Konak Art District, which is now operational as our main event space. We plan to expand the utility of the space this year to include more performances, an open air cinema, and an urban garden.

 

History of Mostar:

Mostar has always been a beautiful city, with architectural attractions such as a picturesque 16th century Ottoman bridge and both Ottoman and Austro-Hungarian style neighborhoods. However, during the Bosnian war in the mid 90’s, much of the city was destroyed and required rebuilding, the community is still healing, architecturally, politically, economically and emotionally. Although much of Mostar has been rebuilt, there is still a push to repair ruins and wartime destruction throughout the city.

Rebuilding is an expensive and often disappointing endeavor due to rampant corruption and money fraud. The SAF aims to repair the city in a different way, by transforming buildings and ruins through street art. All the while, engaging young artists to collaborate across the political divides of the city and use art as a unifier.

Why contribute?

We are asking for funding to help this year’s Street Arts Festival come into fruition. Our main costs come from paint and other artistic supplies needed to create at least 5 large scale murals and 15 smaller murals.  We must take on all the costs for expensive rentals such as scaffolding equipment for artists. We also must provide accommodation and transportation for regional and international artists. As interest grows in the festival, the higher our expenses rise as we wish to include as many artists as possible in the festival.

Even if we don’t achieve our fundraising goal, you can be assured that every dollar contributed will go towards the festival and every bit makes and huge difference in making this special event happen.

“Art makes life brighter and everyday challenges more bearable: “It is nice that we are becoming a city who embraces street art, because we don’t have a lot of that in this country.” -Marina Mimoza (SAF Organizer) to Euronews

We invite you to share our campaign by word of mouth and on any social media platforms.

Our main costs come from paint and other artistic supplies needed to create at least 5 large scale murals and 15 smaller murals.  We must take on all the costs for expensive rentals such as scaffolding equipment for artists. We also must provide accommodation and transportation for regional and international artists. As interest grows in the festival, the higher our expenses rise as we wish to include as many artists as possible in the festival.
Even if we don’t achieve our fundraising goal, you can be assured that every dollar contributed will go towards the festival and every bit makes and huge difference in making this special event happen.
“Art makes life brighter and everyday challenges more bearable: “It is nice that we are becoming a city who embraces street art, because we don’t have a lot of that in this country.” -Marina Mimoza (SAF Organizer) to Euronews
We invite you to share our campaign by word of mouth and on any social media platforms.

story:
About Mother Makers:

While becoming a mother is for most a private thing, for some the conflict between our public lives as makers and private lives as mothers cannot be separated; be it due to a lack of childcare, support systems, time, space, or any other reason.

We should not have to chose between family or career.

By actively examining the process of art production as a mother, Mother Makers aims to develop strategies and create opportunities that are tailored specifically towards the needs of those maker-mothers in need of additional support.

Mother Makers believes that women should get the support they need throughout motherhood to enable them to continue creating.

By seeking visibility for those who feel pushed to the peripheries, for whatever reason, through the creation of projects and collaborations, it is our intention to reclaim a space within art and design, as well as in the wider arts for mothers like ourselves.

Incorporating children into a makers practice

 

With your help we plan to:

 

  • Showcase mother makers internationally. Central to Mother Makers is collaboration.  It is our plan to bring a selection of mother makers to Munich Jewellery Week 2018. We have secured a venue with the help of Munich Aritsts which is right in the city centre at Odeonsplatz and very soon we will launch a callout for participants. This curated exhibition will showcase a wide selection of work from mothers that focus on this life transforming experience, demonstrating that procreation does not mean the end of one's career, or inspiration.

 

  • Develop and add content to our website. To provide more support, advice and examples of best practice for maker-mums online, enabling other mothers to work through our research, to network and to establish a presence within art and design as valid professionals.

 

  • Develop and explore best practices in combined studio and childcare formats We are aware that many mothers often feel isolated and struggle to find support systems to enable them to have dedicated time in the studio. We aim  to research and test combined studio and childcare formats to provide a blueprint to others who are struggling to find ways to create while caring for their children.

 

 

 

How will we use the money we receive?

We have set a target of €7000 for this campaign. This money will be spend on these specific funding requirements:

 

  • Our travel and accommodation (babies and all) to Munich, exhibition and display costs.

 

  • To go towards the costs of managing and organising a curated group exhibition in Munich.

 

  • To enable us to continue to develop content for the Mother Makers website as well as to promote Mother Makers projects in the build up to and during Munich Jewellery Week.

 

  • Help towards Mother Makers first planned trial of a  combined studio and childcare residency between Laura and Laurie planned for February 2018. We have been donated a space to work in and free accommodation and just need a little funding towards the costs of travel for this.

 

  • The cost of the production of all the perks/ rewards.

 

The Mother Makers making plans for the future

 

What we have acheived to date:

  • We have been working really hard and have achieved a lot so far without any funding.
  • We have secured a venue in Munich for a Mother Makers curated exhibition during Munich Jewellery Week.
  • We have already begun to work with artist mothers. We have developed a website which features many interviews, advice and tips.
  • We have begun to explore different studio and residency options that will enable mothers to work while still caring for their child/ren.

 

We have been so lucky so far and have had many wonderful people gift us their time, talents and equipment to the project.

If you can donate any of your time and skills to the project, do let us know –

We always welcome help in whatever form!

Spread the word

 

How to help us:

 

We have been working hard to find ways to make it as easy as we can for you to either donate to our campaign or purchase our perks.

All the perks can be purchased via this Indiegogo campaign using their Stripe card sytem.

If for any reason your unable to pay via the Indiegogo Stripe card system we can now also offer a paypal service.

You can place orders for any of the perks you see here or send donations directly via paypal using the email: mothermakersarehere[at]gmail.com, or you can visit our shop at BigCartel which for the duration of the campaign will feature five of our most popular perks.

ALL items bought via our shop and all donations made via paypal WILL appear on this Indiegogo campaign.

 

The Perks:

 

In exchange for your funding donations we have a huge range of perks we are incredibly excited about. We have been working hard to provide a range of perks to match any budget.

 

We have just added a brand new perk;

The Designers supporting Designers tote bag.

This pure cotton bag is printed on one side in a bright red. What more do you need?

M

 

The Mother Maker Pins

We are expanding our pin range to introduce new colours.

The blue and gold Mother Makers pin:

 

The white and gold Mother Makers pin:

The Pink and gold Mother Maker pin:

 

Examples of the blue and gold pin

 

 

The Mother Makers mentoring package:

 

For mothers trying to fit the time to think, make and develop a practice around the daily trials and tribulations of caring for children, this can sometimes feel like an impossible challenge. We  recognise this challenge and offer a mentorship package to help you through this.

The mentorship is tailored to each artist's specific needs and will consist of some writen work and a skype meeting. If you are seeking to prepare to start back to work after a break, seeking ways to set aims and achieve goals or working towards a specific project, this mentoring package could be for you.

Every person who purchases the mentoring package will also get their choice of Mother Maker apron (retail value for €28) making this package really great value. 

 

The Mother Makers Apron:

Our new apron range for the Jeweller Mother Maker (jewellery / objects / humans) are only available as part of our mentorship package. It comes in green or red on a natural coloured apron. These beautiful aprons come with pockets, because as a mother maker you can never have too many pockets!

Not a jeweller but still want a Mother Maker apron?

Don’t despair, EXCLUSIVELY to this crowdfunding campaign we are offering you the chance to design your own. Available in either font colour, just tell us which words you want and we will do the rest! (Please note, currently this option is for the apron without pockets. If you require one with pockets please contact us separately and we will see if we can help).

 

 

 

 

As part of Laurie's artist residency in motherhood, she began to document just one of the multiple mini obsessions that grip us in early motherhood through a dedicated instagram page and a pantone colour chart. The results are these:

 

The Mother Maker Pantone Poop Colour Chart Poster:

Laurie Schram has developed the 'Waiting for Poop' pantone poop colour chart (A2), charting her journey through two months of breastfeeding and nappy changing.

 

 

The Pantone Poop Colour Mug:

 EXCLUSIVE to this campaign we are offering a pantone poop cup (in a choice of five shades).

 

 

Individual pieces of work from our mother makers:

Not only do we have a number of Mother Maker products for sale, a number of our fantastic Mother Makers have offered some truly exquisite items of jewellery for sale:

 

Julie Usel's earrings 'Buccellatissimi' are from the collection 'La Route de la Soie' are made from silk, gold leaf and gold pendants (7cm x 4cm x 2mm).

Earrings

Detail of earrings

 

Viktoria Münzker's brooch 'Elysia Crispata' (2013) is made of driftwood, Alpacca, granules, glass, stone and lacquer. 12.5 x 8.5 x 2.5 cm

Front of brooch

Back of brooch

 

 

Souraya Karami of Esska Shoes is offering her Esska watch, in rose gold with a navy leather strap, with a 36mm watch face.

                   

 

 

Laurie Schram is offering one of her coins (2012):

The Schram grows in value as the artist herself does as a commodity. Supporting Mother Makers will increase the chances of this currency gaining in value again.

Materials: Bronze.

 

 

Beth Legg is offering a pair of her Stacks earrings, made from sterling silver and 22t gold leaf they are based on the spectacular sea stacks of Duncansby Head on the far north-east coast of Scotland.

 

Laura Bradshaw-Heap is offering up to five necklaces from 'The Repetition of Motherhood' project. Made from paint, ink, thread and pasta.  

 

 

Risks & Challenges:

Every single cent raised will go straight into the development of Mother Maker’s future projects, so please give generously. While we have set a goal of €7000 the more we can raise, the more we can do.

The single biggest hurdle is maintaining our rhythm of output no matter what life brings over these next few months.

With funding, we can insure that we can both maintain dedicated time during the week enabling us to give the project the time and energy the project requires.

We will also continue to find ways to continue to work during the rest of the week while caring for our children.

We have succeeded so much to date and know, with the right support – your support – we will achieve our goals.

 

 

How to help:

 

All the perks can be purchased via this Indiegogo campaign using their Stripe card sytem.

If for any reason your unable to pay via the Indiegogo Stripe card system we can now also offer a paypal service.

You can place orders for any of the perks you see here or send donations directly via paypal using the email: mothermakersarehere[at]gmail.com, or you can visit our shop at BigCartel which for the duration of the campaign will feature five of our most popular perks.

ALL items bought via our shop and all donations made via paypal WILL appear on this Indiegogo campaign.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

 

We of course understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

If you have any ideas for future collaborations, have skills you wish to share with us, or if you know of any inspiring mother makers who we should interview through our 5 questions section on our blog, please do contact us.

And please share this campaign and shout about this campaign through social media. The more people to see it the more chances we have in reaching our target.

 

And don't forget to link with us!

                    

 

                 

 

 

Founders Bio’s

Laurie Schram’s (NL) often satirical work revolves around themes of a socio-political nature and status through objects. A relationship between the fictional and the non-fictional has been an important theme. Schram graduated from the Royal College of Art, London with work mainly focused on altering existing currencies and creating new ones by combining countries and rewriting narratives. She went on to build a fictional jewellery factory as Schram&Sandhu, focussing on collaborative work as well as writing and recently having a child.

 

Laura Bradshaw-Heap (UK/IRE) is a freelance curator, arts practitioner, ethnographer and mother. She has a Master in social and cultural anthropology from University College London and a Master in design from London Metropolitan University. Bradshaw-Heap is most interested in projects that are research based and involve turning the audience into active participants in some way. Her methods are drawn from across disciplines. Previous projects include 'JUNK: rubbish to gold' co-created with Prof. Jivan Astfalck and Rachel Darbourne; 'Suspended in Pink' and 'Suspended in Green' - two touring, curated group exhibitions. Her research interests include the making economy, performativity, aesthetics, the politics of voice, feminist studies and participatory art.

story:
WHAT IS SPARK CONTEMPORARY ART SPACE

Spark Contemporary Art Space is one of Syracuse’s longest standing community-based art centers, operating for the past 20 years. Traditionally, the multi-room, street level commercial venue was operated as a "DIY" space rental, acting as a home base for a large group of artists from all backgrounds and mediums: photographers, directors, musicians, cinematographers, illustrators, dancers, producers, inventors, writers, performers, editors, designers, and more.

Under new ownership, the vision is to respect the grassroots, organic history and the affordable, amorphous use the space has provided Syracuse-area creatives, while simultaneously working to transform SPARK into a full-time live music venue, art gallery, used book store, cafe/lounge and movement/yoga/dance space. It also has sites on producing other SPARK branded events.

This crowd fund campaign aims to "Spark The Arts," embracing cooperative values, building regional partnerships, supporting our surrounding neighborhood and offering a "DIO" (Do It Ourselves) mentality. Located in fast developing downtown / university neighborhood, SPARK is primed to serve a larger youth market hungry for a local hub, funky culture and lively outings.

You as a contributor will help build an affordable, inclusive venue that will encourage students, artists and patrons alike to unite under one roof. SPARK is perfectly triangulated between college lifestyle, urban housing and other creative neighborhoods in Syracuse. All these groups and more should feel welcomed into a space where they can perform, create and even simply kick up their feet, read a book and sip some coffee. Every little bit you provide brings Syracuse closer to creative community, using SPARK as the intersection between all artistic paths.

One of the most exciting elements is the effort to bring a coffee chop element into the space! Discussions are in the works to fully activate this element of SPARK by Spring 2018 .

 

WHO WE ARE

Since the summer of 2017, SPARK has been co-owned by Patrick Tuohey and Jacob Roberts. Patrick, a seasoned talent buyer, promoter and musician, and Jacob, an artist, business owner and property developer both have a desire for SPARK maintain its avant-garde art gallery vibe, hosting art exhibits, film /video, poetry, dance and other arts endeavors, while also becoming the premiere, small capacity sound stage in Syracuse, NY, hosting regional and national acts.

Jacob and Patrick are anything but new to the local art and music community. Back in the late 90’s, early 2000's, Jacob worked as a professional artist and designer in downtown, while acting as the Executive Director of ThINC, The Institution of a Now Culture, Inc. an enterprising 501c3 that activated the local, street-level, art scene, while also revitalizing many dormant commercial properties. Jacob was also instrumental in launching 40Below, a successful young professionals organization, was a founding member of the Arts and Culture Leadership Council of Onondaga County (ACLA), was briefly involved in local politics, and has recently launched a new venture called Crystal City Creative Spaces, an “Art Space”  real estate investment cooperative, as a way to continue the legacy of groups like ThINC and 40Below, and awesome places like SPARK, that have contributed to making Syracuse a fun, exciting, vibrant and creative city.

Likewise, Patrick has been a crucial part of enriching area venues and the artists that play them for years. Having been an active musician in a number of Syracuse based bands (Forfeiture, Only The Chosen, Secrets Kept, etc.) he saw the importance of producing live entertainment. Going from booking shows independently, to joining NonZeroSum Presents (owners of 1Fest, perhaps best known for their Ithaca, NY series) to now working for Upstate New York's largest independent events company After Dark Presents, there's a strong history in bringing people together for the purpose of sharing, creating and performing music with one another.

Pursuing a Bachelor's in Music Business from Berklee Boston (#1 Independent school of music in the world), working for Soundgarden Syracuse (one of only a few independent record stores left in the area) and operating a small web development and graphic design firm called Phantom Pain Media, catering specifically to artists and musicians are just a few of the other projects that places Patrick in the right place to lead an initiative like SPARK The Arts, which depends so closely on a connection with the community. Operating out of so many different clubs to support regional music has provided insight on how to run the future of SPARK as a successful venue.

 

WHAT WE NEED

It’s time to SPARK THE ARTS! We all want the same thing: a community that supports the arts, venues to appreciate them, and places to produce great work. The better our amenities are, the safer the structure is, the more efficiently we operate, the more attractive the space is to spend time in, and the better we're able to offer great professional services to the local cultural sector.

To grow our business, and its offerings, we first need to spruce the place up a bit. Whether it's for live music, gallery exhibits, classes or workshops, SPARK is growing in demand and, unfortunately, our personal cash infusions and sweat equity has only been able to stabilize the ship so far - and now’s the perfect time for us to renovate and revitalize the entire physical site.

With your assistance, SPARK will be able to acquire the basic means to function as a true multi-media production house, where creatives make, study, share, experiment, network, and evolve.

Today, our ability to function and facilitate quality productions are limited by a lack of basic resources: updated light and sound gear, proper storage to organize our sets, props, etc.;  updated PA system and the ability to record audio for live shows, video shoots and recording sessions; as well as an interactive website that features all of the content produced at SPARK.

Here's a rough breakdown of what we need:

$30,000 build out: sliding partitions, mixing booth, office, storage, lighting, doors, windows, sound proofing, carpet, insulation/padding, bass traps, curtains, hardwood flooring, trim, lumber, hardware, bathroom vent, bins, green room, makeup station, awnings, barn doors, cafe bar, etc.

$23,000 studio gear: computer, camera, projector, mixer, speakers, monitors, stereo, mics, headphones, cables, plugins, adapters, hot lights, strobes, stands, rollers, sand, dolly, jib, etc.

$7,000 new website: design, development, programming and up-keep.

 

WHAT YOU GET

Your donation to the “Spark the Arts” campaign works to improve a long time community space and exhibition center for local and visiting artists, ensuring it continues to thrive into the future.

By pledging a gift to this Indiegogo you are supporting the arts sector in a very direct way, by allowing artists to assemble in a clean, affordable, functional (and cool) facility where new works can be conceived, practiced, produced and exhibited on a daily basis in Syracuse, New York.

As a reward for helping us to improve the venue and enhance our services, contributors will receive a number of fresh perks, such as: coffee comps, bookstore discounts; merchandise; event tickets; RSVP party invitations (final date, talent and activities TBD); and original art In exchange for your kind contributions.

In addition, for the next six months SPARK will be working under The Alchemical Nursery Project Inc., a 501c3 fiscal sponsor. This makes us open to other types of donations, sponsorships and/or partnerships beyond this campaign.

Please contact us if you, or someone you know, would be interested in donating any music gear, video equipment, building materials, art studio supplies, etc. Email: gallery@sparkthearts.com

Thanks for your support! We can't do it without you.

Thank you to our partners: Alchemical Nursery, Spark Orange, Syracuse Music Collective

Back in the late 90’s, early 2000's, Jacob worked as a professional artist and designer in downtown, while acting as the Executive Director of ThINC, The Institution of a Now Culture, Inc. an enterprising 501c3 that activated the local, street-level, art scene, while also revitalizing many dormant commercial properties. Jacob was also instrumental in launching 40Below, a successful young professionals organization, was a founding member of the Arts and Culture Leadership Council of Onondaga County (ACLA), was briefly involved in local politics, and has recently launched a new venture called Crystal City Creative Spaces, an “Art Space”  real estate investment cooperative, as a way to continue the legacy of groups like ThINC and 40Below, and awesome places like SPARK, that have contributed to making Syracuse a fun, exciting, vibrant and creative city.

Likewise, Patrick has been a crucial part of enriching area venues and the artists that play them for years. Having been an active musician in a number of Syracuse based bands (Forfeiture, Only The Chosen, Secrets Kept, etc.) he saw the importance of producing live entertainment. Going from booking shows independently, to joining NonZeroSum Presents (owners of 1Fest, perhaps best known for their Ithaca, NY series) to now working for Upstate New York's largest independent events company After Dark Presents, there's a strong history in bringing people together for the purpose of sharing, creating and performing music with one another.
Pursuing a Bachelor's in Music Business from Berklee Boston (#1 Independent school of music in the world), working for Soundgarden Syracuse (one of only a few independent record stores left in the area) and operating a small web development and graphic design firm called Phantom Pain Media, catering specifically to artists and musicians are just a few of the other projects that places Patrick in the right place to lead an initiative like SPARK The Arts, which depends so closely on a connection with the community. Operating out of so many different clubs to support regional music has provided insight on how to run the future of SPARK as a successful venue.
 
WHAT WE NEED
It’s time to SPARK THE ARTS! We all want the same thing: a community that supports the arts, venues to appreciate them, and places to produce great work. The better our amenities are, the safer the structure is, the more efficiently we operate, the more attractive the space is to spend time in, and the better we're able to offer great professional services to the local cultural sector.
To grow our business, and its offerings, we first need to spruce the place up a bit. Whether it's for live music, gallery exhibits, classes or workshops, SPARK is growing in demand and, unfortunately, our personal cash infusions and sweat equity has only been able to stabilize the ship so far - and now’s the perfect time for us to renovate and revitalize the entire physical site.
With your assistance, SPARK will be able to acquire the basic means to function as a true multi-media production house, where creatives make, study, share, experiment, network, and evolve.
Today, our ability to function and facilitate quality productions are limited by a lack of basic resources: updated light and sound gear, proper storage to organize our sets, props, etc.;  updated PA system and the ability to record audio for live shows, video shoots and recording sessions; as well as an interactive website that features all of the content produced at SPARK.
Here's a rough breakdown of what we need:
$30,000 build out: sliding partitions, mixing booth, office, storage, lighting, doors, windows, sound proofing, carpet, insulation/padding, bass traps, curtains, hardwood flooring, trim, lumber, hardware, bathroom vent, bins, green room, makeup station, awnings, barn doors, cafe bar, etc.
$23,000 studio gear: computer, camera, projector, mixer, speakers, monitors, stereo, mics, headphones, cables, plugins, adapters, hot lights, strobes, stands, rollers, sand, dolly, jib, etc.
$7,000 new website: design, development, programming and up-keep.

 
WHAT YOU GET
Your donation to the “Spark the Arts” campaign works to improve a long time community space and exhibition center for local and visiting artists, ensuring it continues to thrive into the future.
By pledging a gift to this Indiegogo you are supporting the arts sector in a very direct way, by allowing artists to assemble in a clean, affordable, functional (and cool) facility where new works can be conceived, practiced, produced and exhibited on a daily basis in Syracuse, New York.
As a reward for helping us to improve the venue and enhance our services, contributors will receive a number of fresh perks, such as: coffee comps, bookstore discounts; merchandise; event tickets; RSVP party invitations (final date, talent and activities TBD); and original art In exchange for your kind contributions.
In addition, for the next six months SPARK will be working under The Alchemical Nursery Project Inc., a 501c3 fiscal sponsor. This makes us open to other types of donations, sponsorships and/or partnerships beyond this campaign.
Please contact us if you, or someone you know, would be interested in donating any music gear, video equipment, building materials, art studio supplies, etc. Email: gallery@sparkthearts.com
Thanks for your support! We can't do it without you.
Thank you to our partners: Alchemical Nursery, Spark Orange, Syracuse Music Collective

**English below

Educar a través del Arte es un programa de Mujeres en las Artes (MUA) desarrollado en escuelas públicas del Centro Histórico de Tegucigalpa desde el 2013. Educar a través del arte es un espacio de experimentación creativa para estimular las capacidades y habilidades artísticas de los niños y niñas. Entre los principales componentes del programa que se han desarrollado en las escuelas son:

  • Talleres Creativos
  • Talleres "Aprendo y así me cuido"
  • Unidades de Pintura
  • La visita es importante (por parte de los artistas padrinos)
  • Megataller "Pintando Tegucigalpa" (donde se convocan a 1000 niños y niñas de las escuelas beneficiadas para desarrollar una jornada de pintura)

--------------------------------------------------

Educar a través del Arte (Educating through Art) is a program by Mujeres en las Artes (MUA = Women in the Arts), a non-profit private organization that is located in Tegucigalpa's downtown. Even though the headquarters are located in the capital, MUA has a lot of programs which visit other municipalities in Honduras. Educar a través del Arte is an open space for creative experimentation to stimulate the artistic capacities and abilities of girls and boys. This program is focused on public schools in Honduras, because they normally don't have the means to afford recreational/artistic/cultural activities for the attending students.

Some of the main activities that have been made in Educar a través del Arte are:

  • Creative workshops
  • "Aprendo y así me cuido" (By learning, I take care of myself) workshops
  • Painting activities
  • "The visit is Important" workshops, in which artists go and visit the schools.
  • Mega-Workshop "Pintando Tegucigalpa" (Painting Tegucigalpa), where approximately 1000 girls and boys are brought together to paint their vision of their city and self-portraits.

 

​​
