story:
PLEASE HELP US REACH OUR STRETCH GOAL OF $5,000!

Whisk Me Away Cakes has partnered with RIF (Refugee & Immigrant Fund NYC) and some incredible musicians through the U.S. State Department to pilot a new program providing opportunities for everyday citizens to engage and develop relationships with refugees and asylum seekers. We'll be achieving this through a series of pop-up concerts in intimate home gatherings and larger event venues throughout New York City starting this Spring. 

As the pastry point person for this exciting endeavor, please help me raise an updated total of $5,000 in the next three days. This additional $2,000 will go directly toward the diverse, international dessert selections at these gatherings - in addition to developing a cake-as-art installation at our launch party later this year. I'm in the process of curating a set of large, tiered cakes that will cumulatively tell stories of the plight of refugees around the world - and I couldn't be more excited about it!

 

DESSERTS CONTAIN IMMENSE POWER FOR GLOBAL CONNECTION.

Call it crazy, but it's real.

By harnessing the universal excitement around cakes, pastries, and traditional sweets, we've effectively connected people from all corners of the world. Through food, we’re able to blur the lines between cultures, races, class systems, and religions - and personalize experiences that are otherwise foreign. We're currently in the middle of the world's largest refugee crisis since WWII. Terrorism has found new soil. The dark reality of our global food supply is forcing us to think creatively - and quickly.  Political elections are gaining strength from focused hate and reckless fear. And in this time of change, I know that desserts engage an audience wide enough to create great impact.

 

THE PROJECT

Whisk Me Away Cakes is embarking on a solo culinary journey through East Africa! 

From February 15th to April 1st, 2017, I’ll be spending six weeks abroad - assembling a series of articles, video shorts, and photojournalism collections featuring rural cooks and sharing their favorite recipes. I plan to include discussions as they naturally evolve, involving family histories, agricultural practices, regional issues, personal stories, and individual hopes for our global future - all told through food, specifically desserts where appropriate.

 

THE FOUNDER

Rose McAdoo strives to live at the intersection of agriculture, food production, international development, and social justice. She uses dessert to create safe, lighthearted spaces surrounding heavy topics - and believes in the power of a shared meal to foster cultural understanding.

In addition to running Whisk Me Away Cakes, she works as a cake decorator at Nine Cakes and as a farmhand and events assistant at Brooklyn Grange Rooftop Farm. She has a decade of experience in baking and pastry arts, has developed programming around culinary education, and frequently backpacks abroad to gain experience in international farming and cooking practices. So far, she's gotten her hands dirty on farms and in kitchens in the U.S., Canada, England, Scotland, Ireland, Dominican Republic, Haiti, Costa Rica, Argentina, and Chile.

Rose has established relationships with a local South Sudanese refugee population in Syracuse, and works closely with the NYC Refugee & Immigrant Fund - developing international pastry menus to increase engagement at their events and welcoming as many asylum seekers as possible into her personal home.

 

THE ITINERARY

*Schedule subject to change and grow

KENYA

  • I’ll start my adventure by exploring Nairobi’s street food with Susan Kamau - Kenya’s most well-known chef and Regional Culinary Ambassador for the UN’s Global Alliance for Clean Cookstoves. [in progress]
  • An invitation stands to stay and cook with the tribe members behind Maji Moto Maasai Camp - a thoughtful and internally-run outlet which allows for respectful tourist access and a view into tribe practices. Among other responsibilities, I’ll be assisting on and harvesting from their farm, a new endeavor of a tribe that typically practiced strict hunter-gatherer methods.
  • I’ll be accompanying Maasai tribal elders on a multi-day bush walk - cooking over the campfire and under the stars, and engaging in a traditional goat slaughter.

KENYAN/UGANDAN BORDER

  • Through WWOOF (Worldwide Opportunities on Organic Farms), I’ll be staying on Mfangano Island in Lake Victoria. From there, I’ll be traveling to Remba - an overpopulated slum island where its 3,500-6,000 inhabitants (depending on the day’s fish catch) are depleting surrounding waters. Local Health Dispensary Chairman, John Keri, has established a farm on the island to promote agricultural education and economic diversification. Coming with a background in soil-based urban rooftop farming, John and I share the experience of farming with tight space requirements and limited access to necessary resources. He has organized a board meeting upon my arrival so we may identify obstacles and brainstorm solutions with the community.

UGANDA

  • On my land-based journey to Rwanda, I’m taking a stopover in Kampala to visit and work with professional cake decorators for a day or two.

RWANDA

  • In Kigali, I’ll be staying with the family of an asylum seeker I befriended as we farmed together in New York. His brother will then escort me to a rural village two hours from Kigali to garden and cook with his mother on the Rwandan/Congolese border.
  • I’ll also be connecting with local men and women through the Kula Coffee Project, One Acre Fund (see below), and the country's first microbrewery, which is female-owned and -operated.  [in progress]

TANZANIA

  • I’m in contact with staff members at the International Rescue Committee in order to secure an opportunity to prepare meals and learn more about food access in crisis settings with the cooks at Nyarugusu Refugee Camp on the border of Tanzania and Burundi. [in progress]
  • A business-connection-turned-good-friend manages an agricultural nonprofit in Iringa. Through her invitation, I’ll be spending much of my time visiting subsistence farmers and rural bakers who are all members of One Acre Fund.
  • The founders behind Kokoa Kamili have been vital connections to me over the past few years. We sourced their cacao beans at a chocolate factory that I managed in Brooklyn, and I hope to finally meet their founders during their off-season in Dar Es Salaam. [in progress]
  • A quick jaunt over to Zanzibar Town will place me directly in the heart of the spice trade of the 19th century - and gift me the dynamic flavors and rich culinary traditions of its blended Arab, Indian, and African populations.
  • A close friend of mine is a born-and-bred Tanzanian safari guide with family rooted in the tourism and hospitality industries. Spending my last few days with him in Arusha will allow me a comfortable and well-connected home base from which to tie up any loose ends on my journey.

 

THE IMPACT

Upon completion of this project, I'll be bringing these experiences, stories, recipes, and photographs back to New York City for a series of formal discussions and culinary events. These events consistently encourage a greater sense of curiosity regarding other cultures and lifestyles and create diverse opportunities for one-on-one connection - in turn, eliminating some of the prejudices and dangerous misunderstandings that are currently threatening our world.

 

THE FUNDING

My personal funds are being used to cover the costs of flights, travel insurance, medical work, country entry visas, backpacking equipment, and any recreational activities through the trip.

The full completion and ultimate success of this project is dependent on additional funding through this campaign.

The fundraising goal of $3,000 will pay for the following:

  1. Purchasing ingredients for shared meals. (This will be my biggest expense.) I've been graciously offered many homestays and opportunities revolving around food. Whether these generous souls are taking me through their towns and villages to eat a delicious meal out, or whether we're harvesting from their garden plot and cooking a meal all together at home, it is my sincere desire to pay for all ingredients and meals during these exchanges. I am beyond grateful and humbled for these invitations, and I would love to have the financial means to thank people appropriately.
  2. Securing my stay with the Maasai Mara.
  3. Purchasing additional AV gear (additional photo/audio equipment, recording devices, external memory components, backup packs, and portable solar chargers).
  4. On-the-ground travel expenses. Many of the locations I'll be traveling to are incredibly rural and off the beaten path. This means multiple modes of transportation to each destination, which, over six weeks, will add up quickly. Matatus (I've also heard them called 'chicken busses') and boats and matatus and boats and matatus and boats...
  5. Small thank you gifts for hosts along my travels. A delicate, but important gesture.

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP, YOU ASK?

  1. Share, share, share! Please help us get the word out to greater networks through Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter - and feel free to chat up our mission with your friends in person too! Use the IndieGoGo share buttons at the top of this page. This one's so easy - and absolutely vital to our success.
  2. Connect! Have a contact in the regions where I'll be traveling? I'd love to meet with them! Live in Brooklyn and drink too much coffee? Me too! Let's be in touch. Always feel free to drop me a note at crmcadoo@gmail.com. I'd love to hear from you.
  3. Swap recipes! I'm always looking for esoteric dessert recipes from around the world. I have particular interest in regions currently in crisis, but - as there seems to be more and more of those lately - I welcome any and all that you're willing to share. 
  4. Sign up! Another easy one. Go to our website, sign up for our newsletter (just photos of delicious things and important musings on the world), and come to an event in the future and eat cake with us. You really can't go wrong.

Any funds raised over our $3,000 goal will be used to support the ongoing mission of Whisk Me Away Cakes: to use desserts to drive global change. Until now, all labor and most materials for our refugee benefit events have come out-of-pocket, which is becoming less and less sustainable. With additional funding, I'll be supported in my work to assemble and deliver presentations, build workshops, donate bigger and more extravagant pastry displays at benefit events, and curate tiered cakes to visually articulate stories of people from around the world. The sheer thought of this excites me to no end. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

 

THE FUTURE

This is only the beginning. I can already taste the chewy, rice flour desserts of Southeast Asia calling from across the Pacific Ocean. I can feel the warmth of the stoves I’ll be igniting with an Aboriginal tribe in the Australian outback in 2018. I can feel the smooth ribs of the palm leaves that we’ll use to cook on open fires in Rarotonga. I can smell the yeasty starter of the bread that I’ll bake with the cooks of Antarctica’s research stations in the cold hours of early morning.

In New York City, I am committed to building up the dynamic, supportive, diverse, and encouraging group of people that I've crossed paths with over the last few years. In a city where asylum seekers have become some of my very closest friends, I join them in leading by example. By putting strength, heart, and goodness first. And by working constantly to make this world a better place.

As for East Africa, I’m absolutely thrilled to continue this worldwide journey - using desserts as a way to share stories, connect strangers, and bring global awareness to issues that are currently tearing us apart.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for joining me in this.



Food is powerful. Desserts are my passion. We have stories to tell. And we have change to see.

www.whiskmeawaycakes.com

"Tasting a Whisk Me Away confection is an exercise in contradictions: it is at once a transcendent experience, yet it roots one firmly in the terroir from which its ingredients are procured. Never has a tomato tasted more tomato-ey than in Rose's caramel. Never has a ground cherry been so elevated as in her galette. Rose's use of farm-to-table ingredients speaks to her deep connection with agriculture, and her respect for the regions and seasonality in which she works."   -Anastasia Cole-Plakias, founder of Brooklyn Grange Rooftop Farm

"Rose has found her unique gift - making beautiful cakes and a variety of other desserts - and uses that gift to bring forth the connection and change she hopes to see in this lifetime.  Whisk Me Away Cakes celebrates people of all kinds, cultures, and walks of life and the beauty that comes from genuine human connection and a simply delicious bite of something sweet."   -Mollie Kinsman, founder of Conversate

"For the past two years, I have witnessed Rose's magic. Through her effusive personality and passion for world desserts, she has uplifted the spirits of many refugees in NYC."   -Maria Blacque-Belair, founder of Refugee & Immigrant Fund NYC

story:
OneTable is the fastest growing nonprofit serving Jewish millennials across the United States. We empower guests and hosts in their 20s and 30s to host weekly Friday night meals, inviting over friends and strangers to build community across the table.

“[OneTable Shabbat made me] remember why civilizations form bonds beyond their families and enjoy others’ company. When a group of people connects, with just enough wine, there’s a release. It’s the feeling that you could sit at the table for hours and not want to check your iPhone. It sounds simple, but it felt like nothing short of a miracle.”

– The New York Times

 

 

OneTable’s mission is to break down the barriers that might stop millennials from hosting Shabbat dinner. Enter...

 

 

Our Shabbat set helps you...

 

The EVERYTHING BUT THE TABLE set will empower our growing host community to create dinners that are more meaningful and impactful.

But we can’t do it without your support.

We’re seeing 200 dinners happening each week; that’s 200 hosts every single week who would benefit from our Shabbat set. By backing this project, you can get your very own Everything but the Table set and ensure that we can create these sets for every host to choose as part of their Nourishment Credit from OneTable for years to come.

story:
so what is BUZZ?

Buzz is a hybrid project. A mobile house and a creative space.

Buzz is an idea that has been living in our minds for almost three years now. Our love for art, human interaction, our passion to (co)create and our need for travelling and constant change are the energy source of that project. 

As a part of our final thesis in Architecture at the Technical University of Crete we want to design and construct a mobile space with two primary functions.

First, we want to convert our vehicle into a living space that will contain all the necessary tools and functions for an everyday living (bed, kitchen, work space, shower, wc). The interior space will be transformable in order to adjust and modify it each time according to our needs. All these are intented to be powered by renewable energy, mainly solar.

At the same time we want to design a space for creation, communication and sharing ideas.

The concept is that Buzz will carry all the required equipment so as to be converted into a creative platform that can host a music concert, an exhibition, a video projection, a performance or any other idea that you will suggest.

Once the project is realised, our dream is to start travelling and (co)organising events with excited people all over the world.

Buzz except from its physical platform, will also have a digital one. Our goal is to create an online community, where we will upload all the work, creations and information of people with whom we co-created Buzz events.

Buzz is our dream, our passion and our way of living.

story:
Grapes and Heroes:

Winemakers of the Cinque Terre

 

The Cinque Terre in northwest Italy has won the hearts of millions of travelers the world over. What very few visitors realize is that this area is much more than just five colorful villages dotting a picturesque stretch of the Italian Riviera; the true heart and heritage of this region are found on its steep hillsides in its terraced vineyards.  But these terraces⁠—and the dry stone walls that support them⁠—are crumbling.

 

 

The Cinque Terre was hit hard by incessant and intense storms in the fall of 2019.  These back-to-back weather fronts poured torrential rain on the region, saturating the land and causing the collapse of countless dry stone walls.  It will take years to repair the damage, but restoring them is imperative: these walls provide structural support to an already fragile region.  

 

 

These walls are not just a scenic feature of the landscape, they are the backbone of the Cinque Terre, keeping it erect and preventing it from washing to the sea. 

The responsibility of rebuilding these walls falls squarely—and weighs heavily—on the shoulders of those who work the land: its winemakers.

 

 

“At this rate, the walls that collapse will always be greater than the number we can rebuild.  Making matters worse are the prohibitive costs involved, especially considering we are micro vintners," says Riccardo Fino, winemaker and President of the Riomaggiore Vintners Association."The Cinque Terre National Park has recognized the problem and has earmarked resources specifically for the dry stone walls.  But even with those, and other funds that arrive from the EU for rural development, it’s just not enough for this monumental task.  The future of the Cinque Terre is in the hands of those who are able to assist us.”

 

While increasingly violent storms with unprecedented rainfall are a huge threat to the integrity of the walls, there's another factor that leads to their demise: neglect.  Ancestors of the Cinque Terre built an astonishing 3,560 miles of dry stone retaining walls by hand, thus creating the terraces which provided—and still provide—essential space for agriculture.  In the past, every bit of hillside in the region was cultivated, primarily with vineyards but also with olive and lemon groves. This was a community of farmers. 

If you look at the hills surrounding the Cinque Terre villages today you can easily see that much of the land has been abandoned.  Rather than crops, the overwhelming majority of the terraces are overgrown with Mediterranean brush, brambles and trees. 

 

 

In the 1800s over 3,400 acres of land were farmed in the Cinque Terre.  Today the number has dropped to just over 250 acres—a staggering decline.  When these terraces are abandoned and the walls fall into disrepair they will eventually collapse, increasing the risk of landslide exponentially. 

 

 

Why have so many terraces and walls been abandoned you might wonder?  Farming here is physically demanding and historically it provided a meager income; many locals left behind their agricultural origins in search of easier and more profitable work.

 

 

Italians use the term viticoltura eroica (heroic viticulture) to describe winegrowers who work in particularly challenging conditions. This could not be more true than in the Cinque Terre where the centuries-old vineyards are rooted on narrow terraces carved out of the cliffs and steep hillsides. Working the land atop the dry stone walls, which have been pieced together like a giant artisan puzzle without the use of cement or mortar, is not for the faint of heart.

 

Today the heroic winemakers of the Cinque Terre are the true caretakers and guardians of the land.  Their dry stone walls help to maintain balance in this incredibly vulnerable landscape and are absolutely critical to the longevity of the Cinque Terre.  

 

  • Without the wine growers, there would be no one to monitor or repair the walls.  
  • Without the walls, there would be no Cinque Terre.

 

 

 

The Cinque Terre is a

UNESCO World Heritage Site

 

 

In addition to their critical role as a support system for the region, these dry stone walls are the very thing that prompted the Cinque Terre to be named a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1997. 

UNESCO declares this region:

"A remarkable cultural landscape created by human endeavor over a millennium in a rugged and dramatic natural landscape.  It represents the harmonious interaction between people and nature to produce a landscape of exceptional quality."

It is imperative that we regard the dry stone walls and the terraces they form as an important part of the world's patrimony and that we protect and maintain them as such.

 

 

 

The Grapes & Heroes Campaign

 

     

    Inspired by the enduring spirit of farmers in the Cinque Terre, “Grapes & Heroes” began as a photographic project that aimed to explore and document local winemakers' specific challenges, hopes and success stories. 

    The project has evolved into this crowdfunding campaign to assist a group of Cinque Terre winemakers in their wall building quest.

     

    • The goal of this crowdfunding campaign is to offset the winemakers' ongoing and ever-increasing costs associated with building and maintaining the dry stone walls. 
    • Although some public funding is available (and appreciated!) unfortunately it will never be enough.  This campaign aims to fill the gap between those funds and the actual wall building costs incurred by the winemakers. 
    • Your contribution, no matter the size, will make a difference. 

     

     

     

    Let's crunch some numbers

    Because the terraces on which the vineyards are located are narrow and steep and in such rugged and remote locations, the most cost-effective way to deliver rocks for building the walls is by helicopter.  But helicopters charge by the minute and with the clock ticking, costs soar.  It's no surprise that building and maintaining the walls is a financial burden on the Cinque Terre winemakers, who are defined as micro agricultural enterprises meaning they have equally small resources.

     

     

     

     

    You can MAKE A DIFFERENCE

    This is your chance to be involved, firsthand, in the reconstruction of the dry stone walls that safeguard the Cinque Terre and make its landscape so unique.  

    Contribute.  

    Purchase a perk.  

    And equally as important, please help us spread the word. There are a whole lot of people who love the Cinque Terre... we could really use your help in reaching them! Like our page on Facebook. Follow us on Instagram. Share the heck out of this INDIEGOGO page.  The more exposure we can get, the more walls we can save!  

    We have set an initial financial goal that is large, but our secret goal is to raise much, much  more.  Once we've paid expenses like the platform commission and shipping fees, every cent raised will be made available to the winemakers to help offset the costs of maintaining their extensive network (we're talking miles and miles) of dry stone walls in the region.  Your participation and support for this campaign will help ensure that the Cinque Terre is here for generations to come.

    Grazie mille!

      #savethewalls5terre #nowallsno5terre

       

       

      The Winemakers

      Funds raised in this campaign will be divided between four winemakers, all based within the municipality of Riomaggiore (which encompasses the villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Volastra and Groppo).  Collectively the four winemakers cultivate 15 acres of land, produce 27,400 bottles of Cinque Terre wine per year and maintain miles and miles of dry stone walls. The winemakers are:  

       

      Riccardo Fino and Davide Bordone, Azienda Agricola Fino Riccardo and Azienda Agricola Bordone Davide

      Long-time friends turned parallel business owners, Riccardo and Davide share a love for the land and their respective villages (Riomaggiore and Manarola).

       

      Heydi Bonanini, Azienda Agricola Possa

      A full-time farmer and winemaker from Riomaggiore, Heydi's heartstrings are attached to his family's vineyard located on the spectacular cliffs of Possaitara.

       

      Alessandro Crovara, Azienda Agricola Cantina Crovara

      Working in his Manarola vineyard and cantina is a family affair for Alessandro, who hopes to pass down his passion for winemaking to his young son.

       

       

      The Team 

      This crowdfunding project is the brainchild of Italian expat photographer, Alessandra Spairani (England).  In collaboration with Karin Mallory (USA), Amy Inman (Cinque Terre) and Claudia Cappo (USA). Despite living across the globe, their collaboration created this campaign.  

      100% volunteer.  And 100% inspired by their love of the region.

      Many, many thanks to our pro bono Crowdfunding Consultant, Alexandra Korey of ArtTrav (Florence). 

       

       

      Perks

      We have gathered perks that are truly unique. 

      You will not find them anywhere else. 

      It is incredibly difficult to purchase wines produced in the Cinque Terre outside of the Cinque Terre.  We’re offering vouchers for a whole lot of wine! Alessandra’s photos are limited edition. The logo for the t-shirts was designed specifically for this campaign by a local artist in Riomaggiore.  GiGi Guides by Italian Fix are an invaluable resource.  And the tours, picnics, wine tastings, hikes and drystone wall experiences are truly one of a kind!  

      For those wishing to lend a hand to the cause but not wanting something tangible in return, we offer digital thank you postcards as well as contribution corks that we will use to create a gratitude mosaic (which will then hang in one of our winemaker's cantinas).  

      BONUS: For those purchasing other perks, when you check out you will be given the opportunity to "add on" a contribution cork at the discounted price of €10!

       

      Postcards 

      • Grazie mille digital postcard (€10)

       

      Thanks for supporting our campaign. Your contribution is appreciated!  Keep your eyes peeled .... we will email a digital Grapes & Heroes postcard with an image of the Cinque Terre.

      xoxo

      Fine print:  Postcards will be emailed within 4 weeks of our campaign conclusion date.

       

      • Set of 5 postcards (€65)

       

      A set of five original blank postcards with images from the Cinque Terre/Liguria by photographer Alessandra Spairani. There are five different sets to choose from.  Each set contains 5 individual images in A6 format, printed on premium paper (350 gsm).  View the images by clicking here, then choose your preference:

      1) Grapes

      2) Summer days

      3) Mare Nostrum

      4) Cinque Terre

      5) Wish you were here

      Fine print:  Postcards will be shipped within 6 weeks of our campaign conclusion date. Please note that worldwide shipping expenses are included in the cost of the perk. 

       

       

      Contribution cork

       

      • Contribution cork (€35)

       

      A small gesture multiplied by lots of people can make a BIG IMPACT.  That's the idea behind our contribution cork.   Those who sponsor a cork will get to make a difference AND be part of the big picture, quite literally!  We will personalize a cork with your name and country before adding it to a corkboard mosaic which will hang proudly in one of the cantinas. We will send a photo of the final masterpiece after its completion.  The mosaic will be a constant reminder to the winemakers of the global support they received in their wall building quest!

      (Image provided by Wine Cork Designs).

      *Please note that this is not a shippable perk, it is declared as such only to collect your name and country of origin from the Indiegogo platform so that we can personalize your cork.

       

      T-Shirts 

       

      ​

      • T-shirt (€50)

       

      Local Riomaggiore artist, Stefano Tassara, has created original artwork exclusively for this campaign (you won't find this logo anywhere else!).  The image seen above will be printed on the front of black 100% organic cotton t-shirts.  On the back you'll find: "Without the winemakers there would be no walls. Without the walls there would be no Cinque Terre." When you wear this shirt you can remind others of the importance of the dry stone walls in the Cinque Terre with the added bonus of knowing that you helped make a difference in this beautiful corner of the world.  We have sourced the t-shirts from ethical producers. They cost a bit more, but we could not in good conscience offer products produced in sweatshops.  Be sure to choose your t-shirt size and style preference (men's/unisex or women's cut and size S, M, L or XL).

      Fine Print: As soon as the campaign has ended, t-shirts will be printed and they will ship as soon as they are ready.  We will keep in touch to update you on progress. Please note that worldwide shipping expenses are included in the cost of the perk.  

       

      Photographs 

       

      • Limited edition, signed and numbered 12"x 16" print (€95, 150 offered)

       

      Signed and numbered limited edition 12" x 16" print of "Il Fruttaio" by Alessandra Spairani, winner of the Errazuriz Wine Photographer of the Year 2019 - Produce award.  This beautiful print shows the grapes hanging to dry (which will later be used to make the Cinque Terre's prized Sciacchetrà wine). Each giclée print is made on archival art paper in a professional printing lab.  The image was taken during I Magnati's 2018 harvest.

      Fine Print: This perk will be shipped within 6 weeks of our campaign conclusion date.  Please note that worldwide shipping expenses are included in the cost of the perk.  

       

      Vouchers for Signed Bottles of Cinque Terre Wine

       

      • Voucher for one signed bottle of Cinque Terre white wine (€200, 504 offered)
      • Voucher for three signed bottles of Cinque Terre white wine (€550, 116 offered) 
      • Voucher for six signed bottles of Cinque Terre white wine (€1000, 33 0ffered)​
      • Voucher for one signed bottle of Sciacchetrà (€600, 240 offered) 

       

      The Cinque Terre's traditional heritage wine is a dry white wine made with three varieties of grapes: Bosco, Albarolo and Vermentino.   These grapes are grown in vineyards within the national park, surrounding the villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso.  Because production is limited due to obvious geographical restrictions,  Cinque Terre wine is difficult to find outside of this area.  As described in Bella Vita Travels, "The dry white wine is a straw colored, light bodied wine. Its main characteristics are its fresh acidic bite and interesting minerality. Within the glass, you can smell aromas of the surrounding lemon trees and wild herbs. You can vaguely taste a salinity from the craggy rocks in which the roots grow and the salt air surrounding the plants." 

      All bottles purchased through the Grapes & Heroes crowdfunding campaign will arrive signed by the winemaker...  making them truly special!  

       

       

       

      The pride of the Cinque Terre is its sweet, amber-colored Sciacchetrà dessert wine (pronounced shock-keh-trah). Why is Sciacchetrà so expensive?  In order to make just one bottle of this sweet wine, an astonishing 45 pounds of fresh grapes are required (these grapes are left to wither to 15 pounds of partially dried ones before being pressed).  During the harvest, winemakers identify the highest quality grapes in their vineyards.  Before choosing them, the sugar content of each individual cluster must be measured to determine if it falls within a specific range.  If the cluster passes this test, it will be cut and hung to dry in a cellar for up to 40 days.  In November it is common to see locals gathered in the cantinas for hours upon end.  What are they doing you might ask? They are removing each partially dried grape from the stem by hand!  Sciacchetrà should age for at least 6 years but good vintages can age 10, 20, even 30 years!  Production is extremely limited which also explains why it is considered precious to locals. It's tradition to open a bottle for special occasions like weddings, baptisms and first communions. Oftentimes when a child is born in the Cinque Terre, a bottle of Sciacchetrà is kept in reserve and only opened on the child's 18th birthday!

      Fine print: For those residing within the U.S., only persons over the age of 21 will be permitted to choose vouchers for perks including alcohol (in other countries it will be the minimum drinking age allowed by law).  Once you are emailed your voucher, you will be instructed on how to redeem your wine. Wine is available for shipping within the United States to every state except UT, AR, MS, AL, DE and RI.  Please note that worldwide shipping expenses are included in the cost of the perk.  However, any potential duty or customs fees (if required by your country) are not.  

       

      Italy Travel Guide Memberships

       

      • Gigi Guides Membership from Italian Fix (special promo rate: €100, normal price €197)

       

      Gigi Guides contains all of the information you need to plan a perfect trip to Rome, Venice, Florence and/or the Cinque Terre, and has been carefully curated by in-the-know-locals.  Your membership gives you access to the most up-to-date recommendations on accommodations, places to eat, things to do and where to go in each city, with additional chapters on the lay of the land (so you can quickly get your bearings), tips and tricks for navigating the area like a pro, and "out of the box" sample itineraries written by residents who will tell you how they would spend a perfect day to make the most of their home turf.  Also included is a bonus section called Plan Your Trip, which covers itinerary planning, what to pack, how to save money on bank fees and currency exchange, how to get around on trains, how to rent a car, and ordering a meal like an Italian.  Gigi Guides is a veritable treasure trove of insider info for DIYers who want the straight goods on how to elevate their trip from run-of-the-mill to out-of-this-world. Each chapter comes with audio, video and pdf options, so you can listen, watch, or read your way to creating the Italian holiday of your dreams.

      Fine print: Within 2 weeks of the end of the campaign you will be emailed instructions on how to redeem this perk.

       

      Wine Tastings

       

      • Voucher for wine tasting for 1-3 people (€250, 30 offered)
      • Voucher for wine tasting for 4-6 people (€500, 30 offered)

       

      Join one of our wine growers for a private tasting in their cantina.  This is a truly intimate experience where you will have the opportunity to see where the magic happens! Our wine grower will explain the process of winemaking in the Cinque Terre and there will be ample time for stories and to answer any questions that you might have.  You'll get to taste his local wine and enjoy Ligurian focaccia and other local treats.  We will contact you directly to coordinate a time that works for you.

      Approximate duration of tasting: 90 minutes

      Fine Print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will be emailed contact information for one of our wine growers.  Together, you will determine a mutually agreeable date and time for your wine tasting. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.  

       

       

      Hands-on Dry Stone Wall Experiences

       

      • 1-day dry stone wall experience with Heydi Bonanini, Azienda Agricola Possa  (€300 for 1-2 people, 10 offered) 
      • 1-day dry stone wall experience with Heydi Bonanini, Azienda Agricola Possa (€500 for up to 4 people, 10 offered)

       

      Heydi will meet you in Riomaggiore and you will travel by car to one of his vineyards. You will spend the day together working on the dry stone walls.  You will learn firsthand the process of building these walls.  Working in the vineyard provides a clear understanding of the never-ending and grueling daily efforts that are required to produce wine in the Cinque Terre. Digging, carrying, cleaning, rebuilding—all of the work is done by hand.  An informal lunch (focaccia, panini or farinata) and drinks will be provided.  At the end of the day you will travel back to Riomaggiore by car.

      Fine print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will receive an email with Heydi's contact information.  Together you will determine a mutually agreeable date and time to redeem this perk. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.  You will be required to sign a waiver before participating.

       

      Panoramic Hilltop Picnic 

       

      • Picnic for two arranged by Cinque Terre Insider (€450, 4 offered) 
      • Picnic for four arranged by Cinque Terre Insider (€900, 1 offered)

       

      Perfect for those wanting a special moment off the beaten path, this experience features stunning views and Cinque Terre wine.  A driver will pick you up in Riomaggiore and drop you off at the trailhead for the village's Nostra Signora di Montenero sanctuary.  From there you will hitch a ride on the monorail up the hill and through the vineyards (trust me, this is a big deal as the monorail is usually used exclusively for religious festivities or by the wine growers themselves).  Once you've arrived to the top, you'll find a picnic blanket set up with all the fixings for a lovely aperitivo with local specialties and chilled Cinque Terre wine from one of our wine growers.  When you're done you can return to the village the same way you came (monorail and driver) or if you prefer you can complete the experience by walking down the historic Via Grande trail back to Riomaggiore (which takes approximately 45 minutes, proper footwear is required). Heads up: The monorail is not recommended for those with a fear of heights. While it travels at a snail's pace it does scale its way up the steep hillside—let's just say, it's exhilarating! (Picnic organized by Amy Inman,  Cinque Terre Insider.)

      Fine print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will receive an email with Amy's  contact information.  Together you will determine a mutually agreeable date and time to redeem this perk. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.  You will be required to sign a waiver before participating.

       

      Hiking Adventure 

       

      • Hiking adventure (Monte Le Croci loop) for two people with Christine and Nicola from Cinque Terre Trekking (€220, 3 offered)

       

      We believe that the best way to experience the Cinque Terre is on foot.  We’ll take you hiking on a recently recovered farmer’s trail, where we’ve found the remains of several old cableways, uncovered stone steps and cobblestones along the path and discovered ancient dry stone walls in the forest at elevations as high as 700 meters (2,296 feet) above sea level. From Monte Le Croci you’ll be rewarded with a 180 degree view of the Cinque Terre, spanning from the Apuan Alps to the promontory of Portofino. 

      Meeting Point: Cinque Terre Trekking,  Manarola
      Meeting time: 8:00am
      Hike time: 2 hours
      Distance: 4 kilometers/approx. 2.5 miles
      Elevation gain: 400 meters/1,312 feet
      Difficulty: moderate, hiking or trail running shoes are required

      Fine print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will receive an email with Christine's contact information. Together you will determine a mutually agreeable date to redeem this perk. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.  You will be required to sign a waiver before participating.

       

      Three Night Private Tour in Riomaggiore

       

      • 3-night tour for two people with Karin Mallory Presents: Intimate Trips to Italy  (€3000, 2 offered)

       

      Two guests are invited to join me, Karin Mallory ( Karin Mallory Presents: Intimate trips to Italy), for three nights in Riomaggiore. This perk includes accommodations for three nights in Riomaggiore, two 3-day Cinque Terre Card train and hiking passes, a visit to Riccardo Fino's cantina (with wine tasting), a sunset boat tour (weather and sea conditions permitting) and a hike through the vineyards.  Upon arrival I'll meet you at the train station and we will walk together to your accommodations.  Then let's explore!  I'll show you my favorite corners of the village, including several prime spots to taste the local wine. Early evening is aperitivo time!  This is one of my favorite Italian traditions where everyone heads out to unwind, catch up, have a drink and a snack and prime their bellies for dinner!  We will decide together what you would like to see and do. I will plan our adventures based on your interests.  If we are able to coordinate schedules, there is also the possibility joining Riccardo and traveling by car to see his vineyards and dry stone walls.  A unique opportunity to see and hike in parts of the Cinque Terre restricted to winemakers.   You are on your own during the evenings, but I am happy to make recommendations or reservations.

      Fine print: Please note that the timing for this tour must be mutually agreed upon.  Karin travels to Italy at least four times a year.  If you'd like to use this perk in 2020 it will need to be booked immediately before or after one of her already booked trips.  Available windows of time in 2020 are April 24-30, July 4-10, October 2-9 or October 27-November 9.  She might be able to accommodate another date in 2020 if you are willing to incur the additional cost of her plane ticket.  Her 2021 trips are not yet scheduled so she is super flexible with dates if you'd like to purchase the perk and use it in 2021. You will be required to sign a waiver before participating.

       

      9-Night Sciacchetrà & Dry Stone Wall Experience

       

      • 9-night Sciacchetrà & Wall Experience for 1 person with Claudia Cappo and the winemakers who produce I Magnati wines (€2,900, 2 offered)

       

      Live like a local for 9 nights in Riomaggiore!  Each fall the cantinas in the Cinque Terre are abuzz with activity.  It's a very important time of year as it is when the region’s specialty wine, Sciacchetrà, is made.  If you peek into any cantina you will see locals gathered, sitting on stools with a bucket in front of them, removing grapes from their stems one by one.  It's a real community effort.  While you are here, you'll get to help!  I will meet you at the train station when you arrive and walk you to your apartment.  After settling in, I will show you around the village and bring you to a local bar for an aperitivo.  You will be here for 9-nights, which is long enough to really get a feel for what it's like to live in the village. We will have 2-3 days in the cantina helping to make Sciacchetrà and 2 days (weather permitting) in the hills helping winemakers Riccardo and Davide rebuild collapsed walls. You will also have several free days to explore the region on your own.  Of course, I am happy to offer suggestions!  This is a unique and once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.  I once asked Riccardo why he did not acquire more land in order to produce larger quantities of wine. He answered me with a profound statement that I could only truly understand after working alongside him for several weeks: “I only have two hands.” Join me for 9 nights as we will serve as extra sets of hands for the winemakers.  Accommodations for 9 nights are included, as is the welcome aperitivo.  I will treat you to coffee on the mornings that we work together and a sack lunch will be provided during cantina and wall maintenance days.  Dates must be somewhat flexible... the exact time will depend on the weather (which impacts the timing of the harvest).  The window of time is usually the end of October through early November.  

      Fine print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will receive an email with Claudia's contact information.  Together you will determine a mutually agreeable time to redeem this perk. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.  You will be required to sign a waiver before participating.

Grapes and Heroes:Winemakers of the Cinque Terre The Cinque Terre in northwest Italy has won the hearts of millions of travelers the world over. What very few visitors realize is that this area is much more than just five colorful villages dotting a picturesque stretch of the Italian Riviera; the true heart and heritage of this region are found on its steep hillsides in its terraced vineyards.  But these terraces⁠—and the dry stone walls that support them⁠—are crumbling.  The Cinque Terre was hit hard by incessant and intense storms in the fall of 2019.  These back-to-back weather fronts poured torrential rain on the region, saturating the land and causing the collapse of countless dry stone walls.  It will take years to repair the damage, but restoring them is imperative: these walls provide structural support to an already fragile region.    These walls are not just a scenic feature of the landscape, they are the backbone of the Cinque Terre, keeping it erect and preventing it from washing to the sea.  The responsibility of rebuilding these walls falls squarely—and weighs heavily—on the shoulders of those who work the land: its winemakers.  “At this rate, the walls that collapse will always be greater than the number we can rebuild.  Making matters worse are the prohibitive costs involved, especially considering we are micro vintners," says Riccardo Fino, winemaker and President of the Riomaggiore Vintners Association."The Cinque Terre National Park has recognized the problem and has earmarked resources specifically for the dry stone walls.  But even with those, and other funds that arrive from the EU for rural development, it’s just not enough for this monumental task.  The future of the Cinque Terre is in the hands of those who are able to assist us.” While increasingly violent storms with unprecedented rainfall are a huge threat to the integrity of the walls, there's another factor that leads to their demise: neglect.  Ancestors of the Cinque Terre built an astonishing 3,560 miles of dry stone retaining walls by hand, thus creating the terraces which provided—and still provide—essential space for agriculture.  In the past, every bit of hillside in the region was cultivated, primarily with vineyards but also with olive and lemon groves. This was a community of farmers. If you look at the hills surrounding the Cinque Terre villages today you can easily see that much of the land has been abandoned.  Rather than crops, the overwhelming majority of the terraces are overgrown with Mediterranean brush, brambles and trees.   In the 1800s over 3,400 acres of land were farmed in the Cinque Terre.  Today the number has dropped to just over 250 acres—a staggering decline.  When these terraces are abandoned and the walls fall into disrepair they will eventually collapse, increasing the risk of landslide exponentially.   Why have so many terraces and walls been abandoned you might wonder?  Farming here is physically demanding and historically it provided a meager income; many locals left behind their agricultural origins in search of easier and more profitable work.  Italians use the term viticoltura eroica (heroic viticulture) to describe winegrowers who work in particularly challenging conditions. This could not be more true than in the Cinque Terre where the centuries-old vineyards are rooted on narrow terraces carved out of the cliffs and steep hillsides. Working the land atop the dry stone walls, which have been pieced together like a giant artisan puzzle without the use of cement or mortar, is not for the faint of heart. Today the heroic winemakers of the Cinque Terre are the true caretakers and guardians of the land.  Their dry stone walls help to maintain balance in this incredibly vulnerable landscape and are absolutely critical to the longevity of the Cinque Terre.   
Without the wine growers, there would be no one to monitor or repair the walls.  
Without the walls, there would be no Cinque Terre.

Share the heck out of this INDIEGOGO page.  The more exposure we can get, the more walls we can save!  We have set an initial financial goal that is large, but our secret goal is to raise much, much  more.  Once we've paid expenses like the platform commission and shipping fees, every cent raised will be made available to the winemakers to help offset the costs of maintaining their extensive network (we're talking miles and miles) of dry stone walls in the region.  Your participation and support for this campaign will help ensure that the Cinque Terre is here for generations to come.Grazie mille! #savethewalls5terre #nowallsno5terre  The WinemakersFunds raised in this campaign will be divided between four winemakers, all based within the municipality of Riomaggiore (which encompasses the villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Volastra and Groppo).  Collectively the four winemakers cultivate 15 acres of land, produce 27,400 bottles of Cinque Terre wine per year and maintain miles and miles of dry stone walls. The winemakers are:   Riccardo Fino and Davide Bordone, Azienda Agricola Fino Riccardo and Azienda Agricola Bordone DavideLong-time friends turned parallel business owners, Riccardo and Davide share a love for the land and their respective villages (Riomaggiore and Manarola). Heydi Bonanini, Azienda Agricola PossaA full-time farmer and winemaker from Riomaggiore, Heydi's heartstrings are attached to his family's vineyard located on the spectacular cliffs of Possaitara. Alessandro Crovara, Azienda Agricola Cantina CrovaraWorking in his Manarola vineyard and cantina is a family affair for Alessandro, who hopes to pass down his passion for winemaking to his young son.  The Team This crowdfunding project is the brainchild of Italian expat photographer, Alessandra Spairani (England).  In collaboration with Karin Mallory (USA), Amy Inman (Cinque Terre) and Claudia Cappo (USA). Despite living across the globe, their collaboration created this campaign.  100% volunteer.  And 100% inspired by their love of the region.Many, many thanks to our pro bono Crowdfunding Consultant, Alexandra Korey of ArtTrav (Florence).   PerksWe have gathered perks that are truly unique. You will not find them anywhere else. It is incredibly difficult to purchase wines produced in the Cinque Terre outside of the Cinque Terre.  We’re offering vouchers for a whole lot of wine! Alessandra’s photos are limited edition. The logo for the t-shirts was designed specifically for this campaign by a local artist in Riomaggiore.  GiGi Guides by Italian Fix are an invaluable resource.  And the tours, picnics, wine tastings, hikes and drystone wall experiences are truly one of a kind!  For those wishing to lend a hand to the cause but not wanting something tangible in return, we offer digital thank you postcards as well as contribution corks that we will use to create a gratitude mosaic (which will then hang in one of our winemaker's cantinas).  BONUS: For those purchasing other perks, when you check out you will be given the opportunity to "add on" a contribution cork at the discounted price of €10! Postcards Grazie mille digital postcard (€10) Thanks for supporting our campaign. Your contribution is appreciated!  Keep your eyes peeled .... we will email a digital Grapes & Heroes postcard with an image of the Cinque Terre.xoxoFine print:  Postcards will be emailed within 4 weeks of our campaign conclusion date. Set of 5 postcards (€65) A set of five original blank postcards with images from the Cinque Terre/Liguria by photographer Alessandra Spairani. There are five different sets to choose from.  Each set contains 5 individual images in A6 format, printed on premium paper (350 gsm).  View the images by clicking here, then choose your preference:1) Grapes2) Summer days3) Mare Nostrum4) Cinque Terre5) Wish you were hereFine print:  Postcards will be shipped within 6 weeks of our campaign conclusion date. Please note that worldwide shipping expenses are included in the cost of the perk.   Contribution cork Contribution cork (€35) A small gesture multiplied by lots of people can make a BIG IMPACT.  That's the idea behind our contribution cork.   Those who sponsor a cork will get to make a difference AND be part of the big picture, quite literally!  We will personalize a cork with your name and country before adding it to a corkboard mosaic which will hang proudly in one of the cantinas. We will send a photo of the final masterpiece after its completion.  The mosaic will be a constant reminder to the winemakers of the global support they received in their wall building quest!(Image provided by Wine Cork Designs).*Please note that this is not a shippable perk, it is declared as such only to collect your name and country of origin from the Indiegogo platform so that we can personalize your cork. T-Shirts  ​T-shirt (€50) Local Riomaggiore artist, Stefano Tassara, has created original artwork exclusively for this campaign (you won't find this logo anywhere else!).  The image seen above will be printed on the front of black 100% organic cotton t-shirts.  On the back you'll find: "Without the winemakers there would be no walls. Without the walls there would be no Cinque Terre." When you wear this shirt you can remind others of the importance of the dry stone walls in the Cinque Terre with the added bonus of knowing that you helped make a difference in this beautiful corner of the world.  We have sourced the t-shirts from ethical producers. They cost a bit more, but we could not in good conscience offer products produced in sweatshops.  Be sure to choose your t-shirt size and style preference (men's/unisex or women's cut and size S, M, L or XL).Fine Print: As soon as the campaign has ended, t-shirts will be printed and they will ship as soon as they are ready.  We will keep in touch to update you on progress. Please note that worldwide shipping expenses are included in the cost of the perk.   Photographs  Limited edition, signed and numbered 12"x 16" print (€95, 150 offered) Signed and numbered limited edition 12" x 16" print of "Il Fruttaio" by Alessandra Spairani, winner of the Errazuriz Wine Photographer of the Year 2019 - Produce award.  This beautiful print shows the grapes hanging to dry (which will later be used to make the Cinque Terre's prized Sciacchetrà wine). Each giclée print is made on archival art paper in a professional printing lab.  The image was taken during I Magnati's 2018 harvest.Fine Print: This perk will be shipped within 6 weeks of our campaign conclusion date.  Please note that worldwide shipping expenses are included in the cost of the perk.   Vouchers for Signed Bottles of Cinque Terre Wine 
Voucher for one signed bottle of Cinque Terre white wine (€200, 504 offered)
Voucher for three signed bottles of Cinque Terre white wine (€550, 116 offered) 
Voucher for six signed bottles of Cinque Terre white wine (€1000, 33 0ffered)​
Voucher for one signed bottle of Sciacchetrà (€600, 240 offered) 
 The Cinque Terre's traditional heritage wine is a dry white wine made with three varieties of grapes: Bosco, Albarolo and Vermentino.   These grapes are grown in vineyards within the national park, surrounding the villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso.  Because production is limited due to obvious geographical restrictions,  Cinque Terre wine is difficult to find outside of this area.  As described in Bella Vita Travels, "The dry white wine is a straw colored, light bodied wine. Its main characteristics are its fresh acidic bite and interesting minerality. Within the glass, you can smell aromas of the surrounding lemon trees and wild herbs. You can vaguely taste a salinity from the craggy rocks in which the roots grow and the salt air surrounding the plants." All bottles purchased through the Grapes & Heroes crowdfunding campaign will arrive signed by the winemaker...  making them truly special!     The pride of the Cinque Terre is its sweet, amber-colored Sciacchetrà dessert wine (pronounced shock-keh-trah). Why is Sciacchetrà so expensive?  In order to make just one bottle of this sweet wine, an astonishing 45 pounds of fresh grapes are required (these grapes are left to wither to 15 pounds of partially dried ones before being pressed).  During the harvest, winemakers identify the highest quality grapes in their vineyards.  Before choosing them, the sugar content of each individual cluster must be measured to determine if it falls within a specific range.  If the cluster passes this test, it will be cut and hung to dry in a cellar for up to 40 days.  In November it is common to see locals gathered in the cantinas for hours upon end.  What are they doing you might ask? They are removing each partially dried grape from the stem by hand!  Sciacchetrà should age for at least 6 years but good vintages can age 10, 20, even 30 years!  Production is extremely limited which also explains why it is considered precious to locals. It's tradition to open a bottle for special occasions like weddings, baptisms and first communions. Oftentimes when a child is born in the Cinque Terre, a bottle of Sciacchetrà is kept in reserve and only opened on the child's 18th birthday!Fine print: For those residing within the U.S., only persons over the age of 21 will be permitted to choose vouchers for perks including alcohol (in other countries it will be the minimum drinking age allowed by law).  Once you are emailed your voucher, you will be instructed on how to redeem your wine. Wine is available for shipping within the United States to every state except UT, AR, MS, AL, DE and RI.  Please note that worldwide shipping expenses are included in the cost of the perk.  However, any potential duty or customs fees (if required by your country) are not.   Italy Travel Guide Memberships Gigi Guides Membership from Italian Fix (special promo rate: €100, normal price €197) Gigi Guides contains all of the information you need to plan a perfect trip to Rome, Venice, Florence and/or the Cinque Terre, and has been carefully curated by in-the-know-locals.  Your membership gives you access to the most up-to-date recommendations on accommodations, places to eat, things to do and where to go in each city, with additional chapters on the lay of the land (so you can quickly get your bearings), tips and tricks for navigating the area like a pro, and "out of the box" sample itineraries written by residents who will tell you how they would spend a perfect day to make the most of their home turf.  Also included is a bonus section called Plan Your Trip, which covers itinerary planning, what to pack, how to save money on bank fees and currency exchange, how to get around on trains, how to rent a car, and ordering a meal like an Italian.  Gigi Guides is a veritable treasure trove of insider info for DIYers who want the straight goods on how to elevate their trip from run-of-the-mill to out-of-this-world. Each chapter comes with audio, video and pdf options, so you can listen, watch, or read your way to creating the Italian holiday of your dreams.Fine print: Within 2 weeks of the end of the campaign you will be emailed instructions on how to redeem this perk. Wine Tastings 
Voucher for wine tasting for 1-3 people (€250, 30 offered)
Voucher for wine tasting for 4-6 people (€500, 30 offered)
 Join one of our wine growers for a private tasting in their cantina.  This is a truly intimate experience where you will have the opportunity to see where the magic happens! Our wine grower will explain the process of winemaking in the Cinque Terre and there will be ample time for stories and to answer any questions that you might have.  You'll get to taste his local wine and enjoy Ligurian focaccia and other local treats.  We will contact you directly to coordinate a time that works for you.Approximate duration of tasting: 90 minutesFine Print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will be emailed contact information for one of our wine growers.  Together, you will determine a mutually agreeable date and time for your wine tasting. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.    Hands-on Dry Stone Wall Experiences 
1-day dry stone wall experience with Heydi Bonanini, Azienda Agricola Possa  (€300 for 1-2 people, 10 offered) 
1-day dry stone wall experience with Heydi Bonanini, Azienda Agricola Possa (€500 for up to 4 people, 10 offered)
 Heydi will meet you in Riomaggiore and you will travel by car to one of his vineyards. You will spend the day together working on the dry stone walls.  You will learn firsthand the process of building these walls.  Working in the vineyard provides a clear understanding of the never-ending and grueling daily efforts that are required to produce wine in the Cinque Terre. Digging, carrying, cleaning, rebuilding—all of the work is done by hand.  An informal lunch (focaccia, panini or farinata) and drinks will be provided.  At the end of the day you will travel back to Riomaggiore by car.Fine print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will receive an email with Heydi's contact information.  Together you will determine a mutually agreeable date and time to redeem this perk. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.  You will be required to sign a waiver before participating. Panoramic Hilltop Picnic  
Picnic for two arranged by Cinque Terre Insider (€450, 4 offered) 
Picnic for four arranged by Cinque Terre Insider (€900, 1 offered)
 Perfect for those wanting a special moment off the beaten path, this experience features stunning views and Cinque Terre wine.  A driver will pick you up in Riomaggiore and drop you off at the trailhead for the village's Nostra Signora di Montenero sanctuary.  From there you will hitch a ride on the monorail up the hill and through the vineyards (trust me, this is a big deal as the monorail is usually used exclusively for religious festivities or by the wine growers themselves).  Once you've arrived to the top, you'll find a picnic blanket set up with all the fixings for a lovely aperitivo with local specialties and chilled Cinque Terre wine from one of our wine growers.  When you're done you can return to the village the same way you came (monorail and driver) or if you prefer you can complete the experience by walking down the historic Via Grande trail back to Riomaggiore (which takes approximately 45 minutes, proper footwear is required). Heads up: The monorail is not recommended for those with a fear of heights. While it travels at a snail's pace it does scale its way up the steep hillside—let's just say, it's exhilarating! (Picnic organized by Amy Inman,  Cinque Terre Insider.)Fine print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will receive an email with Amy's  contact information.  Together you will determine a mutually agreeable date and time to redeem this perk. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.  You will be required to sign a waiver before participating. Hiking Adventure  Hiking adventure (Monte Le Croci loop) for two people with Christine and Nicola from Cinque Terre Trekking (€220, 3 offered) We believe that the best way to experience the Cinque Terre is on foot.  We’ll take you hiking on a recently recovered farmer’s trail, where we’ve found the remains of several old cableways, uncovered stone steps and cobblestones along the path and discovered ancient dry stone walls in the forest at elevations as high as 700 meters (2,296 feet) above sea level. From Monte Le Croci you’ll be rewarded with a 180 degree view of the Cinque Terre, spanning from the Apuan Alps to the promontory of Portofino. Meeting Point: Cinque Terre Trekking,  ManarolaMeeting time: 8:00amHike time: 2 hoursDistance: 4 kilometers/approx. 2.5 milesElevation gain: 400 meters/1,312 feetDifficulty: moderate, hiking or trail running shoes are requiredFine print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will receive an email with Christine's contact information. Together you will determine a mutually agreeable date to redeem this perk. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.  You will be required to sign a waiver before participating. Three Night Private Tour in Riomaggiore 3-night tour for two people with Karin Mallory Presents: Intimate Trips to Italy  (€3000, 2 offered) Two guests are invited to join me, Karin Mallory ( Karin Mallory Presents: Intimate trips to Italy), for three nights in Riomaggiore. This perk includes accommodations for three nights in Riomaggiore, two 3-day Cinque Terre Card train and hiking passes, a visit to Riccardo Fino's cantina (with wine tasting), a sunset boat tour (weather and sea conditions permitting) and a hike through the vineyards.  Upon arrival I'll meet you at the train station and we will walk together to your accommodations.  Then let's explore!  I'll show you my favorite corners of the village, including several prime spots to taste the local wine. Early evening is aperitivo time!  This is one of my favorite Italian traditions where everyone heads out to unwind, catch up, have a drink and a snack and prime their bellies for dinner!  We will decide together what you would like to see and do. I will plan our adventures based on your interests.  If we are able to coordinate schedules, there is also the possibility joining Riccardo and traveling by car to see his vineyards and dry stone walls.  A unique opportunity to see and hike in parts of the Cinque Terre restricted to winemakers.   You are on your own during the evenings, but I am happy to make recommendations or reservations.Fine print: Please note that the timing for this tour must be mutually agreed upon.  Karin travels to Italy at least four times a year.  If you'd like to use this perk in 2020 it will need to be booked immediately before or after one of her already booked trips.  Available windows of time in 2020 are April 24-30, July 4-10, October 2-9 or October 27-November 9.  She might be able to accommodate another date in 2020 if you are willing to incur the additional cost of her plane ticket.  Her 2021 trips are not yet scheduled so she is super flexible with dates if you'd like to purchase the perk and use it in 2021. You will be required to sign a waiver before participating. 9-Night Sciacchetrà & Dry Stone Wall Experience 9-night Sciacchetrà & Wall Experience for 1 person with Claudia Cappo and the winemakers who produce I Magnati wines (€2,900, 2 offered) Live like a local for 9 nights in Riomaggiore!  Each fall the cantinas in the Cinque Terre are abuzz with activity.  It's a very important time of year as it is when the region’s specialty wine, Sciacchetrà, is made.  If you peek into any cantina you will see locals gathered, sitting on stools with a bucket in front of them, removing grapes from their stems one by one.  It's a real community effort.  While you are here, you'll get to help!  I will meet you at the train station when you arrive and walk you to your apartment.  After settling in, I will show you around the village and bring you to a local bar for an aperitivo.  You will be here for 9-nights, which is long enough to really get a feel for what it's like to live in the village. We will have 2-3 days in the cantina helping to make Sciacchetrà and 2 days (weather permitting) in the hills helping winemakers Riccardo and Davide rebuild collapsed walls. You will also have several free days to explore the region on your own.  Of course, I am happy to offer suggestions!  This is a unique and once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.  I once asked Riccardo why he did not acquire more land in order to produce larger quantities of wine. He answered me with a profound statement that I could only truly understand after working alongside him for several weeks: “I only have two hands.” Join me for 9 nights as we will serve as extra sets of hands for the winemakers.  Accommodations for 9 nights are included, as is the welcome aperitivo.  I will treat you to coffee on the mornings that we work together and a sack lunch will be provided during cantina and wall maintenance days.  Dates must be somewhat flexible... the exact time will depend on the weather (which impacts the timing of the harvest).  The window of time is usually the end of October through early November.  Fine print: Within 2 weeks from the end of the campaign you will receive an email with Claudia's contact information.  Together you will determine a mutually agreeable time to redeem this perk. Perk must be redeemed in 2020.  You will be required to sign a waiver before participating.

story:
STRETCH GOAL: £4500 UNLOCKED!

This will allow up to give a free space for all four days to a marginalised or low income creative who wouldn't otherwise be able to afford to go!


PLUS: The next 10 people to donate will get to name one of our Feedback Groups!

Everyone at Ruckus is put into a small feedback group - each named after famous (or lesser known) artists that inspire us. If you are one of the next 10 donors, you can pick a writer, photographer, painter, filmmaker etc of your choice to name one of our hand-picked feedback groups after!

 

 

The Story So Far...

 

We ran the first Ruckus Retreat last year, after seeing a gap in creative events being offered. The way we saw it, these events were either:

- too short

- too focused on listening quietly to panels rather than actually creating

- or too expensive 

 

Ruckus Retreat's aim is to change that with a 4-day event that is interactive, community-driven, and affordable. 

The retreat comprises of 4 main types of session:

- Workshops/discussion sessions around a wide range of creative disciplines

- Personalised feedback groups based on what feedback will be useful to you specifically

- Evening activities, including an open mic

- Free creative time to spend however you like

 

Lat year was an incredible success - with 100% of attendees saying in an anonymous feedback survey that they would attend again and recommend it to a friend. 

 

This crowdfunding campaign will allow us to put Ruckus Retreat on in 2019 by helping pay for vital expenses like our workshop leaders, insurance, materials, and payment fees - while keeping ticket prices as low as possible for attendees.

 

The Perks!

We're hoping that our perks will allow you to experience a little bit of Ruckus magic, even if you can't make it to Wales for the Retreat!

They include:

- 20+ pages of Creative PDF Printables

- A copy of the Ruckus Zine with art and writing from the 2018 attendees

- Creative mentorship sessions

- The opportunity to name our feedback groups after your favourite artist

- Professional editing of your written work

- and lots more!

 

 

The Impact

 

Last year Ruckus Retreat was able to provide a haven for over 70 creatives to explore their practice, try new things, develop their projects, and find fellow artists to collaborate with.  20% of tickets last year went to low-income and marginalised participants through free sponsored tickets from incredible generous creative individuals and organisations (if you would like to sponsor a ticket this year see below!).

We saw new theatre shows, podcasts, comics, poems and more come out of the retreat - as well as a fantastic Facebook community and a sense of confidence and drive in our attendees.

We know Ruckus Retreat 2019 can be even better - and are hoping you'll help us get there!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in sponsoring a place for a low-income or marginalised participant this year - please email us at collectiveruckus@gmail.com

If you can't afford to contribute to this crowdfunder but want to help - please share the link far and wide and tell as many people as possible about it - every pound counts!

 

What if we don’t raise the money?
- £4000 is the minimum we need to put Ruckus on 
- If we don’t raise that we will cancel the event and refund the full amount 
- We are also looking for funding elsewhere - so will be looking for £4000 across the different methods

- If we raise more we'll be adding stretch goals including being able to add workshops, increase the capacity of the events, and add more perks!

story:
For a sprawling global region that holds more than 6 million people, the city still lacks music programming that reflects the long-storied multicultural and international flavor of the city. You wouldn't believe the level of world-class global music acts that have a hard time finding shows in DC and end up bypassing us altogether.

Flash of the Spirit is Multiflora Productions annual month-long DIY global music festival that happens across multiple venues in Washington DC during the month of October. Its mission is to present emerging and remarkable international musicians from abroad as well as local musicians from our diverse immigrant communities to celebrate their stories, heritage, and cultures through their music.

Multiflora Productions was started about 6 years ago as an arts agency for expanding the reach of traditional and genre-bending roots musicians through artist management, event marketing, and tour booking.We remain particularly interested in presenting traditional folkloric music as well as working with artists who explore and experiment with traditional music styles to create something that is at once connected to the past, expressed in the present, and imagined positively in the future.

As you might imagine, the costs of running a festival can be staggering, especially involving multiple venues. This year we have groups coming from Cuba, Colombia, China, Ukraine, Ethiopia, Ecuador, Mali, Peru and Puerto Rico. Several groups based in the US will be traveling to here from across the country as well as local groups based in the DC area. While we are hoping to cover most their performance fees by charging admission there are still many costs involved like lodging, transportation and basic hospitality. We want to keep the ticket prices low to keep the concerts accessible and  your donations will help us offset these costs as well as help us pay for other productions costs like venue fees, paying for PA equipment and sound engineers as well as marketing costs so we can reach as many people in the region as possible. We are also be showing four films with post-screening discussions and plan on paying for screening fees and providing honorariums to the filmmakers and guest speakers.

Beyond helping us with the festival budget, your contribution is essential to making the festival a reality for the city, the artists, and the community. Currently we have no institutional support or endowments so the festival is completely independent and reliant upon public support. Your support. By making it happen this year it will help us get the attention and support of the city, local business, and arts organizations and then the festival will continue to grow year after year, you can help this become an annual city tradition.

For the full schedule of the festival visit this link HERE

Below is a list of just some of our confirmed groups for this year's festival. Just click on the name to learn more about these amazing groups!

Fendika (Ethiopia)

Anbessa Orchestra (Israel/Brooklyn)

Mamadou Kelly (Mali)

Rio Mira (Equador/Peru)

Septeto Santiaguero (Cuba)

Kombilesa Mi (Colombia)

Orquesta el Macabeo (Puerto Rico)

Zhou Family Band (China)

Takht-Al Nagham (Syria/NYC)

Kurbasy (Ukraine)

Radio Jarocho (Mexico/NYC)

and many more!
