(pour les versions portugaise et francaise , faites défiler vers le bas)

 

 

A cultural Space

A tea room and Cafe

A multilingual bookstore

A boutique of fine paper related products

A curiosity cabinet

An artist studio

 

 

 

In the heart of Lisbon, Portugal, near the majestic Tagus river, between the historic districts of Belem and Alfama.

 

 

 

My name is Sandrine and I am an artist. My work, strongly rooted in the practice of drawing, has been exhibited in numerous contemporary art events in Asia, Europe and the United States including Singapore, Shenzhen and Macao Biennials, Kenpoku Art in Japan, Ke Art center in Shanghai, the ARCO museum in Seoul, the Palais de Tokyo in Paris, the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts in San Francisco, and The Mistake Room in Los Angeles.

I am French of Vietnamese origin and I live in Lisbon.

 

After graduating at the Fine Arts School in Nice, I lived in Bordeaux for a few years and then moved to Vietnam, where I stayed for 15 years. That´s where I gave birth to my two gems Kim-Ly and Lou-Andrea, and where I met my partner Nico, who writes fabulous game scripts.

In 2019, the four of us decided to come and settle in Lisbon. I received a research grant which enabled me to study simultaneously Portuguese azulejo and Vietnamese mosaic from a historical and psychological angle.

 

I deeply enjoy the time I spend working alone in my studio but I also like to provoke meetings, discussions and create events. For 20 years I have been organizing exhibitions, concerts, performances and lectures. I launched two art magazines, set up and ran a museum for 3 years, taught art and was a VJ for a few years.

 

 

At the start of this project was the need to find a studio in which I could continue to create combined with the desire to once again run a cultural space to share my passion for art with others. But how can I contemplate its stability without losing myself, while remaining true to my tastes and my convictions? As I looked for ways to make the project financially sustainable, I turned towards my long-lasting interest for fine stationery products. 

 

As far as I can remember I have always been fascinated by stationery, ever on the lookout for new textures, sizes, and weights of paper, notebooks, pencils and brushes… When I travel to a new city, a new country, stationery and craft paper workshops are the first places I rush to because I know they may conceal real treasures.

 

I also look for second-hand booksellers because if a book conveys as much emotion as knowledge, it is even more true for a second-hand book. It conjures up the idea of ​​a transmission of knowledge, not so much exhaustive as flowing from one individual to another; the idea of ​​meeting and sharing but in another way ...

 

Then, my wanderings usually take me to flea markets and museums or galleries ... And if I stay a little longer, I will look for a café whose atmosphere will make me want to come back, settle and work.

 

Hence I decided to gather all those things that nourish, soothe and amaze me in a project, both modest yet ambitious, and which above all mirrors me most.

 

 

 

Visitors will be able to discover and acquire artworks created by contemporary artists from all over the world. These artists, either emerging or already established, will all share their same favorite medium, paper.

 

 

 

I will schedule cultural events (lectures on themes related to art and human sciences, artist talks, mini-concerts, video art, short films and documentaries screenings) as well as workshops, art courses and live model sessions which will ensure the income of the place together with the tea room, the bookshop and the sale of stationery products.

 

 

 

The tea room / café section will provide, in addition to classic coffees and juices, a selection of Asian teas - each with its own little story to discover, “ca-phe sua da” (the Vietnamese ice coffee with sweet condensed milk), and snacks to share in an exotic atmosphere.

 

 

 

The multilingual bookstore section (mainly Portuguese, French and English) will consist of second-hand books, including a selection of essential works for artists and researchers in art and human sciences.

 

 

 

The stationery corner will mainly display artisanal papers from Asia (India, Nepal, Vietnam, Bhutan, Japan, Thailand), Mexico and Portugal, but also notebooks, pencils and brushes as well as paper-related gift items.

 


 

 

It will also be my daily studio where I will gladly welcome visitors to see and discuss my work in progress and my collection of curiosities (ritual objects collected or created by myself); a way for them to access to art in a simple and friendly way.

 

 

 

As a professional artist, I have chosen this name keeping in mind the titles I give to my exhibitions. While reflecting my passion for curiosity cabinets, my taste for the mysterious and for exoticism, it also refers to my origins (Thao is the diminutive of Thu-Thao, my Vietnamese name), the places where I used to live (France and Vietnam) and where I live today (“o gabinete” means the cabinet in Portuguese).

All these influences will mingle to create the atmosphere of the space.

 

 

 

On a micro-scale yes, maybe, because what matters to me, beyond making art and its process accessible, is to show paper differently. I’d like to invite people to reconsider its commodity status and start seeing it as a precious object, carefully manufactured by craftsmen with a unique knowledge and not as something consumable that can be heedlessly wasted. I believe in a reasoned approach to dematerialization and its benefits for the environment. Considering paper from this unusual angle means taking part in one´s own way in this powerful march towards more sustainable practices... And if o Gabinete de Madame Thao may not radically change the world, I hope it will contribute to make it more bearable by offering opportunities to wonder and moments to share.

 

 

In order to spread the funding for the project I have divided the objectives of this campaign into 3 levels.

 

Objective 1: 18 000 euros

This would make the launch of the space possible, but with a reduced activity (workshop, tea room / café, some events or workshops)

This amount will finance:

Legal and company establishment costs (2,035 euros)

3 months deposit for a rent of 850 euros (2,550 euros)

Signage, communication elements (2,500 euros)

Interior design, equipment, furniture (7 500 euros)

Stock of material for the tea room / café, events, workshops activity (1000 euros)

+ Crowdfunding platform commission,  rewards production, shipping costs

 

Or

Objective 2 : 22 000 euros (objective 1 + 4 000 euros)

This would allow the launch of the place with all its activities thanks to an additional amount of 4,000 euros.

The additional amount will finance:

The first stock of books and stationery products (3400 euros)

+ Crowdfunding platform commission, rewards production, shipping costs

 

Or

Objective 3 : 28 500 euros (objective 2 + 6 500 euros)

This will allow optimistically the launch of the space with all its activities and a starting cash box of 6 000 euros.

This cash box will enable to back up the project over a few months after its launch and participate in

Social charges (150 euros / month)

Accounting fees (150 euros / month)

Rent + charges (1 000 euros / month)

Salary of a sales assistant (630 euros / month)

+ Crowdfunding platform commission, rewards production, shipping costs

 

And if…

objective 3 has been exceeded, the additional funds will enable to give another dimension to the programming by offering a greater choice of quality events animated by local and international artists and speakers.

 

Without you this project will only remain a dream, so I'm counting on you!

 

 

As a reward, I offer limited reproductions of my artworks and the opportunity to acquire originals for the most generous ;-) Please contact me if you wish you receive a pdf with large images of all the perks.

For 10 euros and more: the reproduction on a postcard, signed, of "The Invisible Worm That Flies in the Night" (a drawing I made last year)

For 35 euros and more: a catalog compiling a selection of my drawings made over the last ten years, dedicated and signed

For 75 euros and more: your social media ID profile portrait

For 100 euros and more: a reproduction of "Entering the Ruins of the Motley Cow" (a drawing-watercolor I created in 2014) in limited edition (edition of 100 numbered and signed copies) size A4

 

For 200 euros and more: a reproduction of "The Chymical Air" (a drawing-watercolor I created in 2018) in limited edition (edition of 50 numbered and signed copies) A3 size

For 500 euros and more: one of my original works on paper

And for all those who will have taken part in this campaign, whatever their level of participation, a coffee for free at o Gabinete de Madame Thao!

Whether you decide or not to financially support this project, feel free to send me your comments, advice, reading lists or just a hello and share this page!

 

Thanks to my business advisers and supporters: brothers and sisters, parents, friends

To Lou-Andrea, Kim-Ly and Nico who are the main motivation of this project

And to all of you who will believe in it with me.

 

 

 

(pour la version francaise, faites défiler encore un peu vers le bas)

 

O que é o Gabinete de Madame Thao?

Um espaço cultural

Um salão de chá / café

Uma livraria multilingue

Uma boutique de produtos excecionais relacionados com papel

Um gabinete de curiosidades

Um estúdio de artista

 

Qual será a nossa localização ?

No coração de Lisboa, perto do majestoso rio Tejo, entre os bairros históricos de Belém e Alfama.

 

Quem sou ?

Meu nome é Sandrine e sou uma artista plástica. O meu trabalho, fortemente ancorado na prática do desenho, foi exposto em vários eventos de arte contemporânea na Ásia, Europa e Estados Unidos, incluindo as Bienais de Singapura, Shenzhen e Macau, Kenpoku Art no Japão, Ke Art center em Xangai, o museu ARCO em Seul, o Palais de Tokyo em Paris, o Yerba Buena Center for the Arts em San Francisco e The Mistake Room em Los Angeles.

Sou francesa de origem vietnamita e vivo atualmente em Lisboa.

Depois de terminar os meus estudos na Escola de Belas Artes em Nice (França) morei alguns anos em Bordéus e mudei-me para o Vietname, onde morei 15 anos. Foi lá que nasceram as minhas duas filhas maravilhas, Kim-Ly e Lou-Andrea. Foi lá também que conheci o meu companheiro Nico, que escreve roteiros de jogos fabulosos.

Em 2019, os quatro decidimos vir morar em Lisboa. Tive a oportunidade de obter uma bolsa de investigação para estudar o Azulejo Português e as simbioses com o mosaico vietnamita do ponto de vista histórico e psicológico.

Gosto de trabalhar sozinha no meu estúdio mas também aprecio provocar reuniões, discussões e criar eventos. Há 20 anos que organizo exposições, concertos, performances, conferências. Lancei duas revistas de arte e montei e dirigi um Museu durante 3 anos em Ho Chi Minh City.

 Já dei aulas de arte, fui VJ por alguns anos e também faço design gráfico.

 

Nascimento do projeto

No início deste projeto, a necessidade de encontrar um workshop onde possa continuar a criar e, ao mesmo tempo, a vontade de gerir mais uma vez um espaço cultural onde poderei partilhar a minha paixão com os outros. Mas como posso imaginar a sua sustentabilidade financeira sem me perder, permanecendo fiel aos meus gostos e convicções?

Desde muito jovem gosto de trabalhar com o papel. Sempre em busca de novas texturas, tamanhos e gramagens de papel, cadernos, lápis e pincéis ... quando viajo para uma nova cidade, um novo país, papelarias e fabricas de papel artesanal são os primeiros lugares que exploro porque sei que há verdadeiros tesouros a serem descobertos lá.

Procuro também livreiros de segunda mão, porque se o livro em si é portador de conhecimento e também de emoções, essa qualidade adquire uma dimensão ainda mais profunda no caso dos livros usados. Isso evoca a ideia de uma transmissão de conhecimento, não massivo, mas que circularia de um indivíduo para outro; a ideia de um encontro, de uma partilha, mas noutra dimensão ...

O resto das minhas peregrinações levam-me a inúmeras feiras, velharias,  museus ou galerias ... E se ficar um pouco mais, procuro um café cujo ambiente me dê vontade de voltar e instalar-me para trabalhar.

Resolvi, então, reunir todas essas coisas que me alimentam, me acalmam e me surpreendem em um projeto que é ao mesmo tempo modesto e ambicioso, mas que acima de tudo se assemelha a mim.

 

O que vai acontecer lá?

Os visitantes poderão ver e adquirir obras de artistas contemporâneos de todo o mundo. Esses artistas, emergentes ou já consagrados, têm em comum o fato de terem feito do papel um de seus materiais favoritos.

Pretendo também agendar eventos culturais (conferências sobre temas ligados à arte e às ciências humanas, apresentações de artistas, mini-concertos, projeções de videoarte, curtas metragens, documentários) ainda que workshops, sessões de artes plásticas e live model que, em conjunto com a atividade de salão de chá, livraria e papelaria, vão garantir a renda do local.

O Salão de chá / café irá oferecer, para além dos cafés e sumos clássicos, uma seleção de chás asiáticos - cada um com uma historinha a descobrir, o "ca-phe sua da" (café gelado com leite condensado muito doce, popular no Vietname) e pequenos lanches para compartilhar em um ambiente exótico.

A secção da livraria multilingue (principalmente português, francês e inglês) consistirá em livros em segunda mão, incluindo uma seleção de obras essenciais para artistas e investigadores nas artes e nas ciências humanas.

A área de papelaria oferecerá principalmente papéis artesanais da Ásia (Índia, Nepal, Vietname, Butão, Japão, Tailândia), México e Portugal, mas também cadernos, lápis e pincéis, bem como itens de presente relacionados ao papel.

Também será o meu estúdio / local de trabalho diário onde os visitantes poderão se quiserem ver e discutir comigo o meu trabalho em curso e a minha coleção de curiosidades (objetos rituais recolhidos ou criados por mim); uma maneira de eles acederem a arte de forma simples e amigável.

 

De onde vem o nome “O Gabinete de Madame Thao”?

Artista Plástica de profissão, foi pelos títulos que atribuo às minhas exposições que escolhi este nome o qual traduz a minha paixão pelos gabinetes de curiosidades, o meu gosto pelo misterioso e pelo exótico. Também evoca as minhas origens (Thao é o diminutivo de Thu-Thao, o meu sobrenome vietnamita), e os lugares onde morei (França e Vietname) e onde moro hoje Portugal.

É a  fusão de todas essas influências que vai criar a atmosfera do lugar.

 

Sim, mas este projeto mudará o mundo?

Em uma escala micro talvez porque o que importa para mim, além de tornar a arte e o seu processo mais acessível, é mostrar o papel de maneira diferente; para torná-lo considerado um objeto precioso, cuidadosamente fabricado por pessoas com conhecimentos únicos e não um simples consumível que pode ser desperdiçado no lazer. Acredito em uma abordagem racional da desmaterialização e nos benefícios que isso implica para o planeta. Considerar o papel deste ângulo inusitado é participar à sua maneira nesta grande marcha para o progresso ambiental ... E não conseguindo mudar radicalmente o mundo, espero que o Gabinete de Madame Thao também contribua, graças aos momentos de evasão e partilha a torná-lo mais sustentável.

 

Pronto para me acompanhar nesta nova aventura?

De forma a distribuir o financiamento do projeto, dividi os objetivos desta campanha em 3 níveis.

 

Objetivo 1: 18.000 euros

Que possibilitaria o lançamento do local, mas com atividade reduzida (estúdio, salão de chá / café, alguns eventos ou workshops)

Este valor será usado para financiar:

Custos jurídicos e de constituição da empresa (2.035 euros)

Caução de 3 meses para uma renda de 850 euros (2.550 euros)

A marca, os elementos de comunicação (2.500 euros)

Renovação e decoração de interior compra de equipamentos, mobiliário (7.500 euros)

Stock de material para o salão de chá / eventos e atividade de workshops (1000 euros)

+ Comissão de plataforma de crowdfunding, custos de realização e envio de contrapartidas

 

Ou

Objetivo 2: 22.000 euros (objetivo 1 + 4.000 euros)

Que permitiria, graças a um montante adicional de 4.000 euros, o lançamento do local com todas as suas atividades.

O valor adicional será usado para financiar:

O primeiro stock de livros e artigos de papelaria (3400 euros)

+ Comissão de plataforma de crowdfunding, custos de realização e envio de contrapartidas

 

Ou…

Objetivo 3: 28.500 euros (objetivo 2 + 6.500 euros)

Que permitiria o lançamento de toda a atividade com uma tesouraria inicial de 6.000 euros.

Este dinheiro possibilitará apoiar o projeto alguns meses após o seu lançamento e participar aos

Encargos sociais (150 euros / mês)

Encargos com o contabilista (150 euros / mês)

Rendas e encargos (900 euros / mês)

Salário de assistente- vendedor (630 euros / mês)

+ Comissão de plataforma de crowdfunding, custos de realização e envio de contrapartidas

 

E se ... e se ...

Ultrapassado o Objetivo 3, os fundos adicionais permitirão dar uma outra dimensão à programação, oferecendo uma maior escolha de eventos de qualidade animados por artistas e oradores locais e internacionais.

 

Sem a sua colaboração este projeto será apenas um sonho, pelo que conto consigo!

 

As contrapartidas

Tenho a oferecer-lhe o que posso criar com minhas próprias mãos e, como tal, as recompensas serão dadas na forma de reproduções das minhas obras. Para os mais generosos, as recompensas serão obras originais. Entre em contato comigo se desejar receber um pdf com imagens grandes de todas as "perks".

Por 10 euros e mais: a reprodução em postal, assinada, de "The Invisible Worm That Flies in the Night" (um desenho realizado no ano passado)

Por 35 euros e mais: um catálogo que reúne uma seleção dos meus desenhos realizados nos últimos dez anos, dedicado e assinado

Por 75 euros e mais: o seu retrato em desenho digital (pode ser usado, por exemplo, como um perfil para os social media)

Por 100 euros e mais: uma reprodução de " Entering the Ruins of the Motley Cow  " (um desenho-aquarela produzido em 2014) em edição limitada (edição de 100 exemplares numerados e assinados) tamanho A4

Por 200 euros e mais: uma reprodução de "The Chymical Air" (um desenho-aguarela produzido em 2018) em edição limitada (edição de 50 exemplares numerados e assinados) tamanho A3

Por 500 euros e mais: um dos meus trabalhos (original) em papel

E para todos aqueles que terão participado em qualquer altura desta campanha, um chá ou café grátis no Gabinete Madame Thao!

Quer decida ou não me apoiar financeiramente neste projeto, fique à vontade para me enviar os seus comentários, conselhos, listas de leituras ou apenas um alô e compartilhe esta página!


Agradeço aos meus assessores de negócios e apoiantes: irmãos e irmãs, pais, amigos

A Lou-Andrea, Kim-Ly e Nico que são as principais motivações deste projeto

E para todos vocês que acreditam e apoiam este projeto.

 

 

 

Qu’est-ce que c’est ?

Un espace culturel

Un salon de thé / café

Une librairie multilingue

Une boutique de produits d´exception liés au papier

Un cabinet de curiosités

Un atelier d´artiste

 

Où serons-nous situés ?

Au cœur de Lisbonne, Portugal, à proximité du majestueux Tage, entre les quartiers historiques de Belem et d´Alfama.

 

Qui suis-je ? 

Je m’appelle Sandrine et je suis artiste. Mon travail, fortement ancré dans la pratique du dessin, a été exposé dans de multiples évènements d´art contemporain en Asie, Europe et aux États-Unis parmi lesquels les Biennales de Singapour, Shenzhen et Macao, Kenpoku Art au Japon, Ke Art center à Shanghai, le musée ARCO à Seoul, le palais de Tokyo à Paris, Yerba Buena Center for the Arts à San Francisco, ou encore The Mistake Room à Los Angeles.

Je suis française d´origine vietnamienne et je vis à Lisbonne.

Après avoir fini mes études aux Beaux-Arts de Nice j´ai vécu quelques années à Bordeaux puis je suis partie m´installer au Vietnam, où je suis restée 15 ans. C’est là-bas que sont nées mes deux merveilles, Kim-Ly et Lou-Andrea, là-bas aussi que j’ai rencontré mon compagnon Nico, qui écrit des scénarios de jeux fabuleux.

Et puis l’année dernière, nous avons décidé de venir nous installer tous les 4 à Lisbonne. J´y ai obtenu une bourse de recherche qui m´a permis d´étudier en parallèle l´azulejo portugais et la mosaïque vietnamienne sous un angle à la fois historique et psychologique.

J´aime travailler seule dans mon atelier mais, en contrepartie, j´aime aussi susciter des rencontres, des discussions et créer des événements. Depuis 20 ans j’organise des expositions, des concerts, des performances, des conférences, j’ai lancé deux magazines d´art et mis en place et dirigé pendant 3 ans un musée. J´ai enseigné l´art, été VJ pendant quelques années, et je fais aussi du graphisme.

 

Naissance du projet

Au départ de ce projet, le besoin de retrouver un atelier dans lequel je puisse continuer à créer et, en même temps, l´envie de gérer à nouveau un lieu culturel où partager ma passion avec les autres. Mais comment envisager sa durabilité financière sans me perdre, en restant fidèle à mes goûts et à mes convictions ?

Depuis mon plus jeune âge je raffole des papeteries. Toujours à l´affût de nouvelles textures, tailles, et grammages de papier, de carnets, crayons et pinceaux… quand je voyage dans une nouvelle ville, un nouveau pays, les papeteries et les ateliers de papiers artisanaux sont les premiers lieux que j´explore car je sais qu´on y découvre de véritables trésors.  

Je cherche aussi les bouquinistes car si le livre en soi est porteur d´émotion autant que de connaissance, cette qualité prend une dimension encore plus profonde dans le cas du livre d´occasion. Celui-ci évoque l´idée d´une transmission du savoir, non pas massive mais qui circulerait d´un individu a l´autre ; l´idée d´une rencontre, un partage mais dans une autre dimension…

La suite de mes pérégrinations me mène généralement dans les brocantes et les musées ou galeries… Et si je reste un peu plus longtemps, je vais chercher un café dont l’ambiance va me donner envie de revenir m´installer pour travailler.

Aussi j’ai décidé de rassembler toutes ces choses qui me nourrissent, m´apaisent et m´émerveillent dans un projet à la fois modeste et ambitieux mais qui surtout me ressemble.

 

Que va-t-il s y passer ?

Les visiteurs pourront découvrir et acquérir des œuvres créées par des artistes contemporains venant des quatre coins du monde. Ces artistes, émergeants ou déjà établis, auront ceci en commun qu´ils ont fait du papier un de leurs matériaux de prédilection.

J´y programmerai des événements culturels (conférences sur des thèmes liés à l´art et aux sciences humaines, présentations d´artistes, mini-concerts, projections de vidéo d´art, court-métrages, documentaires) ainsi que des workshops, des cours d´art plastique et des séances de modèle vivant qui, avec l´activité salon de thé, librairie-papeterie assureront les revenus du lieu.

La partie salon de thé / café proposera, en plus des cafés et jus classiques, une sélection de thés d´Asie - chacun ayant sa petite histoire à découvrir, des « ca-phe sua da » (le café glace au lait concentré sucré très populaire au Vietnam), et des petites choses à grignoter à partager dans une ambiance exotique.

La partie librairie multilingue (principalement portugais, français et anglais) sera composée de livres d´occasion, dont une sélection d´ouvrages incontournables pour les artistes et les chercheurs en art et sciences humaines.

Le coin papeterie proposera principalement des papiers artisanaux venant d’Asie (Inde, Népal, Vietnam, Bhutan, Japon, Thaïlande) du Mexique et du Portugal, mais aussi des carnets, crayons et pinceaux ainsi que des objets cadeaux liés au papier.

Ça sera également mon atelier / lieu de travail quotidien ou les visiteurs pourront s´ils le désirent voir et discuter avec moi mon travail in progress et ma collection de curiosités (objets rituels collectionnés ou créés par moi-même) ; une façon pour eux d´accéder à l´art de manière simple et conviviale.

 

D´où vient l´appellation « O gabinete de Madame Thao » ?

Artiste de profession, c´est en gardant à l´esprit des titres que je donne à mes expositions que j´ai choisi ce nom qui reflète ma passion pour les cabinets de curiosités, mon goût pour le mystérieux et l´exotisme. Il évoque aussi mes origines (Thao est le diminutif de Thu-Thao, mon prénom vietnamien), les lieux où j’ai vécu (France et Vietnam) et où je vis aujourd´hui (« o gabinete » signifie le cabinet en portugais).

C´est la fusion de toutes ces influences qui va venir créer l´atmosphère du lieu.

 

Oui mais, est-ce que ce projet va changer le monde ?

A une micro-échelle peut-être car ce qui m´importe, au-delà de rendre l´art et son processus accessible, c´est de donner à voir le papier autrement ; faire qu´il soit considéré comme un objet précieux, fabriqué avec soin par des personnes au savoir unique et non comme un simple consommable que l´on peut gaspiller à loisir. Je crois en une approche raisonnée de la dématérialisation et aux bénéfices que celle-ci implique pour la planète.  Envisager le papier sous cet angle inhabituel, c´est participer à sa manière à cette grande marche vers le progrès environnemental… Et à défaut de changer radicalement le monde, j´espère qu´o Gabinete de Madame Thao contribuera aussi, grâce aux moments d´évasion et de partage qu´il permettra, à le rendre plus supportable.

 

Prêts à m´accompagner dans ma nouvelle aventure ?

Afin d´étaler le financement du projet j’ai décomposé les objectifs de cette campagne en 3 paliers.

 

Objectif 1 : 18 000 euros

Qui permettrait de lancer le lieu mais avec une activité réduite (atelier, salon de thé / café, quelques événements ou workshops)

Ce montant servira à financer :

Les frais d´avocat et d´établissement de la compagnie (2 035 euros)

3 mois de caution pour un loyer à 850 euros (2 550 euros)

L´enseigne, les éléments de communication (2 500 euros)

Les travaux d´aménagement, l´équipement, le mobilier (7 500 euros)

Le stock de matière pour l´activité salon de thé /événements, workshops (1 000 euros)

+ Commission plateforme crowdfunding, coûts de réalisation et expédition des contreparties

 

Ou

Objectif 2 :  22 000 euros (objectif 1 + 4 000 euros)

Qui permettrait, grâce à un montant additionnel de 4 000 euros, le lancement du lieu avec toutes ses activités.

Le montant additionnel servira à financer :

Le premier stock de livres et produits de papeterie (3400 euros)

+ Commission plateforme crowdfunding, les coûts de réalisation et expédition des contreparties

 

Ou…

Objectif 3 : 28 500 euros (objectif 2 + 6 500 euros)

Qui permettra le lancement de l´activité complète avec une trésorerie de départ de 6 000 euros.

Cette trésorerie permettra d´accompagner le projet sur quelques mois après son lancement et participer aux

Charges sociales (150 euros / mois)

Frais de comptable (150 euros / mois)

Loyer + charges (900 euros / mois)

Salaire d´un assistant-vendeur (630 euros/mois)

+ Commission plateforme crowdfunding, coûts de réalisation et expédition des contreparties

 

Et si… et si…

l´objectif 3 est dépassé, les fonds supplémentaires permettront de donner une autre envergure à la programmation en proposant un choix plus important d´événements de qualité animés par des artistes et conférenciers locaux et internationaux.

 

Sans vous ce projet ne restera qu´un rêve, alors je compte sur vous !

 

Les contreparties 

J´offre, en contrepartie, des reproductions en série limitée de mes œuvres et l´opportunité, pour les plus généreux,  d´acquérir des œuvres originales. N´hesitez pas a me contacter pour recevoir le pdf listant les "perks" avec de grandes images.

Pour 10 euros et + : la reproduction sur carte postale, signée, de « The Invisible Worm That Flies in the Night » (un dessin réalisé l´année dernière)

Pour 35 euros et + : un catalogue regroupant une sélection de mes dessins réalisés ces dix dernières années, dédicacé et signé

Pour 75 euros et +: Votre portrait en dessin numérique (peut être utilisé par exemple comme image de profil pour les médias sociaux)

Pour 100 euros et + : une reproduction de « Entering the Ruins of the Motley Cow » (un dessin-aquarelle réalisé en 2014) en tirage limité (édition de 100 exemplaires numérotés et signés) format A4  

Pour 200 euros et + : une reproduction de «The Chymical Air » (un dessin-aquarelle réalisé en 2018) en tirage limité (édition de 50 exemplaires numérotés et signés) format A3

Pour 500 euros et + : une de mes œuvres (original) sur papier

Et pour tous ceux qui auront participé à n´importe quelle hauteur à cette campagne, un thé ou café offert au Gabinete de Madame Thao !

Que vous décidiez ou non de soutenir financièrement ce projet, n´hésitez pas en m´envoyer vos commentaires, conseils, listes de lectures ou juste un petit coucou et à partager cette page !

 

Merci à mes conseillers en business et supporters : frères et sœurs, parents, amis

A Lou-Andrea, Kim-Ly et Nico qui sont la principale motivation de ce projet

Et à vous tous qui voulez bien y croire avec moi.

A cultural Space
A tea room and Cafe
A multilingual bookstore
A boutique of fine paper related products
A curiosity cabinet
An artist studio
 

 


 
In the heart of Lisbon, Portugal, near the majestic Tagus river, between the historic districts of Belem and Alfama.

 

 

 
My name is Sandrine and I am an artist. My work, strongly rooted in the practice of drawing, has been exhibited in numerous contemporary art events in Asia, Europe and the United States including Singapore, Shenzhen and Macao Biennials, Kenpoku Art in Japan, Ke Art center in Shanghai, the ARCO museum in Seoul, the Palais de Tokyo in Paris, the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts in San Francisco, and The Mistake Room in Los Angeles.
I am French of Vietnamese origin and I live in Lisbon.
 
After graduating at the Fine Arts School in Nice, I lived in Bordeaux for a few years and then moved to Vietnam, where I stayed for 15 years. That´s where I gave birth to my two gems Kim-Ly and Lou-Andrea, and where I met my partner Nico, who writes fabulous game scripts.
In 2019, the four of us decided to come and settle in Lisbon. I received a research grant which enabled me to study simultaneously Portuguese azulejo and Vietnamese mosaic from a historical and psychological angle.
 
I deeply enjoy the time I spend working alone in my studio but I also like to provoke meetings, discussions and create events. For 20 years I have been organizing exhibitions, concerts, performances and lectures. I launched two art magazines, set up and ran a museum for 3 years, taught art and was a VJ for a few years.
 


 
At the start of this project was the need to find a studio in which I could continue to create combined with the desire to once again run a cultural space to share my passion for art with others. But how can I contemplate its stability without losing myself, while remaining true to my tastes and my convictions? As I looked for ways to make the project financially sustainable, I turned towards my long-lasting interest for fine stationery products. 
 
As far as I can remember I have always been fascinated by stationery, ever on the lookout for new textures, sizes, and weights of paper, notebooks, pencils and brushes… When I travel to a new city, a new country, stationery and craft paper workshops are the first places I rush to because I know they may conceal real treasures.
 
I also look for second-hand booksellers because if a book conveys as much emotion as knowledge, it is even more true for a second-hand book. It conjures up the idea of ​​a transmission of knowledge, not so much exhaustive as flowing from one individual to another; the idea of ​​meeting and sharing but in another way ...
 
Then, my wanderings usually take me to flea markets and museums or galleries ... And if I stay a little longer, I will look for a café whose atmosphere will make me want to come back, settle and work.
 
Hence I decided to gather all those things that nourish, soothe and amaze me in a project, both modest yet ambitious, and which above all mirrors me most.
 

 

 
Visitors will be able to discover and acquire artworks created by contemporary artists from all over the world. These artists, either emerging or already established, will all share their same favorite medium, paper.
 

 

 
I will schedule cultural events (lectures on themes related to art and human sciences, artist talks, mini-concerts, video art, short films and documentaries screenings) as well as workshops, art courses and live model sessions which will ensure the income of the place together with the tea room, the bookshop and the sale of stationery products.
 

 

 
The tea room / café section will provide, in addition to classic coffees and juices, a selection of Asian teas - each with its own little story to discover, “ca-phe sua da” (the Vietnamese ice coffee with sweet condensed milk), and snacks to share in an exotic atmosphere.
 

 

 
The multilingual bookstore section (mainly Portuguese, French and English) will consist of second-hand books, including a selection of essential works for artists and researchers in art and human sciences.
 

 

 
The stationery corner will mainly display artisanal papers from Asia (India, Nepal, Vietnam, Bhutan, Japan, Thailand), Mexico and Portugal, but also notebooks, pencils and brushes as well as paper-related gift items.
 

 

 
It will also be my daily studio where I will gladly welcome visitors to see and discuss my work in progress and my collection of curiosities (ritual objects collected or created by myself); a way for them to access to art in a simple and friendly way.
 


 



 
As a professional artist, I have chosen this name keeping in mind the titles I give to my exhibitions. While reflecting my passion for curiosity cabinets, my taste for the mysterious and for exoticism, it also refers to my origins (Thao is the diminutive of Thu-Thao, my Vietnamese name), the places where I used to live (France and Vietnam) and where I live today (“o gabinete” means the cabinet in Portuguese).
All these influences will mingle to create the atmosphere of the space.
 


 

 
On a micro-scale yes, maybe, because what matters to me, beyond making art and its process accessible, is to show paper differently. I’d like to invite people to reconsider its commodity status and start seeing it as a precious object, carefully manufactured by craftsmen with a unique knowledge and not as something consumable that can be heedlessly wasted. I believe in a reasoned approach to dematerialization and its benefits for the environment. Considering paper from this unusual angle means taking part in one´s own way in this powerful march towards more sustainable practices... And if o Gabinete de Madame Thao may not radically change the world, I hope it will contribute to make it more bearable by offering opportunities to wonder and moments to share.
 

 
In order to spread the funding for the project I have divided the objectives of this campaign into 3 levels.
 
Objective 1: 18 000 euros
This would make the launch of the space possible, but with a reduced activity (workshop, tea room / café, some events or workshops)
This amount will finance:
Legal and company establishment costs (2,035 euros)
3 months deposit for a rent of 850 euros (2,550 euros)
Signage, communication elements (2,500 euros)
Interior design, equipment, furniture (7 500 euros)
Stock of material for the tea room / café, events, workshops activity (1000 euros)
+ Crowdfunding platform commission,  rewards production, shipping costs
 
Or 
Objective 2 : 22 000 euros (objective 1 + 4 000 euros)
This would allow the launch of the place with all its activities thanks to an additional amount of 4,000 euros.
The additional amount will finance:
The first stock of books and stationery products (3400 euros)
+ Crowdfunding platform commission, rewards production, shipping costs
 
Or
Objective 3 : 28 500 euros (objective 2 + 6 500 euros)
This will allow optimistically the launch of the space with all its activities and a starting cash box of 6 000 euros.
This cash box will enable to back up the project over a few months after its launch and participate in
Social charges (150 euros / month)
Accounting fees (150 euros / month)
Rent + charges (1 000 euros / month)
Salary of a sales assistant (630 euros / month)
+ Crowdfunding platform commission, rewards production, shipping costs
 
And if…
objective 3 has been exceeded, the additional funds will enable to give another dimension to the programming by offering a greater choice of quality events animated by local and international artists and speakers.
 
Without you this project will only remain a dream, so I'm counting  on you!
 

 
As a reward, I offer limited reproductions of my artworks and the opportunity to acquire originals for the most generous ;-) Please contact me if you wish you receive a pdf with large images of all the perks.
For 10 euros and more: the reproduction on a postcard, signed, of "The Invisible Worm That Flies in the Night" (a drawing I made last year)

For 35 euros and more: a catalog compiling a selection of my drawings made over the last ten years, dedicated and signed

For 75 euros and more: your social media ID profile portrait
For 100 euros and more: a reproduction of "Entering the Ruins of the Motley Cow" (a drawing-watercolor I created in 2014) in limited edition (edition of 100 numbered and signed copies) size A4

 
For 200 euros and more: a reproduction of "The Chymical Air" (a drawing-watercolor I created in 2018) in limited edition (edition of 50 numbered and signed copies) A3 size

For 500 euros and more: one of my original works on paper

And for all those who will have taken part in this campaign, whatever their level of participation, a coffee for free at o Gabinete de Madame Thao!
Whether you decide or not to financially support this project, feel free to send me your comments, advice, reading lists or just a hello and share this page!
 
Thanks to my business advisers and supporters: brothers and sisters, parents, friends
To Lou-Andrea, Kim-Ly and Nico who are the main motivation of this project
And to all of you who will believe in it with me.
 
 

 
(pour la version francaise, faites défiler encore un peu vers le bas)
 
O que é o Gabinete de Madame Thao?
Um espaço cultural
Um salão de chá / café
Uma livraria multilingue
Uma boutique de produtos excecionais relacionados com papel
Um gabinete de curiosidades
Um estúdio de artista
 
Qual será a nossa localização ?
No coração de Lisboa, perto do majestoso rio Tejo, entre os bairros históricos de Belém e Alfama.
 
Quem sou ?
Meu nome é Sandrine e sou uma artista plástica. O meu trabalho, fortemente ancorado na prática do desenho, foi exposto em vários eventos de arte contemporânea na Ásia, Europa e Estados Unidos, incluindo as Bienais de Singapura, Shenzhen e Macau, Kenpoku Art no Japão, Ke Art center em Xangai, o museu ARCO em Seul, o Palais de Tokyo em Paris, o Yerba Buena Center for the Arts em San Francisco e The Mistake Room em Los Angeles.
Sou francesa de origem vietnamita e vivo atualmente em Lisboa.
Depois de terminar os meus estudos na Escola de Belas Artes em Nice (França) morei alguns anos em Bordéus e mudei-me para o Vietname, onde morei 15 anos. Foi lá que nasceram as minhas duas filhas maravilhas, Kim-Ly e Lou-Andrea. Foi lá também que conheci o meu companheiro Nico, que escreve roteiros de jogos fabulosos.
Em 2019, os quatro decidimos vir morar em Lisboa. Tive a oportunidade de obter uma bolsa de investigação para estudar o Azulejo Português e as simbioses com o mosaico vietnamita do ponto de vista histórico e psicológico.
Gosto de trabalhar sozinha no meu estúdio mas também aprecio provocar reuniões, discussões e criar eventos. Há 20 anos que organizo exposições, concertos, performances, conferências. Lancei duas revistas de arte e montei e dirigi um Museu durante 3 anos em Ho Chi Minh City.
 Já dei aulas de arte, fui VJ por alguns anos e também faço design gráfico.
 
Nascimento do projeto
No início deste projeto, a necessidade de encontrar um workshop onde possa continuar a criar e, ao mesmo tempo, a vontade de gerir mais uma vez um espaço cultural onde poderei partilhar a minha paixão com os outros. Mas como posso imaginar a sua sustentabilidade financeira sem me perder, permanecendo fiel aos meus gostos e convicções?
Desde muito jovem gosto de trabalhar com o papel. Sempre em busca de novas texturas, tamanhos e gramagens de papel, cadernos, lápis e pincéis ... quando viajo para uma nova cidade, um novo país, papelarias e fabricas de papel artesanal são os primeiros lugares que exploro porque sei que há verdadeiros tesouros a serem descobertos lá.
Procuro também livreiros de segunda mão, porque se o livro em si é portador de conhecimento e também de emoções, essa qualidade adquire uma dimensão ainda mais profunda no caso dos livros usados. Isso evoca a ideia de uma transmissão de conhecimento, não massivo, mas que circularia de um indivíduo para outro; a ideia de um encontro, de uma partilha, mas noutra dimensão ...
O resto das minhas peregrinações levam-me a inúmeras feiras, velharias,  museus ou galerias ... E se ficar um pouco mais, procuro um café cujo ambiente me dê vontade de voltar e instalar-me para trabalhar.
Resolvi, então, reunir todas essas coisas que me alimentam, me acalmam e me surpreendem em um projeto que é ao mesmo tempo modesto e ambicioso, mas que acima de tudo se assemelha a mim.
 
O que vai acontecer lá?
Os visitantes poderão ver e adquirir obras de artistas contemporâneos de todo o mundo. Esses artistas, emergentes ou já consagrados, têm em comum o fato de terem feito do papel um de seus materiais favoritos.
Pretendo também agendar eventos culturais (conferências sobre temas ligados à arte e às ciências humanas, apresentações de artistas, mini-concertos, projeções de videoarte, curtas metragens, documentários) ainda que workshops, sessões de artes plásticas e live model que, em conjunto com a atividade de salão de chá, livraria e papelaria, vão garantir a renda do local.
O Salão de chá / café irá oferecer, para além dos cafés e sumos clássicos, uma seleção de chás asiáticos - cada um com uma historinha a descobrir, o "ca-phe sua da" (café gelado com leite condensado muito doce, popular no Vietname) e pequenos lanches para compartilhar em um ambiente exótico.
A secção da livraria multilingue (principalmente português, francês e inglês) consistirá em livros em segunda mão, incluindo uma seleção de obras essenciais para artistas e investigadores nas artes e nas ciências humanas.
A área de papelaria oferecerá principalmente papéis artesanais da Ásia (Índia, Nepal, Vietname, Butão, Japão, Tailândia), México e Portugal, mas também cadernos, lápis e pincéis, bem como itens de presente relacionados ao papel.
Também será o meu estúdio / local de trabalho diário onde os visitantes poderão se quiserem ver e discutir comigo o meu trabalho em curso e a minha coleção de curiosidades (objetos rituais recolhidos ou criados por mim); uma maneira de eles acederem a arte de forma simples e amigável.
 
De onde vem o nome “O Gabinete de Madame Thao”?
Artista Plástica de profissão, foi pelos títulos que atribuo às minhas exposições que escolhi este nome o qual traduz a minha paixão pelos gabinetes de curiosidades, o meu gosto pelo misterioso e pelo exótico. Também evoca as minhas origens (Thao é o diminutivo de Thu-Thao, o meu sobrenome vietnamita), e os lugares onde morei (França e Vietname) e onde moro hoje Portugal.
É a  fusão de todas essas influências que vai criar a atmosfera do lugar.
 
Sim, mas este projeto mudará o mundo?
Em uma escala micro talvez porque o que importa para mim, além de tornar a arte e o seu processo mais acessível, é mostrar o papel de maneira diferente; para torná-lo considerado um objeto precioso, cuidadosamente fabricado por pessoas com conhecimentos únicos e não um simples consumível que pode ser desperdiçado no lazer. Acredito em uma abordagem racional da desmaterialização e nos benefícios que isso implica para o planeta. Considerar o papel deste ângulo inusitado é participar à sua maneira nesta grande marcha para o progresso ambiental ... E não conseguindo mudar radicalmente o mundo, espero que o Gabinete de Madame Thao também contribua, graças aos momentos de evasão e partilha a torná-lo mais sustentável.
 
Pronto para me acompanhar nesta nova aventura?
De forma a distribuir o financiamento do projeto, dividi os objetivos desta campanha em 3 níveis.
 
Objetivo 1: 18.000 euros
Que possibilitaria o lançamento do local, mas com atividade reduzida (estúdio, salão de chá / café, alguns eventos ou workshops)
Este valor será usado para financiar:
Custos jurídicos e de constituição da empresa (2.035 euros)
Caução de 3 meses para uma renda de 850 euros (2.550 euros)
A marca, os elementos de comunicação (2.500 euros)
Renovação e decoração de interior compra de equipamentos, mobiliário (7.500 euros)
Stock de material para o salão de chá / eventos e atividade de workshops (1000 euros)
+ Comissão de plataforma de crowdfunding, custos de realização e envio de contrapartidas
 
Ou
Objetivo 2: 22.000 euros (objetivo 1 + 4.000 euros)
Que permitiria, graças a um montante adicional de 4.000 euros, o lançamento do local com todas as suas atividades.
O valor adicional será usado para financiar:
O primeiro stock de livros e artigos de papelaria (3400 euros)
+ Comissão de plataforma de crowdfunding, custos de realização e envio de contrapartidas
 
Ou…
Objetivo 3: 28.500 euros (objetivo 2 + 6.500 euros)
Que permitiria o lançamento de toda a atividade com uma tesouraria inicial de 6.000 euros.
Este dinheiro possibilitará apoiar o projeto alguns meses após o seu lançamento e participar aos
Encargos sociais (150 euros / mês)
Encargos com o contabilista (150 euros / mês)
Rendas e encargos (900 euros / mês)
Salário de assistente- vendedor (630 euros / mês)
+ Comissão de plataforma de crowdfunding, custos de realização e envio de contrapartidas
 
E se ... e se ...
Ultrapassado o Objetivo 3, os fundos adicionais permitirão dar uma outra dimensão à programação, oferecendo uma maior escolha de eventos de qualidade animados por artistas e oradores locais e internacionais.
 
Sem a sua colaboração este projeto será apenas um sonho, pelo que conto consigo!
 
As contrapartidas
Tenho a oferecer-lhe o que posso criar com minhas próprias mãos e, como tal, as recompensas serão dadas na forma de reproduções das minhas obras. Para os mais generosos, as recompensas serão obras originais. Entre em contato comigo se desejar receber um pdf com imagens grandes de todas as "perks".
Por 10 euros e mais: a reprodução em postal, assinada, de "The Invisible Worm That Flies in the Night" (um desenho realizado no ano passado)
Por 35 euros e mais: um catálogo que reúne uma seleção dos meus desenhos realizados nos últimos dez anos, dedicado e assinado
Por 75 euros e mais: o seu retrato em desenho digital (pode ser usado, por exemplo, como um perfil para os social media)
Por 100 euros e mais: uma reprodução de " Entering the Ruins of the Motley Cow  " (um desenho-aquarela produzido em 2014) em edição limitada (edição de 100 exemplares numerados e assinados) tamanho A4
Por 200 euros e mais: uma reprodução de "The Chymical Air" (um desenho-aguarela produzido em 2018) em edição limitada (edição de 50 exemplares numerados e assinados) tamanho A3
Por 500 euros e mais: um dos meus trabalhos (original) em papel
E para todos aqueles que terão participado em qualquer altura desta campanha, um chá ou café grátis no Gabinete Madame Thao!
Quer decida ou não me apoiar financeiramente neste projeto, fique à vontade para me enviar os seus comentários, conselhos, listas de leituras ou apenas um alô e compartilhe esta página!
Agradeço aos meus assessores de negócios e apoiantes: irmãos e irmãs, pais, amigos
A Lou-Andrea, Kim-Ly e Nico que são as principais motivações deste projeto
E para todos vocês que acreditam e apoiam este projeto.
 
 

 
Qu’est-ce que c’est ?
Un espace culturel
Un salon de thé / café
Une librairie multilingue
Une boutique de produits d´exception liés au papier
Un cabinet de curiosités
Un atelier d´artiste
 
Où serons-nous situés ?
Au cœur de Lisbonne, Portugal, à proximité du majestueux Tage, entre les quartiers historiques de Belem et d´Alfama.
 
Qui suis-je ? 
Je m’appelle Sandrine et je suis artiste. Mon travail, fortement ancré dans la pratique du dessin, a été exposé dans de multiples évènements d´art contemporain en Asie, Europe et aux États-Unis parmi lesquels les Biennales de Singapour, Shenzhen et Macao, Kenpoku Art au Japon, Ke Art center à Shanghai, le musée ARCO à Seoul, le palais de Tokyo à Paris, Yerba Buena Center for the Arts à San Francisco, ou encore The Mistake Room à Los Angeles.
Je suis française d´origine vietnamienne et je vis à Lisbonne.
Après avoir fini mes études aux Beaux-Arts de Nice j´ai vécu quelques années à Bordeaux puis je suis partie m´installer au Vietnam, où je suis restée 15 ans. C’est là-bas que sont nées mes deux merveilles, Kim-Ly et Lou-Andrea, là-bas aussi que j’ai rencontré mon compagnon Nico, qui écrit des scénarios de jeux fabuleux.
Et puis l’année dernière, nous avons décidé de venir nous installer tous les 4 à Lisbonne. J´y ai obtenu une bourse de recherche qui m´a permis d´étudier en parallèle l´azulejo portugais et la mosaïque vietnamienne sous un angle à la fois historique et psychologique.
J´aime travailler seule dans mon atelier mais, en contrepartie, j´aime aussi susciter des rencontres, des discussions et créer des événements. Depuis 20 ans j’organise des expositions, des concerts, des performances, des conférences, j’ai lancé deux magazines d´art et mis en place et dirigé pendant 3 ans un musée. J´ai enseigné l´art, été VJ pendant quelques années, et je fais aussi du graphisme.
 
Naissance du projet
Au départ de ce projet, le besoin de retrouver un atelier dans lequel je puisse continuer à créer et, en même temps, l´envie de gérer à nouveau un lieu culturel où partager ma passion avec les autres. Mais comment envisager sa durabilité financière sans me perdre, en restant fidèle à mes goûts et à mes convictions ?
Depuis mon plus jeune âge je raffole des papeteries. Toujours à l´affût de nouvelles textures, tailles, et grammages de papier, de carnets, crayons et pinceaux… quand je voyage dans une nouvelle ville, un nouveau pays, les papeteries et les ateliers de papiers artisanaux sont les premiers lieux que j´explore car je sais qu´on y découvre de véritables trésors.  
Je cherche aussi les bouquinistes car si le livre en soi est porteur d´émotion autant que de connaissance, cette qualité prend une dimension encore plus profonde dans le cas du livre d´occasion. Celui-ci évoque l´idée d´une transmission du savoir, non pas massive mais qui circulerait d´un individu a l´autre ; l´idée d´une rencontre, un partage mais dans une autre dimension…
La suite de mes pérégrinations me mène généralement dans les brocantes et les musées ou galeries… Et si je reste un peu plus longtemps, je vais chercher un café dont l’ambiance va me donner envie de revenir m´installer pour travailler.
Aussi j’ai décidé de rassembler toutes ces choses qui me nourrissent, m´apaisent et m´émerveillent dans un projet à la fois modeste et ambitieux mais qui surtout me ressemble.
 
Que va-t-il s y passer ?
Les visiteurs pourront découvrir et acquérir des œuvres créées par des artistes contemporains venant des quatre coins du monde. Ces artistes, émergeants ou déjà établis, auront ceci en commun qu´ils ont fait du papier un de leurs matériaux de prédilection.
J´y programmerai des événements culturels (conférences sur des thèmes liés à l´art et aux sciences humaines, présentations d´artistes, mini-concerts, projections de vidéo d´art, court-métrages, documentaires) ainsi que des workshops, des cours d´art plastique et des séances de modèle vivant qui, avec l´activité salon de thé, librairie-papeterie assureront les revenus du lieu.
La partie salon de thé / café proposera, en plus des cafés et jus classiques, une sélection de thés d´Asie - chacun ayant sa petite histoire à découvrir, des « ca-phe sua da » (le café glace au lait concentré sucré très populaire au Vietnam), et des petites choses à grignoter à partager dans une ambiance exotique.
La partie librairie multilingue (principalement portugais, français et anglais) sera composée de livres d´occasion, dont une sélection d´ouvrages incontournables pour les artistes et les chercheurs en art et sciences humaines.
Le coin papeterie proposera principalement des papiers artisanaux venant d’Asie (Inde, Népal, Vietnam, Bhutan, Japon, Thaïlande) du Mexique et du Portugal, mais aussi des carnets, crayons et pinceaux ainsi que des objets cadeaux liés au papier.
Ça sera également mon atelier / lieu de travail quotidien ou les visiteurs pourront s´ils le désirent voir et discuter avec moi mon travail in progress et ma collection de curiosités (objets rituels collectionnés ou créés par moi-même) ; une façon pour eux d´accéder à l´art de manière simple et conviviale.
 
D´où vient l´appellation « O gabinete de Madame Thao » ?
Artiste de profession, c´est en gardant à l´esprit des titres que je donne à mes expositions que j´ai choisi ce nom qui reflète ma passion pour les cabinets de curiosités, mon goût pour le mystérieux et l´exotisme. Il évoque aussi mes origines (Thao est le diminutif de Thu-Thao, mon prénom vietnamien), les lieux où j’ai vécu (France et Vietnam) et où je vis aujourd´hui (« o gabinete » signifie le cabinet en portugais).
C´est la fusion de toutes ces influences qui va venir créer l´atmosphère du lieu.
 
Oui mais, est-ce que ce projet va changer le monde ?
A une micro-échelle peut-être car ce qui m´importe, au-delà de rendre l´art et son processus accessible, c´est de donner à voir le papier autrement ; faire qu´il soit considéré comme un objet précieux, fabriqué avec soin par des personnes au savoir unique et non comme un simple consommable que l´on peut gaspiller à loisir. Je crois en une approche raisonnée de la dématérialisation et aux bénéfices que celle-ci implique pour la planète.  Envisager le papier sous cet angle inhabituel, c´est participer à sa manière à cette grande marche vers le progrès environnemental… Et à défaut de changer radicalement le monde, j´espère qu´o Gabinete de Madame Thao contribuera aussi, grâce aux moments d´évasion et de partage qu´il permettra, à le rendre plus supportable.
 
Prêts à m´accompagner dans ma nouvelle aventure ?
Afin d´étaler le financement du projet j’ai décomposé les objectifs de cette campagne en 3 paliers.
 
Objectif 1 : 18 000 euros
Qui permettrait de lancer le lieu mais avec une activité réduite (atelier, salon de thé / café, quelques événements ou workshops) 
Ce montant servira à financer :
Les frais d´avocat et d´établissement de la compagnie (2 035 euros)
3 mois de caution pour un loyer à 850 euros (2 550 euros)
L´enseigne, les éléments de communication (2 500 euros)
Les travaux d´aménagement, l´équipement, le mobilier (7 500 euros)
Le stock de matière pour l´activité salon de thé /événements, workshops (1 000 euros)
+ Commission plateforme crowdfunding, coûts de réalisation et expédition des contreparties
 
Ou
Objectif 2 :  22 000 euros (objectif 1 + 4 000 euros)
Qui permettrait, grâce à un montant additionnel de 4 000 euros, le lancement du lieu avec toutes ses activités.
Le montant additionnel servira à financer :
Le premier stock de livres et produits de papeterie (3400 euros)
+ Commission plateforme crowdfunding, les coûts de réalisation et expédition des contreparties
 
Ou…
Objectif 3 : 28 500 euros (objectif 2 + 6 500 euros) 
Qui permettra le lancement de l´activité complète avec une trésorerie de départ de 6 000 euros.
Cette trésorerie permettra d´accompagner le projet sur quelques mois après son lancement et participer aux
Charges sociales (150 euros / mois)
Frais de comptable (150 euros / mois)
Loyer + charges (900 euros / mois)
Salaire d´un assistant-vendeur (630 euros/mois)
+ Commission plateforme crowdfunding, coûts de réalisation et expédition des contreparties
 
Et si… et si…
l´objectif 3 est dépassé, les fonds supplémentaires permettront de donner une autre envergure à la programmation en proposant un choix plus important d´événements de qualité animés par des artistes et conférenciers locaux et internationaux.
 
Sans vous ce projet ne restera qu´un rêve, alors je compte sur vous !
 
Les contreparties 
J´offre, en contrepartie, des reproductions en série limitée de mes œuvres et l´opportunité, pour les plus généreux,  d´acquérir des œuvres originales. N´hesitez pas a me contacter pour recevoir le pdf listant les "perks" avec de grandes images.
Pour 10 euros et + : la reproduction sur carte postale, signée, de « The Invisible Worm That Flies in the Night » (un dessin réalisé l´année dernière)
Pour 35 euros et + : un catalogue regroupant une sélection de mes dessins réalisés ces dix dernières années, dédicacé et signé
Pour 75 euros et +: Votre portrait en dessin numérique (peut être utilisé par exemple comme image de profil pour les médias sociaux)
Pour 100 euros et + : une reproduction de « Entering the Ruins of the Motley Cow » (un dessin-aquarelle réalisé en 2014) en tirage limité (édition de 100 exemplaires numérotés et signés) format A4  
Pour 200 euros et + : une reproduction de «The Chymical Air » (un dessin-aquarelle réalisé en 2018) en tirage limité (édition de 50 exemplaires numérotés et signés) format A3
Pour 500 euros et + : une de mes œuvres (original) sur papier
Et pour tous ceux qui auront participé à n´importe quelle hauteur à cette campagne, un thé ou café offert au Gabinete de Madame Thao !
Que vous décidiez ou non de soutenir financièrement ce projet, n´hésitez pas en m´envoyer vos commentaires, conseils, listes de lectures ou juste un petit coucou et à partager cette page !
 
Merci à mes conseillers en business et supporters : frères et sœurs, parents, amis
A Lou-Andrea, Kim-Ly et Nico qui sont la principale motivation de ce projet
Et à vous tous qui voulez bien y croire avec moi.
---

Portrait in my studio by Vanya Volkov
Special thanks to: Susana Boulin, Ilda Briosca, Penelope Cadeau, Fabrice and Juliette Carrasco, Olivier Cloez, Daniele Condat, Nadege David, Florent, Helene, Magali and Ngoc Thu Flament,  Arup Gupta, Bina, Eric, Florence and Olivier Llouquet, Olivier Mourgue d´Algue, Catherine and Laurent Nguyen, John Tue Nguyen, Tu Nguyen, Quynh Pham, Nicolas Plesse, Constanca Schedel Arouca, Jeff Von Der Schmidt

story:
Creating a open space where Palestinian youth can freely unfold their creativity

In 2015 I took part in the building of a 700m2 concrete skate park in the Palestinian village of Asira alShamalia. 

A great experience that contributed to the local society, creating a space where boys and girls are able to unfold their creativity and releasing their energy by learning how to skate. 

It has also become a central meeting point in the village where both grown ups and children come to socialise on a regular basis. 

As a volunteer its now my third time visiting Asira and the skatepark ( I arrived here 10.09.17 this time). Im very please to see that the program of SkatePal works well, sending out monthly volunteers that gives skate-board classes, engaging in the local community,having a deeper look into their culture and their every day life.

Home

Personally Asira has become like a home to me. To be able to come back here on a regular basis, visiting my friends and to see the progress of the kids that are active skate boarders is very inspiring and makes me want to continue supporting and working for SkatPal to create more of these magical places and maintaining what we already started.  

Since SkatePal and SkateQilya is two non-profit organisations, we depends on among others, support trough fundraising.

I aim to raise 500€ the next month that would go directly to the project. 

Here is an overview on how the money will be spent: 

Funding

SkatePal and SkateQilya have jointly raised £15,000 towards Jayyous Skatepark so far and we are aiming for another £10,000 to finish the project and make it the best skatepark possible!

- Our existing £15,000 has been allocated for site preparation and materials.

All your donations are important and significant to make the future park stay maintained with the right tools and reassures.

So far we manage to raise more then half of the goal and all the donations will go to install lighting and shade, making it possible to skate at any time of year (Palestine is very hot, so being able to skate at night is important!)

Donations beyond the goal will go towards making the project sustainable for years to come.

Here are some photographs of the recent days in the park here in Asira alShamaliya: 

On the way from the village we normally hitchhike with locals. Here we found ourself on the back of a truck transporting wood. 

Kids arriving, normally getting dropped off by their families. 

Two local skaters skating the miniramp.

Volunteer Tori and local girl having fun at the park!

Me looking at my portrait taken by local skater:) She is a born photographer btw:)

story:
There are as many opinions about Israel and Palestine as there are minds and mouths (and fingers to type a tweet), but here is something everyone can agree on: People in Gaza need more books. 

Mosab Abu Toha, a young Gazan with a degree in English literature who has never been able to explore the world due to Israel’s ban on travel, escapes through reading. Now he is trying to start an English-language library and book shop. (It will have books in Arabic as well—there is a great shortage of books in any language in Gaza, much fewer than one per person.)

He and his friend Shafi Salem have collected hundreds of books, which currently live in his apartment. His dream is to set up a library in a building of its own, with a coffee shop and a book shop—the sort of social and cultural amenity that is practically nonexistent in Gaza, where most of the public libraries have been closed or destroyed, and where the remaining ones hold only 70,000 books for a population of 1.8 million.

Now the two young men have started a crowdfunder to raise $15,000 to get the library off the ground–for rent, shelves, tables, chairs, and staff. 

Can you chip in to help make the library a reality and do something concrete and positive for the people of Gaza?

Noam Chomsky has donated books to the library project. Here’s what he says about it:

It has been amazing, and inspiring, to see how people surviving in the Gaza prison, subject to constant and vicious attack and living under conditions of brutal deprivation, continue to maintain their dignity and commitment to a better life. Mosab’s initiative to create a library and cultural center in Gaza is an outstanding example of these remarkable efforts. What he is seeking to achieve would make a very significant contribution to enriching the lives of Gazans and providing them with opportunities for a much better future.  It merits strong support from everyone concerned with justice and basic human rights.

If you care about Israel, Palestine, Gaza, education, reading, books, stretching the imagination through encounters with the imaginations of others, or encouraging people who are trying to make the world a better place even in extremely discouraging circumstances, please give to the project and circulate this information to your friends and lists.

Written by Katha Pollit on The Nation

During the three months that we operated in the library, we have done many activities ranging from visiting schools and kindergartens to enlighten students, hosting lectures, hosting small musical concerts, helping students research for students, taking regular visitors to other libraries and to some historical places and so many to come.

 

The funds we need from January 2018 till December 2018 are:

3500 USD for renting a bigger apartment.

Two employees with a salary of 300 USD each (600 USD X 12 = 7200 USD)

A servant for deliveries and staying in the library in time of out-door activities: 100 a month (100 X 12= 1200 USD)

Operating costs (100 USD each month= 1200 USD)

More Shelves for the more books we get and tables and chairs (Estimated: 1700 USD)

A laptop (600 USD)

LCD screen 550 USD

UPS device 450 USD

Total: 16400

story:
Known as the “High Priestess of Soul,” Nina Simone’s career spanned multiple genres, four decades, several continents, and 15 Grammy nominations. But her legacy isn’t just a musical one.

From refusing to perform for inattentive audiences, to fusing classical piano with African rhythms, to condemning racial and gender discrimination, Nina Simone transcended the constraints society placed on black female performers.

Her music and politics drew her into a powerful circle, including Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., Malcolm X, James Baldwin, Stokely Carmichael, Langston Hughes, and Miriam Makeba. Her performance at the Dr. King-led march from Selma to Montgomery and recordings of songs such as “To Be Young, Gifted, and Black” (her tribute to Lorraine Hansberry) and “Strange Fruit” cemented her identity as a fierce, fearless voice of the Civil Rights Movement.

Today, the call for social justice that Nina Simone carried is as relevant as ever, and it all started in her modest childhood home—a simple yet powerful place that needs your help to be preserved for future generations.

 

Nina Simone was born Eunice Waymon in Tryon, North Carolina, in 1933.

As a young girl, she first played publicly while accompanying her mother on the piano during church services. Becoming aware of her talent, Tryon residents convinced her mother to allow Simone to take piano lessons. One of the residents was a classically trained pianist and teacher who would go on to teach Simone for years, placing her on a musical trajectory that would not only take her to the Juilliard School in New York City, but to some of the most celebrated stages around the world.

Looking back, Nina Simone’s childhood life in Tryon didn’t just shape her musically; it was also where she experienced the racial discrimination that shaped her worldview and eventually propelled her as a voice of the Civil Rights Movement. Once such instance is when Simone’s parents were forced to give up their seats to white audience members at her debut recital. Even though she was only eleven, Simone found her voice and refused to play until her parents were returned to their rightful place in the front row.

Despite its rich history at the root of Simone’s legacy, her childhood home in Tryon sat vacant and neglected following previously unsuccessful preservation efforts. In 2017, when demolition appeared to be the only option, four New York-based artists rallied together and purchased the home so that it could be spared from the wrecking ball.

Today, with the artists’ guidance, the National Trust for Historic Preservation, through its African American Cultural Heritage Action Fund,  is working to develop a rehabilitation plan, perform critical exterior stabilization work, and identify future uses and protection for this National Treasure.

But we can’t do it without you.

 

While work is underway to bring Nina Simone’s childhood home back to life, we need your help to cross the finish line.

By donating to our campaign, you’ll help fund critical restoration work at the home, including much-needed exterior repairs to its roof and windows. And in the process, you’ll get to enjoy one-of-a-kind perks that make it easy for you to show your love for the “High Priestess of Soul.”

Spread the Word with Nina Simone-Inspired Prints, Enamel Pins, Hand Fans, T-Shirts, and Postcards – Prices Vary

​Want to show your love for the "High Priestess of Soul" and the campaign to restore her childhood home? We've got you covered! We're offering a variety of exclusively designed, Nina-inspired perks to thank you for your generous donation. Check the sidebar to the right for all the details (click each item to learn more), including information on our special bundles that allow you to claim multiple perks at discounted prices. 

(PS: Donors who claim the full bundle will receive a print of a never-before-seen photo of Nina Simone in the recording studio, courtesy of Sony Legacy.)

But wait, there’s more! In addition to our amazing lineup of tangible perks, we’re offering an exclusive experience that will allow you to tap into Nina’s legacy like never before.

Childhood Home Listening Sessions (Only Ten Available!) – $1,000

Discover firsthand what must it have been like to hear Nina Simone play the piano inside her childhood home. By claiming this perk, you and a friend will get to listen to a collection of Nina Simone’s most beloved hits inside the home that shaped her art. Please note that travel to North Carolina and any related expenses are not included in this perk. Your donation secures your access to the home for a private, hour-long listening session and a tour of the home. Listening sessions will be available beginning in the spring of 2020. After claiming this perk, a representative from our campaign will reach out to coordinate scheduling and to answer any additional questions you might have. 

And We're Not Done Yet!

Throughout the campaign, we plan to release additional items for sale to benefit the restoration of Nina Simone's childhood home. Please stay tuned to our campaign updates for more details about their release. Note: Not all items will be available for purchase through Indiegogo.com.

All images of Nina Simone appear courtesy of the Nina Simone Charitable Trust.

story:
BRICK BY BRICK

Who We Are

Brick By Brick is a group of five University of Tennessee students teaming up with the nonprofit Knox Heritage to make a difference. The five of us call Knoxville our home; three of us are natives to the area. That’s why we have partnered with Knox Heritage, a non-profit organization committed to preserving historic Knoxville and improving our city.

Established in 1974, Knox Heritage works to preserve, restore and transform historically important places. This organization plays an important role in keeping our city beautiful and rich with history. Without Knox Heritage, many of our important buildings, along with the history and charm of the area, would have been demolished. We think that the entire community benefits from the work Knox Heritage does, and we want to support them in an effort to build a new community garden.

 

 

What We Need

Historic Westwood's original owners, John and Adelia Lutz, once had a nice shade garden on the west side of their property, but over the years the garden has slowly disappeared. However, $1000 would go a long way in helping to bring the garden back to life so that the community may enjoy it for years to come. This money would fund new plants for the garden, as well as benches. We are working with the Historic Westwood Garden Committee and a concept plan provided by Landscape Architect Stephen Hackney.

 

How This Will Benefit The Community

Historic Westwood is a building, museum, and a beautiful outdoor center for the community to enjoy. It offers a glance into the past while also providing a functional and gorgeous landscape for special events and programs. Westwood has been a source of fun and education for Knox families since it opened to the public in 2014. Raising the funds so Knox Heritage may create a new garden on the grounds will help keep this historic piece of Knoxville beautiful and useful for years to come.

What you could receive

If you donate $10 you will get a shoutout on the Brick by Brick UTK Facebook page. For $25, you will get a thank you video that you can share wherever you please. For $50, you will receive a $15 gift certificate to Jump Jam Trampoline Park.

 

Other Ways To Help

If you cannot donate money, there are always more options. A quick share on Facebook, Twitter, or even just telling a friend could influence many more to help the cause.
story_txt: BRICK BY BRICKWho We AreBrick By Brick is a group of five University of Tennessee students teaming up with the nonprofit Knox Heritage to make a difference. The five of us call Knoxville our home; three of us are natives to the area. That’s why we have partnered with Knox Heritage, a non-profit organization committed to preserving historic Knoxville and improving our city.Established in 1974, Knox Heritage works to preserve, restore and transform historically important places. This organization plays an important role in keeping our city beautiful and rich with history. Without Knox Heritage, many of our important buildings, along with the history and charm of the area, would have been demolished. We think that the entire community benefits from the work Knox Heritage does, and we want to support them in an effort to build a new community garden.  What We NeedHistoric Westwood's original owners, John and Adelia Lutz, once had a nice shade garden on the west side of their property, but over the years the garden has slowly disappeared. However, $1000 would go a long way in helping to bring the garden back to life so that the community may enjoy it for years to come. This money would fund new plants for the garden, as well as benches. We are working with the Historic Westwood Garden Committee and a concept plan provided by Landscape Architect Stephen Hackney. How This Will Benefit The CommunityHistoric Westwood is a building, museum, and a beautiful outdoor center for the community to enjoy. It offers a glance into the past while also providing a functional and gorgeous landscape for special events and programs. Westwood has been a source of fun and education for Knox families since it opened to the public in 2014. Raising the funds so Knox Heritage may create a new garden on the grounds will help keep this historic piece of Knoxville beautiful and useful for years to come.What you could receiveIf you donate $10 you will get a shoutout on the Brick by Brick UTK Facebook page.
