The film created for Zero Discrimination Day will empower people who regularly experience discrimination, including those with disabilities, refugees and asylum seekers, to provide a vision of what a more inclusive world could be through performance of "I'd Like To Teach The World To Sing", with a message of ending discrimination. 
With services cut as a result of the pandemic, hiring a community support worker will offer, once a week, vital pastoral support and signposting to mutual aid, education and employment opportunities. 
By offering training in digital technology and data support, we will enable our members to not only access the choir, but also connect to vital support services.
 

Your support: 
Please help us to support members of Sing For Freedom Choir to continue to meet online, and enable us to offer the technical support, training and pastoral support they deserve. 
£5 - will fund data payments for one singer for one week and enable them to get online
£15 - will fund a pair of headphones for one singer
£20 - will provide one member with a digital training session
£50 - will enable one choir member to participate in the video project for Zero Discrimination Day
£150 - will enable a community support officer to provide once a week, vital pastoral support and signposting to our members
£500 - will fund a bursary place for one choir member for one year

story:
The Veganary Mini Tours are short meetups with local vegan experts who guide you through their favorite vegan stops around the city, while explaining about important aspects of the local vegan culture.


Get a local vegan to take you around the best vegan gems the city has to offer, everything from vegan restaurants and street foods, to open markets and health food stores.

Our tours give vegans a chance to provide jobs for one another, support local vegan business and unite around our love for veganism! 

By visiting, eating and shopping at local vegan venues recommended by passionate local vegan experts, these tours bring a financial boost to vegan businesses everywhere, and well-paid employment to vegans who choose to become tour guide in the city they love.

It's our dream to make it easy for vegans everywhere to enjoy the delights of vegan food and local culture. We also want to provide jobs, boost vegan businesses and support vegan-focused initiatives and activism everywhere.

 

Each tour purchase is:
1.  For 2 people - each extra person is 30 USD. 
2. Valid until the end of 2022 - giving you time to choose where and when you take the tour. 

To book a tour in one of our 13 destinations, please send a mail to: Contact@TheVeganary.com
 

 

 


 

We might be less than a year old, but we're already making our presence felt. Just imagine the impact we could have if you join us and get others to join us. The bigger we become, the better life will be for vegans everywhere.

 

 

If, like us, you've experienced problems finding good quality vegan food while you're away on vacation or business, we hear you! And to solve your problem, with your support, we can bring  The Veganary Mini - Tours to you, wherever you are. 

Each vegan expert will offer 2 or more different vegan tour options in their city for guests to choose from.

When guests book a tour, they receive the personal email address of the guide to enable them to coordinate specifics and finalize the meetup location and time.

 

 


Guides show guests around their favorite local vegan shops, stores, markets, street food vendors and restaurants. They also share their knowledge of local vegan culture.

And reveal hidden vegan gems!

Guests can ask ask their guide questions to expand their knowledge of veganism in that part of the world.

By the end of the tour, guests are well-informed. They have a real feel for vegan culture and cuisine, wherever in the world they are. And more vegans will have united and made new friendships.

 

We want to establish a powerful international vegan community that will give its members a voice that will be heard around the world.

We already know that veganism is the most eco-friendly way to live. It’s the lifestyle that will help save the planet. We just need more people to know it!

So vegans around the world, this is your chance to join us, to help spread the word, and to help each other.

 

 

Let's unite and support each other's vegan businesses. Let's share ideas on how to promote the vegan lifestyle. Let's host and promote vegan events that will make headlines and attract new people into the vegan community.

We want people to see The Veganary as their Vegan Gateway to the World. Our strength will be in numbers. The bigger the worldwide vegan community we can build, the more global impact we will have. But we need your help and support to make this happen.

It starts here, today, with this, our request for donations to support the expansion of The Veganary Mini-Tours.

 

Hi, we are Shani Zukerman and Natan Saffer, a vegan couple living in Vancouver BC.

We met while studying business management, and after gaining experience in the marketing field, we left our day jobs to start our own marketing business. 

This allowed us to experience the nomad’s life for more than a year, while travelling around the world. It was during this time that we discovered how difficult it was to maintain our vegan diet and lifestyle while moving from country to country.

Ahead of our trip to a new destination, it took us ages to search for information online about veganism in that area. Sometimes it was impossible to find places that sold vegan food.

And so we created The Veganary - A  crowd-sourced platform, offering organized vegan related information in more than 65 countries worldwide! 

 

 

During our research, we discovered that the best way to get local vegan information was to contact local vegans ourselves and find out the details we needed from them.

It proved very successful, a mind-blowing experience every single time!

The people we met always enthusiastically shared their local vegan knowledge and were happy to meet like-minded vegans from different cultures.

This took our travel experience as vegans to another level! We gained vegan-related knowledge that would otherwise have taken months if not years to acquire without that local input. And we made some true new friends along the way!

 

 

But we knew that many vegans wouldn't have the time to contact vegan locals themselves. There had to be a quicker way to put people in touch with vegan guides, without them having to go and look for them.

And so the idea for The Veganary Mini-Tours was born.

Having already compiled relevant vegan information for more than 65 countries for our website by working with thousands of keen local vegans from around the world, we were already in a strong position to create tours that replicate the amazing experiences we've had from local tour guides.

And with your backing, we plan grow our Veganary Mini Tours in 2020. It's all part of a bigger goal to support the expansion of veganism on a local level to such an extent that it will have a global impact.

 

 

  • Incorporating new exciting activities vegans worldwide, such as cooking classes, events, activism, vegan fairs, get togethers and more. 
  • Creating overnight tour options for selected vegan destinations.
  • Adding the option for guests to hire a vegan guide to join their planned trip for longer periods
  • Supply customized vegan snack packs for visitors, and ensure they're waiting in guests' hotel rooms.
  • Making a genuine and positive difference to the world by uniting vegans worldwide

 

All donations will be reinvested in growing The Veganary. Donations of any size will be highly appreciated and will help us grow and improve The Veganary community.

 

Please donate and share this page with friends, family, colleagues and other social media contacts. Please add the link to this crowdfunding page and our official hashtag #TheVeganaryMT to your messages. Thank you!

story:
A Brief Summary

Shapeshifters Cinema and Brewery is a 40 seat experimental microcinema, microbrewery and taproom housed in a beautiful Victorian originally built in 1872 located on the historic Bret Harte Boardwalk in the Jack London District of Oakland, CA. Shapeshifters is locally-owned and operated by Gilbert Guerrero and Kathleen Quillian. 

Shapeshifters started in 2012 as a monthly, volunteer-run series focused on expanded cinema. For the past several years we have been working towards building on the success of the series by securing our own space and developing a business plan to make Shapeshifters a more permanent, self-sustaining organization. Since we signed the lease on our new space in 2018 we have been working on securing permits and finalizing plans to add a brewery and taproom. We are now nearly ready to begin construction but first we need to raise $30,000 to cover incidental costs before the contractors will begin work. 

Our Story 

Shapeshifters Cinema began in 2012 as a monthly series focused on expanded cinema, featuring moving image work by experimental filmmakers and video artists with accompaniment from sound artists, musicians, and artists from other creative disciplines. So far in our 7 ½ year run, we have presented 86 shows featuring over 200 artists performing experimental and expanded moving image and sonic art to over 3,500 people. At every show we offer a limited, small batch of beer on tap that Gilbert has been developing through his personal homebrewing practice. To date he has served over 350 gallons of his award-winning brewing experiments at Shapeshifters programs. 

Shapeshifters emerged from a deep-seated and long-standing dedication to the Bay Area experimental film community. After decades of working behind the scenes with artists and non-profit arts organizations in San Francisco (most notably Artists’ Television Access, San Francisco Cinematheque and Leonardo/ISAST), we decided to bring our experience and energy to Oakland, the place we call home and where we are raising our family. The series originally took place at Arbor Cafe in North Oakland and was later moved to the Temescal Art Center, a community-based non-profit performance space, where it ran monthly for the next 7 years. The series has been supported by the Zellerbach Family Foundation (5 time grant awardee), Southern Exposure’s Alternative Exposure Grant (2 time grant awardee), the Clorox Foundation (2 time grant awardee), and individual donors, with fiscal sponsorship from the San Francisco Cinematheque. The funding provided by these foundations and other individual donors has allowed us to offer free admission and to provide artists a small stipend for their participation in the series, with the occasional stipend for some of our administrative work. After 7 ½ years of this it has become clear that we are providing something more than just a vanity project for experimental moving image and sound art and it is time to step up our game to create a more sustainable venue with a more stable future, which is capable of providing for artists, audiences and administrators alike.

In September 2019 we took a major leap and moved into our own building with the vision of providing a community space for a variety of programs, including our long-standing, popular expanded cinema series, as well as a wide range of experimental moving image art, music, sound art, and radical performance by local and traveling artists and curators. To sustain the venue, we have chosen to replace grants and donations provided by foundations and individuals with a vital earned income stream provided by the microbrewery and taproom, which will be open during shows as well as nights when the cinema is dark, as well as a small in-house store that will feature artist-made and small press DVDs, CDs, LPs, books, zines and more.

Our Beer

Gilbert has been brewing beer for over 7 years. It started out of curiosity and a series of experiments on a 5-gallon homebrewing kit. In the process, he discovered a contemporary world of consumable alchemy, involving ingredients, process, time and chemistry.  He joined the Bay Area Mashers Homebrew Club where he learned invaluable information from his fellow homebrewing comrades during monthly meetings. In 2013 he started Temescal Homebrewing to provide hand-packed homebrew kits and monthly workshops for others interested in the art of homebrewing. He has given talks and taught public and private homebrew workshops for Preserved, the Biofuel Oasis and the Marin Public Library for over 4 years. In 2018, he won first prize in the World Cup of Beer competition for his Synesthesia Pale Ale recipe.

We believe beer should be fresh, local and creative. Our menu of beers have been developed using non-traditional processes and recipes with one eye keenly focused on history, political awareness, community building and creative practices. Here are a few: 

  • Synesthesia Pale Ale. A blend of hop varieties play with the senses in this malty pale ale with notes of white wine grapes, peaches, and citrus. 
  • Ice Cold Popcorn IPA. Freshly popped popcorn is added to the grain bill along with a dash of sea salt, making this chewy, hazy IPA light and flavorful. 
  • Americas Schwarzbier. A rich, black lager made with toasted indigenous corn as part of the grain bill. 
  • Drunken Sea Imperial Rice Pilsner. Large quantities of rice round out this dry, incredibly light, slightly bitter Pilsner that has a kick to keep you rocking on the high seas. 
  • Magentachrome Cherry Grisette. This hearty, five-grain blend of rolled barley, oats, rye, wheat, and triticale is fermented on Saison yeast, then racked on fresh cherries, giving it a nostalgic pink hue.
  • Blackberry Gose. A tart rye wheat beer fermented on local blackberries harvested at their peak. 

 

The Financial Break-down

Starting up a new business is costly! Our organization has a solid history of presenting amazing art by incredible, independent artists from around the world. In order to grow into the next phase of our existence, we need a little help to get things started.

We have already contributed over $100K of our own for: 

  • architects fees,
  • structural engineering fees,
  • Conditional Use Permit (required to sell alcohol),
  • building permits and health department fees,
  • purchasing comfortable, vintage theater chairs,
  • purchasing a new sound system with subwoofer,
  • and paying a security deposit, rent, insurance, and utilities. 

 

We are working with a lender to get an SBA-backed business loan for $250K to cover:

  • basic construction, 
  • sewage, plumbing, electrical, 
  • an ADA accessible bathroom, 
  • cold storage room, 
  • kegerators, 
  • starting inventory,
  • and working capital. 

 

The $30,000 we raise during this fundraising campaign is essential seed money necessary to get started on construction of the brewery and taproom—an important element for our future operations which will provide a sustainable source of earned income. Both the lender and the general contractor require us to have this money on hand, which will be earmarked to cover “incidental costs” associated with construction, before they allow construction to begin.

If there are no incidental costs during construction, the money we raise during this campaign will go towards fixing up the deck surrounding the building—a necessary step in order to open the future-planned back patio beer garden. 

All money raised beyond the stated goal will be used to buy much of the necessary equipment we need to establish a functional brewing operation:

  • $5,000 will buy an under counter glass washer. 
  • $2,000 will buy a 3 compartment sink, utility sink, floor sink, mop sink, and two hand sinks 
  • $10,000 will buy a 1 BBL brewing system, complete with control panel, heat exchanger
  • $10,000 will buy 4 temperature-controlled unitanks for fermentation and carbonation
  • $7,000 will buy a small glycol chiller, kegs, pumps, hoses and connectors

 

How YOU Can Help!

Make a one-time donation

Donate at the level that works for you. Any amount will help and you can get some fun, limited-time only perks for showing your support. Higher level donations come with some seriously cool perks like helping us design a beer and hosting a private screening for you and a roomful of your friends.

Join as a Member

Along with this fundraising campaign, we are also excited to announce the new Shapeshifters Cinema and Brewery Membership program. You can choose to join the cinema track, the brewery track or the combined cinema/brewery track so you can show your ongoing support and keep the perks coming your way throughout the year while you enjoy your time in Oakland’s brand new (and possibly the world’s first) experimental microcinema and microbrewery. See the list of perks for details on what each level provides. Join as a member now during this fundraising campaign at a reduced price and receive all the perks for one year of membership. But this is a limited, one-time only offer so get it while you can!

Join as an Investor

In addition to this fundraising campaign, we are ready to welcome higher level investors which comes with major financial incentives and will allow us to continue building out our plans to full completion. Investors are a vital piece of this equation. So if you are looking for an exciting new investment opportunity, please contact Gilbert at gilbert@shapeshifterscinema.com to discuss this further.

What YOU Get 

With this new chapter of our existence, we are excited to re-introduce ourselves to the world as Shapeshifters Cinema and Brewery with a new logo and a fresh new look. 

We have lots of fun and lucrative, limited time-only perks to say THANK YOU for showing your support as we work towards completing this major undertaking.

 

For Now, We’ll See You at the Shows!

Share this with your friends, family, drinking buddies and fellow cinephiles on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, SMS, email and wherever else you spend your virtual time. In the meantime, come join us for radical art and beer at our upcoming shows http://shapeshifterscinema.com/!

story:
Thank you to our supporters -- we have hit our goal but we are STILL GOING! 

The press is taking notice: 

Wired | Recode | NPR | TechCrunch | Quartz

 

Are you tired of losing elections and feeling helpless? So are we.

Democrats have all the right ideas—but they're spending their money in all the wrong places. Meanwhile, Republicans are crushing us online. Tech for Campaigns can fix that.

 

 

With your help, Tech for Campaigns (TFC) can build a digital arm for the Left. Our community of 3,000 skilled volunteers will supercharge campaigns with digital expertise—like building email programs, running social media advertising, and analyzing voter data—and software tools we’re building. In short: we give political campaigns a digital makeover. For free.

 

Our goal: complete 500 digital campaign projects by the end of 2018. For free.

With your contribution, you’ll help real candidates across the country win their elections—and join a new dialogue about how tech and politics can work together.

Get access to our fireside chats with tech and political leaders for real dialogues about how tech and politics should work together—and how they shouldn’t. What would you ask former Twitter CEO Dick Costolo or former Michigan governor Jennifer Granholm if you had the chance?

To change politics in America, we need a different solution—and the conversation starts with you.

 

What is the problem?

Democrats are spending their money in all the wrong places—and Republicans are outspending & outmaneuvering us online.

Today’s voters get most of their information online. According to AdWeek, we spend 5.6 hours online every single day. In 2016, more money was spent on Internet ads than television ads in the US.

And yet, Democrats only spend 5-10% of their campaign funds on digital channels!

 

Meanwhile, the Republicans have prioritized digital: they spend more money, for longer periods of time—in smarter ways.

On average in the 2016 Senate races, Republicans outspent Democrats on Google digital channels (like YouTube) by 3 to 1. It got even worse from January to June, to the tune of  20 to 1.

This hurts us everywhere. But it’s been most devastating at the state level—where races are won and lost by just hundreds or thousands of votes.

 

You probably know Democrats lost Congress in the last 2 elections. But did you know we’ve been crushed at the state level too?

 

Why do state elections matter so much?

In most states the legislatures decide how federal and state districts are drawn—AKA, they are really important!

State governments also make decisions on major issues like health care, gun control, and environmental protections. You hear a lot about “taking back Congress” or “flipping the house”—but we can’t do that in a meaningful way without changing how the districts are drawn.

And that starts with the state legislatures.

 

So, how can we fix it?

Tech for Campaigns helps progressives & centrists by matching them with best-in-class talent and technology they need to win state elections.

Our mission: activate our network of 3,000 volunteers to build tech tools and strategies that candidates can use for years to come. We’re not just helping one campaign; we’re changing the way campaigns are run. All over the country.

Today’s voters get most of their information online. And winning online requires better advertising and targeting, smoother websites, and smarter data. But Democrats haven’t caught up—and keep spending their campaign funds in all the wrong places.

 

We match talented experts from our community of 3,000 volunteers to campaign teams—and take on their biggest digital challenges.

Whether it’s running social media advertising programs, analyzing complex voter data, or building tools for automating fundraising research, we’re writing a digital campaign playbook that actually works.

 

How you can help—and what’s in it for you?

It all starts by bridging the gap between technology and politics. With a contribution of $100 or more, you’ll get access to an online fireside chat with a notable pair of leaders: one from tech, and the other from politics. Like Jason Kander and Sam Altman—or Jennifer Granholm and Dick Costolo!

You have a right to be involved in the conversation about the role of technology in politics. How can they work together—and where should we draw the line? It’s not a backroom conversation. It’s something people like you should be able to lead.

 

With your help, we'll tackle 500 digital projects:

    We’ve already proven that TFC works. By next month, we’ll have completed 50 successful campaign projects.


    Next, we'll build technical infrastructure and software tools 

    • Shared best practice guides, templates and toolkits to optimize online spending
    • Data models to help states understand which districts are most competitive—and where to focus their efforts
    • Employ full-time staff to build these products—and manage 500+ teams of skilled volunteers

    Our north star goals:

    • Achieve better political results in 2018 and beyond
    • Widen access to politics and empower long-term volunteerism
    • Teach pro campaigners how to leverage technology to win elections

     

    CASE STUDIES

    Here’s how the campaigns we work with feel about TFC.

    For James Thompson's special Election race in April 2017, we ran their paid social media program. Including their targeting, creative assets, copy and reporting. In under 2 months, our TFC team started their paid programs from scratch, taking them from: 

    •  1,300 to 10,000 followers 
    • 20 to 600 likes per post
    • Engagement levels 15x higher than their opponent's

     

    Meet the TFC Team

    Our founders & volunteers hail from all over—but are proven tech experts who want to change how politics works.

     

    With so many races in 2018, how do you choose which ones to focus on?

    National elections get all the attention, but state-level elections are secretly the center of political power.

    Fun fact: State-level politicians control how much your vote matters—locally, and nationally. Yep. You read that right.

    We know, we know: you probably don’t pay attention to state elections. They’re like the Minor Leagues. But your local state officials control how much your votes matter—because they control redistricting at the state and national level.

    That’s right: in most states, your state legislature gets to redraw the boundary lines of Congressional districts. And for years, Republicans have been doing this in a way that is ridiculously favorable to their candidates—while totally disenfranchising Democratic voters.

    This is called gerrymandering.

     

    Should you care about gerrymandering? Yes—if you ever want Congress back.

    Gerrymandering is secretly the worst problem in American democracy. The Republicans are rigging the game, and we need to take action now.

    Republicans use gerrymandering to suppress the impact of your vote. And the votes of women, minorities, and other groups that tend to support Democrats.

    In 2020, your elected state officials will redraw their districts—and we’ll be stuck with those lines for another ten years.

    So, the people we elect next year matter. A lot. We need to start taking back the states now to even have a chance of taking back Congress in 2020.

    It's 2017. All campaigns should get best-in-class digital help.

    Let's bridge the gap between tech & politics - and start winning again. 

     

    TFC in the News

    We've been lucky enough to have our work featured in leading publications like:

    Read more: Recode| Quartz | NPR | Next Gen Dem Podcast 

    FAQs

    Q: Are the fireside chats in person or online?

    A: A bit of both. The virtual fireside chats will be hosted as a private online video-chat. Only backers will receive a unique link to access the fireside chat(s) they sign-up for, and will have a chance to submit questions both ahead of time and during the chat through a moderator.

    The Chamath/McFaul/Ghonim chat is in-person in the Bay Area.

    Q: When will I get my perks?

    A: Shirts will be shipped by December, 2017. The fireside chats will take place between November 2017 and February 2018. Each fireside chat will be scheduled separately.

    Q: Will any perks go out before the campaign is completed?

    A: No, perks will not go out before the campaign is completed.

    Q: How do I tell you what t-shirt size I need?

    A: You will be asked to indicate the size and style of your t-shirt when you are checking out in Indiegogo.

    Q: What if I want more than one perk?

    A: You can make multiple gifts on Indiegogo using a single account. Just make sure you use the same email address and login, so we’ll know that all of your perks are meant to go to the same person. Many of our backer levels offer access to multiple fireside chats, so if you give $750 or more, you will be able to choose multiple. We will follow up after the campaign is completed to find out which fireside chats you want to attend -- including any surprise perks that we release mid-way through the campaign. 

    Q: Can I donate at one backer level and attend a digital fireside chat for a different backer level?

    A: Each backer level comes with its own fireside chat, and you will only be able to attend the fireside chat(s) that are associated with your level. Some backer levels give you the option to choose from a set of fireside chats. For example, if you donate $750, you will be able to choose any 2 of the fireside chats available up to the $500 level.

    You can also earn access to additional fireside chats by referring your friends to contribute to the campaign. The top referrer will win access to every fireside chat! The top 10 referrers will all get access to multiple fireside chats as well. Donate to join the referral program. Learn more about the prizes here!

    Q: How much is shipping? What if I'm an international donor?

    A: Shipping is $4, regardless of your location. Unfortunately we cannot ship t-shirts internationally. However, if you purchase a t-shirt and live internationally, we are happy to ship it to an alternative domestic address.

    Note that we cannot accept donations from any international donors, unless you are a United States Citizen living abroad.  

    Q: I’m not a U.S. citizen. Can I donate?

    No. Legally, only United States citizens or Permanent US Residents can donate to Tech for Campaigns.  

    Q: How will I get my perk?

    A:  The virtual fireside chats will be hosted as a private online video-chat. We will send you more details on the fireside chat once the campaign has ended, including a link to register and get your unique access code that will let you into the fireside chat on the day of. You will be able to submit questions for the fireside chat participants in advance of the session. The fireside chats will be scheduled following the close of the Indiegogo campaign.  

    T-Shirts will be shipped domestically to the address you give when you make your donation.

    Q: What if I want one of the perks and it is sold out?

    A: Some perks are only available in limited quantities because of their special nature. So get these perks while they’re hot and contribute now!

    Q: What happens if I can’t make the scheduled time for my fireside chat?

    A: If you are unable to attend at the scheduled time, we will make the recording available to you after the fireside chat is completed. If you are unable to attend at your scheduled time, please email us at ighelp@techforcampaigns.org.

    Q: Will the chats be recorded?

    A: Yes, the fireside chats will be recorded and made available to participants.

    Q: How will I participate in the chat?

    A: You will be asked to submit your questions for your fireside chat through a virtual form at the close of the campaign. You will also be able to submit additional questions to a moderator while the fireside chat is live. Your questions will contribute to making these fireside chats a rich discussion - this is your time to engage directly with tech and political leaders!

    Q: Is TFC a non-profit?

    A: Yes, TFC is a registered 527 non-profit organization.

    Q: Are you a PAC?

    A: We are actually something called a Hybrid PAC, a political committee that is both able to make contributions to political candidates and able to make independent expenditures.  

    Q: Are contributions tax deductible?

    A: It turns out that no contributions to political organizations are tax deductible, sorry about that. Hopefully, you feel good about what you’re doing for democracy ;).

    Q: What are the contribution rules?

    To contribute to Tech for Campaigns, you must agree that the following are true: 

    • I am a U.S. citizen or lawfully admitted permanent resident (i.e., green card holder).
    • This contribution is made from my own funds, and funds are not being provided to me by another person or entity for the purpose of making this contribution.
    • I am making this contribution with my own personal credit card and not with a corporate or business credit card or a card issued to another person.
    • I am at least eighteen years old.
    • I am not a federal contractor.

    Q: I have another question. How can I ask you?

    A: If you don’t see your questions answered above, give us a shout by emailing ighelp@techforcampaigns.org. We’ll be happy to help you out!

     

    Contribution Rules

    By contributing this campaign you certify to that you meet the legal requirements stated in the contribution rules below.

    Contribution rules

    1.      I am a U.S. citizen or lawfully admitted permanent resident (i.e., green card holder).

    2.      This contribution is made from my own funds, and funds are not being provided to me by another person or entity for the purpose of making this contribution.

    3.      I am making this contribution with my own personal credit card and not with a corporate or business credit card or a card issued to another person.

    4.      I am at least eighteen years old.

    5.      I am not a federal contractor.

    Tech for Campaigns is a 527 non-profit organization and federal political committee registered with the Federal Election Commission.

    Contributions or gifts to Tech for Campaigns are not deductible as charitable contributions for Federal income tax purposes.

    Federal law requires Tech for Campaigns to request and disclose the name, address, occupation and employer of contributors who contribute, in the aggregate, in excess of $200 in a calendar year.

    Paid for by Tech for Campaigns, www.techforcampaigns.org, not authorized by any candidate or candidate’s committee.

    Contributions for the fireside chat program are limited to $5,000 per calendar year from federally permissible sources.  No corporate contributions will be accepted in connection with this program.

story:
It’s time for LA’s Triforium to shine again!

We at the National Trust for Historic Preservation, in collaboration with Heineken USA and the Triforium Project, are on a mission to reclaim and revitalize LA’s most audacious piece of public art after decades of silence. With your support, we’ll be one step closer to bringing its signature light and sound back to the heart of downtown.

The Triforium is a six-story, 60-ton public artwork by LA legend Joseph Young that sits in the shadow of City Hall. When it debuted in 1975, the space-age-looking, pointy edifice boasted 1,494 multicolored glass cubes that glowed in synchrony to music from a 79-note glass bell carillon, making it the largest musical instrument of its kind on Earth.

There had never been anything else like it ... anywhere!

Unfortunately, the Triforium was 40 years ahead of his time. The computer installed to synchronize the bells and lighting effects was plagued with problems from the beginning. Today, all of its incandescent bulbs have burned out, the instrument has been removed and sold, and the control room has been locked.

But it still stands, ready for its second act—thanks to new technology.

Interest in the project continues to grow. The volunteers behind the Triforium Project believe that Joseph Young’s vision for a “Rosetta Stone of art and technology” has a bright future in downtown LA. And people are noticing—just recently, the project was awarded a $100,000 innovation grant to kick off the restoration effort.

Today, the Triforium Project is working with the City of Los Angeles and the family of Joseph Young to develop a sustainable plan that brings Young’s original design into the 21st century. Their plan includes replacing the Triforium’s burned-out incandescent bulbs with LED lighting and building an interactive smartphone app and motion-sensor array. Thanks to these high-tech updates, all Angelenos will be able to play this remarkable musical instrument.

That’s right—forty years later, we can build things Joseph Young could only dream of creating. And these changes start right now, with your help!

One of the first critical steps is the replacement of broken-down, refrigerator-sized computers that originally controlled the Triforium with a new, faster and smaller networked computer system. This flexible “brain” will control the Triforium’s new LED lighting array and synchronize it to music in real time, turning the plaza into the bright musical heart of Los Angeles.

Success! We're happy to report that our campaign raised $39,780! That's $24,780 above our original goal of $15,000!

Thanks to the generous support of our backers, we’ll soon kick-start the Triforium’s reinvention, including contributing funding to the first big project—installing the computers needed to bring its light and sound back.

Please stay tuned to the updates section of this page for additional project news.

I claimed tickets to the Bruno Mars: 24K Magic World Tour as my perk and have questions.

Thank you for supporting our project! You will find answers to your questions in our FAQ. If you have specific questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com. Enjoy the show!

What is the National Trust for Historic Preservation?

The National Trust for Historic Preservation, a privately funded nonprofit organization, works to save America’s historic places. We are the cause that inspires Americans to save the places where history happened. The cause that connects us to our diverse pasts, weaving a multi-cultural nation together. The cause that transforms communities from places where we live into places that we love. As the leading voice for preservation, we are the cause for people saving places.

Our mission is to protect significant places representing our diverse cultural experience by taking direct action and inspiring broad public support.

Where is my donation going?

More than 90% of all funds raised will support the cities' projects and the National Trust’s ongoing work to save historic places in Los Angeles and around the country. Up to 10% will cover Indiegogo costs and processing fees as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.

When will I get my perk (non-ticket)?

Perks will be delivered later this summer (July/August).

Can I visit the project site?

Yes! You can visit the Triforium at Fletcher Bowron Square. Thanks to supporters like you, everyone will be able to see it in its full glory soon enough!

When will the project be complete?

Saving places takes time! But with your generous support, we hope to get the Triforium project completed as soon as possible.

How do I get support for my project? Or can I submit a project for consideration?

We at the National Trust are always interested in hearing about what is important to you. Although we may not be able to save it immediately, you can always contact your state’s historic preservation office and see how you can get started on the road to preservation!

Is the National Trust involved in other restoration projects?

Yes! We’re the country’s leading advocate for saving historic places. As such, we’re on the ground in communities across the nation. Visit our website to explore other historic places that we are trying to save like Los Angeles' Triforium.

Media Inquiries:

For further media inquiries about these projects, check out our Press Center.

My question wasn’t answered above. Who can I contact?

First, please see the full FAQ for the Cities Project.

If you have questions about the projects or how to claim perks other than tickets, please email cities@savingplaces.org.

If you have questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email  fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com.

If you have questions about the Cities Project, please email corporaterelations@heinekenusa.com.
story_txt: It’s time for LA’s Triforium to shine again!We at the National Trust for Historic Preservation, in collaboration with Heineken USA and the Triforium Project, are on a mission to reclaim and revitalize LA’s most audacious piece of public art after decades of silence. With your support, we’ll be one step closer to bringing its signature light and sound back to the heart of downtown.The Triforium is a six-story, 60-ton public artwork by LA legend Joseph Young that sits in the shadow of City Hall. When it debuted in 1975, the space-age-looking, pointy edifice boasted 1,494 multicolored glass cubes that glowed in synchrony to music from a 79-note glass bell carillon, making it the largest musical instrument of its kind on Earth.There had never been anything else like it ... anywhere!Unfortunately, the Triforium was 40 years ahead of his time. The computer installed to synchronize the bells and lighting effects was plagued with problems from the beginning. Today, all of its incandescent bulbs have burned out, the instrument has been removed and sold, and the control room has been locked.But it still stands, ready for its second act—thanks to new technology.Interest in the project continues to grow. The volunteers behind the Triforium Project believe that Joseph Young’s vision for a “Rosetta Stone of art and technology” has a bright future in downtown LA. And people are noticing—just recently, the project was awarded a $100,000 innovation grant to kick off the restoration effort.Today, the Triforium Project is working with the City of Los Angeles and the family of Joseph Young to develop a sustainable plan that brings Young’s original design into the 21st century. Their plan includes replacing the Triforium’s burned-out incandescent bulbs with LED lighting and building an interactive smartphone app and motion-sensor array. Thanks to these high-tech updates, all Angelenos will be able to play this remarkable musical instrument.That’s right—forty years later, we can build things Joseph Young could only dream of creating. And these changes start right now, with your help!One of the first critical steps is the replacement of broken-down, refrigerator-sized computers that originally controlled the Triforium with a new, faster and smaller networked computer system. This flexible “brain” will control the Triforium’s new LED lighting array and synchronize it to music in real time, turning the plaza into the bright musical heart of Los Angeles.Success! We're happy to report that our campaign raised $39,780! That's $24,780 above our original goal of $15,000!Thanks to the generous support of our backers, we’ll soon kick-start the Triforium’s reinvention, including contributing funding to the first big project—installing the computers needed to bring its light and sound back.Please stay tuned to the updates section of this page for additional project news.I claimed tickets to the Bruno Mars: 24K Magic World Tour as my perk and have questions. Thank you for supporting our project! You will find answers to your questions in our FAQ. If you have specific questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com. Enjoy the show!What is the National Trust for Historic Preservation?The National Trust for Historic Preservation, a privately funded nonprofit organization, works to save America’s historic places. We are the cause that inspires Americans to save the places where history happened. The cause that connects us to our diverse pasts, weaving a multi-cultural nation together. The cause that transforms communities from places where we live into places that we love. As the leading voice for preservation, we are the cause for people saving places.Our mission is to protect significant places representing our diverse cultural experience by taking direct action and inspiring broad public support.Where is my donation going?More than 90% of all funds raised will support the cities' projects and the National Trust’s ongoing work to save historic places in Los Angeles and around the country. Up to 10% will cover Indiegogo costs and processing fees as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.When will I get my perk (non-ticket)?Perks will be delivered later this summer (July/August).Can I visit the project site? Yes! You can visit the Triforium at Fletcher Bowron Square. Thanks to supporters like you, everyone will be able to see it in its full glory soon enough!When will the project be complete?Saving places takes time! But with your generous support, we hope to get the Triforium project completed as soon as possible.How do I get support for my project? Or can I submit a project for consideration?We at the National Trust are always interested in hearing about what is important to you. Although we may not be able to save it immediately, you can always contact your state’s historic preservation office and see how you can get started on the road to preservation!Is the National Trust involved in other restoration projects?Yes! We’re the country’s leading advocate for saving historic places. As such, we’re on the ground in communities across the nation. Visit our website to explore other historic places that we are trying to save like Los Angeles' Triforium.Media Inquiries:For further media inquiries about these projects, check out our Press Center.My question wasn’t answered above. Who can I contact?First, please see the full FAQ for the Cities Project.If you have questions about the projects or how to claim perks other than tickets, please email cities@savingplaces.org.If you have questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email  fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com.If you have questions about the Cities Project, please email corporaterelations@heinekenusa.com.

story:
SMASH SEASON IS UPON US

 Smash Friday is the new Black Friday!

Have a lot of stuff to buy the day after Thanksgiving? Everyone loves stuff! But you know what else they love? Smashing stuff! It's gonna get thrown away eventually - so smash it now! (Not your stuff, we have other stuff to smash.)

Also, Black Friday is what you name a day where something serious happened, not a day of buying screens and toasters. Nothing against toast or videos, but oh never mind, JUST SMASH SOMETHING!

In the Smash Truck, we've got eye protection, gloves, soundtrack, steel pipes and baseball bats, and stuff to SMASH! We'll gear folks up and cheer them on as they smash the ever-lovin' crap out of screens, appliances, and other stuff past its planned obsolescence expiration date.

We can even take a youfie (it's a selfie that someone else takes of you, like in the old days - see if you can help get the trend going) with a holiday card cutout so it can be printed from one's own phone - wow!  Mid-tech!

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We need money to cover truck rental, gas for driving around to pick up smashables, dumping costs, and food for the crew! (And beer when we're done!)

BUT WAIT, THERE'S LESS!

What you get is a resin cast gem made with stuff that's been smashed -- effin cool!

CAN WE SMASH STUFF NOW?

AND -- huge thanks for BIG Reuse, the Gowanus-based environmental non-profit, for a lot of the smashables! They're great people doing a great service. www.bigreuse.org

story:
The Coru Cathubodua is a Celtic Polytheist Priesthood dedicated to the Morrígan and honoring the family of Celtic Gods. We work hard to serve our communities through pastoral care, ritual services, community gatherings, activism, and education. We're a polytheist church with IRS-approved 501c3 nonprofit status. Our annual fundraising campaign is your opportunity to support living polytheist devotion by contributing to fund the work that we do, and also get some great backer rewards to enrich your practice and grace your home!

Each year, the dedicated priests of the Coru Cathubodua Priesthood pour our hearts and souls into service to our communities. We build safe, sacred, inclusive community spaces and gatherings where we can provide spiritual support to Pagans and Polytheists. We work to bring the Temple of the Morrígan to community; we run A Hosting at the Morrígan’s Hearth, our gathering for Celtic polytheists, and we work all year round to be of service to our communities through pastoral care, ritual services, activism, and education. The consecrated spaces, the lovingly built shrines, the numinous rituals of devotion, the work of community support  - we are honored to be of service in bringing these offerings to you.

But we need your help to make all this possible.

Our operating costs are significant - especially the cost of renting the spaces for community events like the Morrígan’s Hearth and providing hospitality at our Temple Weekend. You can help bring this work to life in 2020!

Your backing will allow us to pay for the many forms of hospitality that we offer to all devotees and Gods at events like our Morrigan’s Hearth Gathering. We are looking to fund the hospitality costs associated with our Temple Weekend and the Morrígan’s Hearth Gathering - providing the Gathering with the financial stability to offer more scholarship spaces, comp or pay its presenters, and ensure we have everything we need to provide a safe and nourishing experience for participants. Since we are an IRS-approved 501c3, parts of your contributions to this fundraiser are tax-deductible. You can read all the budget specifics about our goals down below.

 

Our Backer Rewards

To inspire your support, we have some great perks available - and just for fun, we’ve named our perk tiers after heroes of Celtic tradition who inspire us. We think everyone can find something here to be excited about: enamel pins, patches, and jewelry to wear, devotional and magical charms, art to display, tools for your polytheist practice and more. Plus, to support our Morrígan’s Hearth Gathering, we’re offering pre-sales of tickets and cabin reservations. Coru Priests, Hearth members and community have gathered our creative efforts to offer these gifts to our honored backers, and we hope you find them inspirational. We can’t wait to share them with you!

Cathubodua Enamel Pins: For this year’s fundraiser we’re creating a brand new enamel pin design in honor of our namesake, the Gaulish battle goddess Cathubodua, depicting Her in vulture form with a Celtic shield design.

Coru Raven Patches: This year we will have a lovely new woven patch, featuring our raven insignia in honor of the Morrígan in bold red and black.  

Coru Priesthood’s Book of Practice: This Book of Practice is our core manual for the Celtic Polytheist devotional tradition practiced by our priesthood. For people seeking guidance to creating a devotional relationship with the Great Queen and other Irish or Celtic Gods, this short book provides a philosophical, ethical, and ritual grounding. For the first time ever, we're making it available in a printed hard copy as a backer perk in this campaign!

Skilled divination sessions with the Coru: One of our professional diviners will help you in a 30 minute divination session conducted via phone or video conferencing. You’ll be able to choose your preferred diviner from among the priests of the Coru to help you with your questions.

Morrigan's Hearth Tickets:

Your ticket to A Hosting at the Morrígan's Hearth, our annual Celtic polytheist devotional retreat, including tent cabin accommodation. This ticket gets you in at the early-bird rate of $130 - plus it comes with extra goodies you won't get if you wait and buy your ticket when registration opens to the public.

You can also grab a package of tickets for four, including your own 4-person tent cabin reserved for your group. This pass is valued at $520 (at the early-bird rate of $130 per person x4) PLUS extra backer goodies come with it,  so grabbing your tickets through this campaign saves you a bundle.

Magical Soaps and Devotional Candles from Samhain Crafts: 

Turn shower into ritual... Samhain Crafts offers their signature “Cleanse & Protect” soap, made from luxurious and moisturizing organic coconut, olive, and castor oils, witch-crafted with cedarwood, rosemary, thyme, and lime essential oils, and dried nettle leaves. A potent blend for cleansing, protection, and strength. You’ll receive three 4oz bars.

Our beautiful consecrated devotional candles will feature illuminated manuscript style art with a translation of the Morrígan's Peace Prophecy, for use as a devotional prayer, along with our raven insignia on the back.

Magical Saining Sprays from Moon & Spear: 

This potent saining spray is prepared by a skilled priest and contains consecrated water, spirits, herbs, and prayers. Use it to cleanse, protect, and refresh - dispersing and clearing unwanted energies and spirits around your space or yourself.

Ogham Charm Pendants from Brennos Agrocunos:

Hand-carved from oak, polished and detailed with loving care by Brennos Agrocunos, these oblong pendants feel silky to the touch. They measure about 2.5-3" long, and will feature your choice of Ogham inscription for Badb, Macha or the Dagda.

Celtic Polytheist Meditation Beads & Rosaries from Banshee Arts: 

Meditation beads and Celtic polytheist rosaries feature beads of glass, bone, and metal, complemented by larger corvid-head charms or reliquaries. We love using these sacred tools to structure devotional prayer recitations and meditation practices.

Magnets & Metal Prints from Wolf Mercury Photography:

Magnets are in a set of four featuring gorgeous Irish landscape images by Wolf Mercury Photography. Magnets feature a beautiful print wrapped around a metal shell, pressed on to a magnet. 

Metal prints are a new art medium that infuses images directly into specially coated 8” by 12” metal sheets, giving the images a magical luminescence. Choose from four gorgeous Irish landscape images. 

 

Budget

Our primary goal funds the base costs of this year’s Temple of the Morrígan, plus the 501(c)3 filing. At Stretch Goal 1 we’ll be able to cover 50% of base costs for the Morrígan’s Hearth Gathering, and Stretch Goal 2 will bring that to 100%. This is our fifth annual fundraiser and with our history of success, we’re confident that with your participation, we’ll be able to meet all these goals.

Since we are an IRS-approved 501c3, parts of your contributions to this fundraiser are tax-deductible.

 

Primary Goal

  • Temple Weekend $875.00
  • 50% Morrigan's Hearth Gathering $3,750.00
  • Backer rewards & shipping $1,400.00
  • Campaign fees $550.00
  • Goal $6,575.00

 

Stretch Goal 1

  • 25% Morrigan's Hearth Gathering $1,875.00
  • Backer rewards & shipping $575.00
  • Campaign fees $225.00
  • Goal: $2,675.00 | Total: $9,250.00

 

Stretch Goal 2

  • 25% Morrigan's Hearth Gathering $1,875.00
  • Backer rewards & shipping $575.00
  • Campaign fees $225.00
  • Goal: $2,675.00 | Total: $11,925.00

 

Join us in service and devotion!

If you’ve ever enjoyed celebrating the Gods in the Temple of the Morrígan, or if you've valued the community spaces we’ve created and the work that we do, this is your opportunity to participate directly. Or, if you aren’t an attendee at our events directly, but still wish to support living polytheist devotion, we welcome your support and hope that our backer gifts will help make that support worth your while.

We, the Coru Cathubodua Priesthood, are honored to serve and look forward to another year of rich devotion and community service with the many communities and kinships of Paganism and Polytheism in their love and devotion of the Morrígan and the family of Celtic Gods.

Please back this campaign today and help bring us bring this work to life in 2020. And please share this link and tell your friends!

In Her service,

The Coru Cathubodua Priesthood

story:
Senegal is celebrating 20 years of capoeira with an event that aims to bring practitioners from all over the world to commemorate an Afro-Brazilian martial art flourishing in West Africa that has supported social development and perpetuated this global black artistic heritage.

Capoeira is an Afro-Brazilian martial art comprised of elements of dance, combat, music, playfulness, trickery, acrobatics and camaraderie. It was developed by enslaved Africans and Afro-Brazilians under conditions of oppression as a way to build community, to maintain a sense of their African traditions and at times was used to free themselves from enslavement. Today, capoeira is practiced all over the world by people devoted to continuing the powerful legacy of those early martial artists.

Hundreds of years after its creation, capoeira schools began to emerge in West Africa in the 1990s, often from the same sites from which Africans were captured and sent off to American colonies like Brazil. Senegal is home to one of the most prominent capoeira schools in West Africa today, and also the historical slave port of Gorée Island. Moctar Ndiaye, a native of the island, created a capoeira group 20 years ago that has trained thousands of children (some disenfranchised) and adults to institutionalize this cultural tool for the betterment of the country.

The generosity of your funding will go to the travel and lodging of those capoeira practitioners in West and Central Africa so that they may travel to Dakar, Senegal to attend the event. Many of those we hope to fund are former students of the founder Moctar Ndiaye, who have since become advanced students and are now teaching students in their respective countries throughout the region.

story:
Departure

Kültürhane was opened a year ago by the dismissed university professors with the objective of offering their books to students of all ages and a public space for all those who have a word or message to share. In the middle of geography of deep despair, we managed to flourish hopes in all those who have respired the spirit of resistance and insistence of all shared their feelings and positions in this modest house of hope.

Thanks to the generous of our friends from all around the globe, we could start off confidently and we kept that confidence all along the way until now since we never felt alone.

On the Road

We have held more than a hundred meetings on a great variety of subjects from human rights to gender, from literature to cinema, from cycling to sailing and etc.

We broadcasted most of them on internet and let them reach to thousands of people all around the world.

We appeal for further solidarity from you to enhance this spirit of mutual hopefulness by being able to host a wider scope of friends and experts to let them share their word for the general public.

Horizons

Most of the above-mentioned gatherings were organized by the participation of our friends or of those who were in town for other purposes and expressed the courtesy to spare time for a meeting in Kültürhane since we lacked resources to invite participants and organize premeditated events. Most of these meetings could be thus announced in the last minute lacking an announced program .

This year we wish to offer at least a monthly program by scheduling the meetings beforehand. For this purpose we need a ad hoc funding since the place is running on the limit by only auto-financing its daily functioning. Moreover, organization of social events decrease the ordinary turnover since we stop the kitchen and the coffee machines not to disturb the event.

Wouldn't it be nice if we had a modest budget to spend for travel and accomodation expenses of our visitors so that we can determine the annual program of socio-cultural events of our House of Hope?

How?

We hold two or three events per week and we need approximately $150 to finance the travel and hotel expenses of our visitors. If we can finance an event per week thanks to your solidarity we can host about 50 events from fall to summer. 

We would need also $1000 to print the montly bulletin.

So what?

We see all these events as seeds of hope since they encourage us to come together and find new sources of hope and ressistance. So the more we have of these seeds, the more we are ressilient and hopeful.

In short, we invite you to become one of the gardeners of this land of hope

Wouldn't it be nice if we had a modest budget to spend for travel and accomodation expenses of our visitors so that we can determine the annual program of socio-cultural events of our House of Hope?
How?
We hold two or three events per week and we need approximately $150 to finance the travel and hotel expenses of our visitors. If we can finance an event per week thanks to your solidarity we can host about 50 events from fall to summer. 
We would need also $1000 to print the montly bulletin.
So what?
We see all these events as seeds of hope since they encourage us to come together and find new sources of hope and ressistance. So the more we have of these seeds, the more we are ressilient and hopeful.
In short, we invite you to become one of the gardeners of this land of hope

story:
Help Creative Suitland become a vibrant arts center for the greater Suitland community. 

 

So what exactly is Creative Suitland?

Creative Suitland Arts Center, a project by Joe’s Movement Emporium in partnership with the Revenue Authority of Prince George’s County, Maryland, seeks to work with residents and neighboring businesses to define the cultural and creative spirit of Greater Suitland, which includes the central Prince George’s County communities of Suitland, Coral Hills, Silver Hill, Forestville, Capitol Heights, District Heights, Camp Springs, Hillcrest Heights, Marlow Heights, & Temple Hills.

Essentially, Creative Suitland Arts Center is a cultural hub for the community to gather, learn, have fun, and express themselves through art. Creatives and community members are invited to collaborate and develop cultural programs, including exhibits, public art, performance series, and murals to reflect the talents and perspectives of local artists and cultural groups in Greater Suitland.

 

What will your contribution support?

Your contribution will help put the finishing touches on the newly-renovated space at Creative Suitland Arts Center. While we are now up and running, it’s still a work in progress. Any contributions and donations will help us purchase up-to-date technology for our theater and other creative spaces, including mirrors for two dance studios, and equipment for other performing and visual arts classes.

More specifically, funds will be used to achieve the following goals:                                                       Goal #1: Purchase specialized production equipment for the Theater:                                                     -LED lights, digital sound board, speakers and monitors, and microphones                                         -Curtains and dressing room gear to match the generous donation of chairs from local business DPI                             

Goal #2: Purchase mirrors, sound systems, and other furniture for the two large performing arts studios

Goal #3: Hire tech staff and studio managers to support artists using our Theater and studios

 

Based on our discussions with community members, Creative Suitland Arts Center intends to provide the following programs and activities:

ARTIST PARTNERS:

· Support artists to develop a creative, entrepreneurial businesses

· Shared and independent spaces to teach, rehearse, create, and present

· Opportunities to collaborate with members of the Greater Suitland community

· Professional development opportunities

 

COMMUNITY MEMBERSHIP:

· Become a monthly sustaining member - just like NPR - but with a real space to get your culture on!

· Special members-only events and receptions

· Access to rent performance or studio space at a discount

· One free class, workshop or performance pass per month

 

THEATER PERFORMANCE SERIES:

· Weekly theater, music, poetry, and dance performances--and more!

· Monthly Hip Hop Poetry Jam with Dialect Prince George’s

· Stage time for Suitland High School CVPA students

 

ARTS EDUCATION PROGRAMS:

· Arts learning opportunities for young people, from toddlers to high schoolers

· After school programs

· Summer camps

· School partnerships

 

WEEKLY CLASSES AND WORKSHOPS FOR ADULTS AND YOUTH:

· Sip and Sew with Sew Creative Lounge

· Dance and movement classes

· Creative workshops taught by local professional artists and our artist partners

 

COMMUNITY EVENTS

· Thrive Market: an indoor holistic wellness experience in collaboration with the Capital Market of 20743.Art exhibitions, artist talks and panel discussions.

· Creative placemaking projects to enhance neighborhoods in the Greater Suitland area.

story:
The Bill Monroe Museum is the only one of its kind. 

While museums, musicians, halls of fame, and entire genres pay tribute to Bill Monroe, the Bill Monroe Museum will house his complete legacy. Telling the entire story of his life and musical career just feet from where Bill used to play baseball before performing for the crowds! There will even be stories and facts that have, until now, remained family stories tucked away in the hills of Rosine. 

"It means the world! It gives people a chance now to come from all over the world to see my father's museum." -- James Monroe

Construction in Rosine is underway. Urgent need for furnishings!

The building itself is paid for and construction has begun just across the street from the famous Rosine Barn Jamboree. The groundbreaking ceremony on May 22nd hosted some bluegrass music greats and announced that the Bill Monroe Museum will come to fruition! However, all that is certain is the building itself. 

The County has paid for the 'shell' but the museum needs much more than a roof! Displays, lighting, cases, furniture, a theater, and much more are still needed before the museum can open. This campaign is what will give the Bill Monroe Museum its character and flair. Many things are planned; an interactive timeline of Bill's life, a theater, multiple dedicated exhibit areas, but nothing is guaranteed. Your contributions will give the Bill Monroe Museum the future it deserves!

History is being made in Rosine, KY and you can directly influence its timeline and the degree to which we honor the legacy of Bill Monroe and bluegrass history. 

Your tax-deductible donation.

The Ohio County Tourism Commission is a quasi-government organization and all contributions are tax deductible. You will receive a charitable receipt immediately upon your donation! If you'd like to give directly (recommended for large contributions) visit our website's donate page.

"One thing I’ve learned about the Bluegrass Community is that we are a tight-knit family. That’s why we are asking the Bluegrass Family to be a part of building a home for the legacy of the Father of Bluegrass.” - Jody Flener, Ohio County Tourism Commission Executive Director

Our Goal and How It's Used

Our goal is $300K. This amount will allow for a very basic build-out of the museum. The funds will enable the purchase of:

  • A security system to protect the building and items inside
  • Furniture for the welcome area and conference room
  • Directional lighting fixtures for lighting of exhibits
  • Display cases for items
  • Restoration on many of the items to be displayed (some items will cost many thousands of dollars to restore)
  • Framing for hanging art and memorabilia 
  • Preservation of sensitive items 
  • An interactive timeline of Bill's life
  • Various placards and informational signs
  • Design of info-boards and displays

Some donations used for specific items

There are special items in our list that require specific funding. The funding of these perks will determine if those specific items end up happening! Like the mandolins made from wood taken from Jerusalem Ridge and the Homeplace itself or the welcome theater... If no one funds those perks, they won't happen!

What happens with additional funds

While the goal is $300K, this will truly only allow for a basic museum so DON'T STOP THERE! When the goal is reached and we start gaining additional funds, that's when we can start making the museum GREAT! Additional funds will allow for:

  • Restoration of more items
  • Production of videos recording never-before-shared Monroe family stories and documenting the lesser-known life of Bill Monroe
  • Acquisition of some extremely rare items
  • Upgraded security 
  • Curated exhibits
  • Humidity and temperature controlled display cases for instruments like the Jerusalem Ridge Mandolins
  • If we reach $1M an auditorium seating 750 will be built onto the museum to host live concerts and performances!

The Perks

The perks list is long because there is something for every lover of bluegrass! We also have some special perks in the works so it will be important for you to check back often and watch the Museum Website for special, limited offers!

Digital Packages

If you want behind-the-scenes access and exclusive content, then the digital packages are for you. The VIP package will have TONS of content and even a video of a trip to one of the largest private Bill Monroe collections in existence. 

Blue Moon Walkway Bricks

The walkway leading up to the museum and around the statue of Bill Monroe will be made of bricks featuring the immortalized sentiment of bluegrass fans everywhere! Get a small or large brick with your custom message to be laid in this historic walkway!

"When news of this project first hit, my wife and I quickly purchased our brick for the Blue Moon Walkway. As part of the bluegrass community, we are proud of this project and proud to have a tangible connection to this project." -- Chris Joslin, Executive Director of the International Bluegrass Museum in Owensboro, KY

Founders Packages

Includes an official founder plaque set on cedar taken from the original siding of the Bill Monroe Homeplace, a certificate awarding citizenship of Bill Monroe's hometown of Rosine, and much more! The top levels are able to dedicate the 3 exhibit display areas and one lucky person will name the welcome theater!

Ribbon Cutting Package

While the ribbon cutting ceremony itself will open to the public, there will be a private tour and reveal for the bluegrass elite. Names likely to attend are James Monroe, Ronnie Reno, Dale McCoury, Larry Sparks, and more. Founders receiving the Ribbon Cutting Package will have an all-expenses-paid trip for two to Rosine, KY to make sure they don't miss it! Those founders who dedicated or named parts of the museum will be able to present them personally. After the ceremony, attend a private dinner and jam session with the bluegrass elite. 

For more detail on the perks, see the perks page on the museum website.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe a contribution isn't in the cards for you and that's okay! You can still help out in a very large way by helping us spread the word. There will even be a special reward for the person who raises the most funds via sharing! 

  • If you manage or have access to an email list, send a link to this campaign along with a statement of why this museum is important to you.
  • Use the Share buttons on this site and share on social media. Your contribution via shares is automatically tracked and can win you an extra reward!
  • Tell all of your friends. If you can't direct them to this page, just tell them to visit www.BillMonroeMuseum.com
  • Want to give directly via check? Visit our website's donate page

story:
I haven't been back to my hometown of San Diego since I played in Jantastic two years ago. I would love the opportunity to play derby in my hometown for my family! 

 

About myself- 

I skate for TXRD - The original banked roller derby. It is our 17th year of operation in Austin, Texas. I am co-captain of the Rhinestone Cowgirls, was voted rookie of the year, and voted onto the All-Scar Army. I began skating with Dublin Roller Derby in Ireland and have skated with Texas United Roller Derby, and occasionally play some flat track.  

This invite to play Jantastic is an absolute dream. I really would love the opportunity to play in my hometown for my family to see! 

Here is a breakdown of costs for the tournament- 

Buy in: $35 
Jersey: $20 
Flights: $200
Food/Accommodation: $200
Transportation:$45

Total= $500 

What I Need & What You Get

  • Every dollar will go to my costs to get to San Diego for the Tournament.
  • I have a lot of unique perks! Including custom patches and banked track derby lessons!

story:
Breve Resumen 

Soy profesor titular de la U. de los Andes de Venezuela, en derecho y ciencias políticas, desde 1965. Publicó una veintena de libros y muchos artículos en revistas y folletos. Se anexa listado

Como ahora no hay recursos para publicar, utilizar las redes (Facebook y blog) que se puede consultar libremente. Pero en muchos medios académicos se prefiere el texto escrito.

Al participar en esta campaña, los colaboradores para mantener el nivel de la Universidad, divulgar las ideas y los conocimientos y garantizar el derecho a la libertad de expresión. En última instancia, a salvar nuestra cultura, gravemente amenazada ahora mismo.     

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Están listos para publicar 6 libros (sobre temas jurídicos, políticos, históricos y sociales). De ellos, 3  este año y los demás el próximo año.

El costo de la publicación de los 6 libros es de $ 10,000. La venta de los libros no cubre ese monto. La inflación que sufre el país obliga a subsidiar a los compradores (en este caso estudiantes y académicos). La publicación se hará en Venezuela, para contribuir a mantener nuestra industria gráfica, seriamente afectada por la crisis. 

Los libros se publican en la medida en que se recauden los fondos. De manera similar, se se distribuyen los beneficios.

Los colaboradores de más de $25 recibirán los primeros tres libros publicados. Los de más de $ 50 los 6 libros publicados. Quienes colaboren con  mas de $100 (y así lo autorizan) serán mencionados al final del texto de cada uno de los libros    

 El impacto

La campaña me permite cumplir con mis tareas como profesor. Pero, permitir la Universidad cumplir con uno de sus finos: proyectos e ideas en la comunidad. Ya lo antes antes, pero no lo puedes hacer ahora, por falta de recursos.

En tiempo de crisis, solo se puede usar las cosas básicas, como las referidas a la alimentación y la salud. Es comprensible y necesario. Pero también se debe atender a otras necesidades del ser humano (como la educación y la cultura). No solo de pan vive el hombre

Hoy existe un consenso general en señalar que un cierto nivel de desarrollo cultural es indispensable para el desarrollo económico y social. Más aún, expertos en el tema señalan que la diferencia en el nivel de educación y cultura marca la diferencia entre los países (mucho más que otro factor).

¡De allí la importancia de los libros!         

Riesgos y desafíos

Es necesario que los posibles colaboradores entiendan que las necesidades no hijo solo materiales; que, también importantes son las cosas derivadas de la condición dual del ser humano.

Por eso, se debe insistir durante la campaña en las ventajas que se puede obtener con el desarrollo de la educación y la cultura. Y se debe mostrar el ejemplo de otros países del mundo. 

A través de los medios de comunicación y de las redes se pueden difundir estas ideas. Y también a través de contactos personales      

 Puedes ayudar de otras formas

 Pedimos a quienes no pueden colaborar con los recursos económicos que difunden los propósitos y características de esta campaña. Eso también es muy útil    

 

  ANEXO : CURRICULUM VITAE Y OBRAS PUBLICADAS

 

                          JESUS RONDON NUCETE – CURRICULUM VITAE

 

Tovar (Estado Mérida),  20 de junio de 1.941.

ESTUDIOS

1.      Facultad de Derecho de la Universidad de Los Andes, Mérida (1.959 ‑1.964). Título de Abogado otorgado el l de agosto de 1.964 (con mención Suma cum Laude).

2.      Entrenamiento Gerencial de Administración Municipal en la Universidad Sur de California (1.964). Diploma.

3.      Curso de Doctorado en Derecho Constitucional y Ciencias Políti­cas en la Universidad de París (1.969 ‑1.971). Diploma.

4.      Sesión de Enseñanza de la Academia de Derecho Internacional de La Haya (1.970). Diploma.

ENSEÑANZA

Profesor (de pre y postgrado) de la Facultad de Ciencias Jurídicas y Políticas de la Universidad de Los Andes (Mérida), desde 1.965, en las Cátedras: Ciencias Políticas, Derecho Constitucional, Regímenes Políticos Contemporáneos y Políticas Públicas. Profesor invitado en cursos de postgrado de las Facultades de Arquitectura y Arte y de Ciencias Económicas y Sociales de la misma Universidad.

Conferencista invitado en Universidades de Venezuela, Colombia y Puerto Rico, así como en otras instituciones públicas y privadas.

FUNCIONES PUBLICAS

         1.      Concejal del Distrito Libertador del Estado Mérida (1.964 ‑ 1.969).

2.      Diputado a la Asamblea Legislativa del Estado Mérida (1.964 ­-1.969).

3.      Diputado al Congreso de la República por el Estado Mérida (1.969 -1.974).

         4.      Director General del Ministerio de Justicia (1.972 ‑1.974).

5.      Presidente del Concejo Municipal del Distrito Libertador del Es­tado Mérida (1.979 ‑1.984).

6.      Gobernador del Estado Mérida: electo en 1990 (período 1990 ‑1993) y reelecto en 1992 (período 1993 -1996)

 

MISCELÁNEA 

  1.    Presidente de la Fundación Universidad de Los Andes (1.986 ‑1992).
  2.    Fundador de varias instituciones académicas, culturales, científicas             económicas y sociales.
  3.    Miembro de varias instituciones. Ha recibido premios y diversas condecoraciones y distinciones. Reconocimiento especial de las Academias Nacionales de la Lengua y de la Historia por la creación de la Red de Centros Culturales del Estado Mérida y el establecimiento del Programa de las Escuelas Integrales.  

 

JESUS RONDON NUCETE  -  OBRAS  PUBLICADAS

 

LIBROS (10):

 

1

ACONTECER DE MÉRIDA. 

Pról. de Germán Briceño Ferrigni.  Caracas, Editorial Arte, 1977. 165  p.

 

 

 

2

HISTORIA DE COPEI EN MÉRIDA. 

Pról. de Rafael Caldera. Mérida, l988. 250 p.

 

Premio Nacional de Concurso promovido en 1986

 

3

TEORÍA JURÍDICA DEL PODER CONSTITUYENTE. 

Mérida, Universidad de los Andes, 2000. 159 p. 

 

 

4

PRIMEROS AÑOS DEL GOMECISMO.

Pref. de Carlos Chalbaud Zerpa. Mérida, Universidad de los Andes, 2003. 211 p. 

 

5

PUEBLOS EN LA HISTORIA. EL VALLE DEL MOCOTÍES.

Pról. de Alfonso Ramírez Díaz. Mérida, Talleres Gráficos Universitarios, 2007. 145 p.

 

6

ANTONIO SPINETI DINI. ECO DE SU TIEMPO.

Pról. de Lubio Cardozo. Mérida, Universidad de los Andes, 2008. 260 p.

 

7

LA CONSOLIDACIÓN DEL GOMECISMO.

Mérida, Universidad de los Andes, 2009. 214 p.

 

Cien años del gomecismo

8

LOS ALUMNOS DE LA ANTIGUA UNIVERSIDAD DE MÉRIDA.

Mérida, Universidad de los Andes, 2012. 116 p.

 

9

LA CAMPAÑA ADMIRABLE. 1813.

Mérida, Universidad de los Andes, 2014. 117 p.

 

Bicentenario de la Campaña Admirable

 

 

10

AMÉRICA LATINA: EN LA MAÑANA DEL CAMINO.

Mérida, Universidad de los Andes, 2014. 139 p.

 

Feria Internacional del Libro. Puerto Rico

 

MONOGRAFIAS (9):

 

1

LAS ELECCIONES PRIMARIAS PRESIDENCIALES.

Caracas, Editorial Arte, 1976. 55  p.

 

Premio de Investigación de la Asociación de Profesores de la  ULA. 1976

2

ORÍGENES DEL MOVIMIENTO SINDICAL DE MÉRIDA  (1894 – 1959). 

Pról. de J. Mendoza Angulo. Mérida, Imprenta Oficial, l986. 107  p.
